We were going to go here for dinner but it was just too loud and had too much going on for a newborn so we decided to go here for lunch which was perfect for us - it was not crowded or loud and we got great service. The staff was so friendly and they told us about their sister restaurant The House Brasserie which we are going to check out tonight.

I LOVE this place. My mouth is watering just thinking about those tacos!

Let me start by saying the atmosphere, food and cocktails are fabulous.   My one star rating is due to the poor judgment of management and customer service.  Which for me makes or brakes a place.  
I had hear a lot of great things about The Mission, so a friend and I finally decided to give it a try.  It was a Friday night, the place was packed, we decided to sit at the bar, have a drink and order some appetizers.  While sitting there another single woman at the bar started talking to us along with 2 couples that were waiting to be seated for dinner.  So the group of newly found friends (7 total), all started talking, laughing and enjoying ourselves.  
Just a side note, there was a TV on in the bar, with a football game, music (current upbeat) being piped in through the bar and restaurant, the crowd was about at an average decimal level for a Friday evening, packed place with a TV and music in the background.
After laughing at one of the many topics of conversation that our new friends brought to the table, the bartender came over to our group and gave us a "shhhh" using his hands in a "lower the volume" motion.   I asked "did someone complain about us being to loud" (I was shocked)  he motioned over to his manager, who about a half hour earlier came over to welcome us and we raved to him about the food and atmosphere.  
Another side note, I am a 49 year old woman, raised well, from Scottsdale, have been in the service industry and know how to "behave" in an establishment.
I was so insulted, as were our other new friends, we all asked for our bills and cashed out, to the bartenders surprise.
As I was leaving, I asked to see the Manger, Tom is his name.  He came over, I asked if any of the patrons had complained about the volume of our conversation, he said "no but several were looking your way as you were all laughing"......   REALLY?!!!!!
Not only did I explain that he made a very poor choice in having the bartender do his dirty work and ask us to lower our voices, but the fact that no one complained, and that the restaurant was loud and as I looked around the majority of the patrons were laughing and having a good time, gave me cause to believe that he had no right to embarrass us as he did.  
Tom never apologized, got very defensive and rude to both myself and my friend.  I will admit that there may have been 30 seconds to 1 minute when 7 people were laughing and clapping hands at the topic of conversation, but in no way were we causing a scene or making spectacle of ourselves.
I hope Tom and the owner of The Mission read this review and remember the old saying "a happy patron will tell 3 people, an unhappy patron will tell dozens"......
DONE!!!!!!!

Six of us had dinner, the atmosphere and service were terrific.  All of our meals were only so-so.  Portions were small for the guys and there weren't rave reviews on the seasoning of the meat.  My fish tacos were good but didn't expect battered and fried (never thought to read that closely).  Surprise after all the rave reviews and the price that it wasn't over the top.

My husband and I came here for a date night. It is pretty loud on the inside on a Saturday night and there is a more laid back feel on the patio . We decided to sit on the patio since there was immediate seating. The atmosphere was really nice they had some casual chill music playing and the fireplace made it serene. The service was great and great recommendations were given. If you don't enjoy the culinary arts I really don't recommend you come here, the portions are small but full of amazing flavor . The drinks were also delicious. The location of the restaurant is perfect for a long stroll through old town Scottsdale after a decadent meal.
I have been here 5 or 6 times. The service is phenomenal and I always try something different. Every dish has been a joy to my mouth. Well worth the time and cost.

Had an amazing meal here. The Pork Belly Pibil appetizer was superb. My husband & I shared it but next time I will get my own! We each ordered tacos - the butternut squash and the Brussel sprouts one. Both very good. For dessert, I had the fried bananas. They were good but a little too much pastry vs banana. I would give it 5 stars for the food, but I knocked it down to 4 because of the darkness of the restaurant. It was way too dark to the point we had to use the flashlight on our phones to read the menu and to even see our food! You could tell everyone was struggling to see. Completely unnecessary and distracted from fully enjoying my meal.

This place has always been on my list of places to eat. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. Some people might view this as not a deal breaker but it is to me: sitting elbow to elbow with someone on each side of me, who are complete strangers is not okay. The second they sat myself and my date down, I knew it was all down hill. Worst seating I have ever experienced. 

The food was subpar, nothing to rave about. I got the skirt steak tacos, boring. The tostada appetizer, boring. Black bean purée, boring. All and all, the food was bland, tasteless, and way over priced for what it is. 

Not worth a trip there again.

There literally is not one thing on the menu that you won't like.  The servers are amazing. The bev choice is amazing and the vibe is amazing.  Its a little pricier than I would like but absolutely worth it.  Breakfast here is unreal!  Sunday all you can eat pork for $16!!! Can't beat that.  Take it easy on the fantasma!  ITS HOT!!

atmosphere is wonderful- the service and the food are OK. We went in for drinks and appetizers last weekend. Nothing out of the ordinary-ciabatta bread, shrimp cocktail.I guess its a good place to bring out of town guests.

We LOVE the mission.  It is one of our favorite places to go for guac and sangria.

That being said - yesterdays experience could not have been more disappointing.  We were seated outside - which was great.  20 minutes between when we were seated and when someone actually spoke to us.  5 minutes later, the water arrives.  At that point a DIFFERENT waitress then our own comes up and can sense our being annoyed and very nicely asks if she can help.  She takes our drink order.  10 more minutes go by and she again comes up and says "no one has brought you your drinks"...to which we say no, and finally several minutes later our regular waitress comes up with the drinks (we are now over 30 minutes into this ordeal) and smiles and acts like nothing has happened.  I overheard two other tables complaining of the same - it was 3 in the afternoon - its not like they were overly busy!  Outside tables were full in the front of the restaurant but about 40% full inside and outback.

So as we were frustrated, we discussed how one of the unfornate things about YELP is that managers of restaurants are not given the opportunity to fix things at the time of the event.  So we talk to the manager and let him (BRYAN ADAMS) what has transpired.  He appologizes and says he wants to do something for us.  We say that isnt really necessary, as that is not the point of the complaint.  He insists, and says he will speak to our server and adjust our bill.  We proceed to pay the unadjusted bill when it arrives because just like our server, he does NOTHING about this.  

Note to the mission....when you are paying $12 for a bowl of guac, no matter how good it is, people are going to stop coming if you cant get it right.  The only saving grace for the MIssion yesterday was the younger friendlier waitress that seemed to care more than the waitress or the manager.

The first few times we came to this location, everything was great! The fish dishes were all excellent, and the show stopper was always the filet.

However, we came here Mother's Day brunch and had a completely different and disappointing experience. Service was horrible. It was extremely slow, unable to answer questions, and rude. To top it all off, we were furious that they charged us something like $8 for each bowl of chips and salsa at the table. We had a big group and basically each couple paid $8. This didn't include guacamole. It was just for chips and salsa, which had been free the first 100 times I've come here! The server really rang us up a bill. 

I also don't like how dark & loud this location is. It's hard to see the menu and hard to have a conversation. 

The Mission in Kierland is much nicer and we have never had any problems there. I won't be back to this location.

I LOVE this place!  I used to come here at least 2x a week, now that I live further away I'm not there as often as I like, but whenever I get the chance I'm here!   This place is impeccable!  The ambiance is gorgeous!  The food is delectable, and the staff is superb!  Brian (the owner?)  always comes by the tables to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.  Mike (the bartender) always remembers what I order, even when it's been quite a while!  I really just can't rave enough about this place!  Every time I have a special event (or just want some good food or drinks!) This is where I'll be!

The ambiance is great...I'll give it that.

Service, however, was full court press, and yeah i understand that they are trying to turn over tables but when I am paying a final tab of $100+ for 3 petite taco plates and 2 cocktails (me and my date) i expect a bit more than food artistry.

Frankly, great concept by way of decor...but a bit too pretentious for my taste. Its a place to 'be seen' and to impress someone with but not particularly cozy nor intimate..i.e. if you go for more than dim lighting.

I certainly would go back but with adjusted expectations.

Nice decoration and lighting. The outdoor sittings is beautiful too. The food is delicious. Must try The salads and tacos. They have the best margaritas in all Scottsdale. The service is excellent. Their servers are well trained. The manager checks on the customers occasionally. I'd def go back and recommend it to all.
Warning even though yelp says Mission closes at 11PM on Thursday the kitchen closes at 10PM.

First time visit here. We enjoyed the Margaritas and the appetizer Pozole, which contained some complex flavors. Unfortunately I thought my pork shoulder was fairly dry and lacked overall flavor. My girlfriend's Snapper also was fairly dry and lacked much flavor. We were both underwhelmed for the pretty pricey dishes. We decided we'd go back for the Margaritas and appetizers skipping the expensive dinner.

Discovered this fun place while on vacation. The ambiance is cool. Drinks were good. We started with the table side guac and chicken tostadas. We had the pork tacos for 2. They were good except the handmade tortillas were very greasy. It's like they brushed them with oil which is unnecessary. Service was a bit slow. Overall pretty good meal.

At least I finally went and have a review written before it hits 100.  Some things just take time.  

That said, we attended the Pig Roast on a Sunday Afternoon.  The pork was really tender.  The little tortillas we so cute!  Loved all the little itty bitty condiments to daintily spoon on your mini tacos.  It was fun to do as something different and out of the ordinary.  As a huge bonus, wine by the bottle was  1/2 price!!  Who~Hoo!!

Loved the sexy & romantic décor.  Nice and cozy, just right (as Goldilocks said).  Their brunch menu looks cool, but I am not big into breakfast.  The regular menu prices did seem fairly high, so I am not sure I would come back for Din~Dins, but I would love to re-visit, and sit at the intimate bar for a Sunday where there is drink specials and of course to take advantage of their fabby wine prices.

The Mission is one of the best restaurants in Old Scottsdale. The Street Corn and Clam stew are the perfect lite meal as are the tacos. The Mission Bitter Bee is one of best cocktails in the Valley with fresh grapefruit & lime juices. The service was efficient but not rushed and the table location was exactly as requested. It's our favorite for out of town visitors but allow a few extra minutes to find a parking spot at peak times.

The guacamole is outstanding as are the street tacos.  The tequila flights and margaritas were also good. The overall atmosphere is nice.  There is a bar as well as seating areas.  The outside patio is probably the best place to sit.

I was drawn to this Yelp page by a highlighted review that said "medium priced" so I went to their yuppie-shmuppie, faux-mexican, overpriced menu.  I remembered the slogan of the now defunct Karem's from my childhood in San Antonio:  "Mexican food don't cost nuthin".

Read these reviews and if faus gras empanadas and watermelon basil mojitos appeal to you, go for it.  I am going to La Canasta or Los Dos Molinos.

It is kind of interesting to see the contrast in reviews based on where a person lives. If you're from AZ then chances are you find this place to be just okay. If you're from say the Midwest you'll find this place to be incredible. As Mexican food goes it is alright in my book. The atmosphere is what makes this place a three star review because the food is not the best. The table side guacamole is good, but the tacos are blah. The tacos are smaller than street tacos and the taste ranges from blah to okay. 

Come here for the atmosphere, drinks, and guacamole. This is a once a year spot for us locals who know good Mexican food.

Absolutely the best food, service and presentation I have ever experienced!   I live on the East Coast, travel weekly and experienced many restaurants across this country.  The Mission tops them all in every way.   Hope to return to Phoenix very soon.
They have super tasty guacamole = absolutely delicious!

The Mission is incredible! The first time I went I ordered chicken tacos, I thought they were a little pricey, especially when I saw the size... TOTALLY worth every penny! AMAZING! Their drinks are super delicious, Blood Orange Margarita is my favorite!

I have come to Scottsdale for several years to see some spring training games, shop and eat a few good meals.  We have made this restaurant a stop because of their excellent chips and guacamole, despite the loud and crowded atmosphere - it is a scene.  

Having said this, we cancelled our 6:15 reservation this year because for the second year in a row they called us to confirm our dining time (no problem there) to also tell us that there is an 8pm reservation for our table afterwards!!! This is tacky and insulting to immediately let us know BEFORE WE HAVE EVEN SET FOOT in the place  that there is a time limit on our meal; and having the pressure of knowing we better not linger already ruined our experience!

I live in San Francisco where dining out is a way of life and no establishment would ever pull this crap on their patrons - basically putting the onus on us to manage their table turnover - ridiculous!!!!  Maybe the Mission should put egg timers in the shape of avocados on each table, and when the alarm goes off, the customer has to spit out the food in his mouth and  immediately hand over his credit card and flee the premises!

There are too many really good restaurants in Scottsdale to spend my money at a place that is so arrogant and treats their customers like robots.

We won't be returning, not even for the great chips and guacamole.

the BEST hands down. i always am asking for xmas/bday giftcards to here! all of it is great, the food/drinks/service/environment. this was the first place i ate at when i was apartment browsing about 2 years ago and ill never forget it. the butternut squash tacos, margaritas and other cocktails, tableside homemade guac (YUM), street corn. all of it = amazing. the menu is awesome. I always bring people here who are visiting from out of town. i love the romantic back patio and the cozy bar atmosphere inside is perfect too so no matter where you choose to sit its a win/win. highly recommend reservations however one friday night we didn't and lucked out with a small corner table at the bar which was perfect! the chef here is amazing and knows what he is doing. never had a bad meal here and can't wait to go back soon!

I really like The Mission.  My second trip here for lunch and it didn't disappoint.  

We had a larger group with us this time but everyone loved their meal.  The guacamole is outstanding, we ordered two this time because it's so good.  Chips are fresh and the salsa has a wonderful tomato puree base with a medium heat.  Chicken Anticuchos were a big hit, I didn't try them but everyone at the table gave them rave reviews.  I had the butternut squash tacos, I love these the flavor is incredible.  Husband tried the Cuban sandwich this time and thought it was excellent, another at our table tried the brisket sandwich - also giving rave reviews.  One person ordered the pozole and everyone went nuts for it!

I also ordered a side of the white bean puree - if you even just kind of like beans, try this it is so delicious!!  I could have ordered three sides of this as my meal. I gave everyone a taste and I could see them waiting to pounce if I left a speck in my bowl.

There is a public lot across the street which makes parking a breeze.  The ambiance is nice, big bar with TV's, tight tables with dim lighting in the interior restaurant, nice patio seating out front.  Service has been excellent both times but the hostess staff is similar to the interior lighting - dim.

My next move is to go at night for dinner and try some margaritas.

My leadership team and I had dinner at Mission last night. It was a great experience overall. The food was excellent and arrived very quickly. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The ambiance was great. We enjoyed the street corn, table side guacamole, black bean purée, Florida grouper and pork tacos. Oh, and the pumpkin bread pudding was just divine. Cole was our waiter and he was so very professional. I recommend this restaurant to anyone...it's definitely worth the money.

Excellent guacamole served table side. Avocado margarita unique and worth checking out. I got the skirt steak tacos which were delicious. My husband had the grouper - a little in the dry side. Overall a great meal!
Great food but felt overpriced when we got the bill.  We shared several appetizers and a drink each (2 couples) and it ended up being about $60/couple.

I love this restaurant! I have never ordered anything that wasn't yummy. Some of my favorites: Almejas Al Vapor, Pork Shoulder Tacos, Crispy Pork Belly. The restaurant  is very cozy, especially the front patio by the fire in the winter. The service is friendly and professional. Eat here!

Took guests to the Mission the other night, and that's always risky.....just when you have hyped some place up.....that's when the service or something will be off, BUT NOT THE MISSION.  It was, AGAIN, a wonderful experience in every way.  The tacos, jicama salad, and guacamole were fresh, flavorful, and delicious.  They had a nice selection of Malbec, too.  We celebrated a birthday and they brought out a sweet dessert, chocolate churros......with a sparkler to liven it up.   Nice touch.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Best guacamole I've ever had! Fresh, delicious, quite frankly amazing! The margaritas were very good, too. The rest of the food (chicken and steak tacos) were good, but nothing spectacular and a bit pricey. Atmosphere is lively and hip, the service was excellent. I would go back for the drinks and apps next time.

The Mission does everything well.  From their creative cocktail menu to the table-side guacamole to the short ribs its all delicious.  There are a lot of options depending on how hungry you are and the Sunday Pig Roast is a great value.  The fried banana dessert is unreal.

Best Mexican food ever created. Don't worry about the prices, your tastebuds will thank you later.

Came here my first night back in Scottsdale in a few years. The place was buzzing; we waited fifteen minutes in the gorgeous front patio area with a couple of over-priced Stella Artois. We were soon escorted to our table on the back patio.

The place was decorated beautifully and with southwestern class. Dress to impress here, but also don't fret if you're wearing shorts and a collared shirt; everyone is welcome here.

We began with table-side guacamole, which was prepared with ease and efficiency. Made with some heat to our liking; we finished it before our entrees. My girlfriend and I shared the pork shoulder tacos, which came highly recommended, with a habeñero pineapple sauce, and small dishes of chopped onions, shredded cheese, and cilantro to add to the mix. 

Handmade corn tortillas served on a hot Himalayan salt block, absolutely exquisite. 

The do-not-miss side dish we ordered was the Peruvian Street Corn, (offered on, or off-the-cob) which came with a lime wedge to squeeze over the top. Incredible complex flavors of sweet, tangy, and savory. We started adding it to our tacos and wow, we were blown away.

For dessert we shared the pumpkin bread pudding which came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and served warm; a great way to end our meal. 

Our service was a little scattered, only because the place was slammed. However the food was some seriously inspired cuisine, with flavors hitting every desirable note imaginable. 

I'd come back again and highly recommend this place to anyone willing to spend $75+ on an unbelievable meal for two.
The chicken tacos and the table side Guacamole were great! This is definitely the place to go for Mexican food on this side of town. Make sure to make a reservation early--they book up fast!

I had the pleasure of dining in old town Scottsdale at Mission.  Very quaint and modern Latin.  The food was quite yummy, I had the tostadas before my maui maui tacos and fresh guac and chips oh yeah and sweet potato fries:) I had too!  Everything was fresh and delish and  I will definitely make it back for the pumpkin bread pudding dessert  I didn't have room for.  Mission is one of my new favorites!

Latin cuisine meets French with a twist. My husband and I are visiting Scottsdale all the way from Bed Stuy in Brooklyn and we were really pleased with both the service and quality of the cuisine we experienced at The Mission.

We started with the cheese plate and the duck confit empanadas. Both were good but the cheese plate stood out. They took something simple and elevated it with the addition of salty & spicy peanuts and rich honey which was absolutely marvelous.

For the main dishes we had the pork shoulder stuffed with chorizo and fresh made tortillas and the Grouper. The pork and chorizo was amazing but a little heavy so I think the portion could have easily been cut in half. The grouper was nice but the small crab cake that came with it melted in your mouth and outshined the fish.

For dessert we had French press coffee and churros. One word....YUM
Great dinner, ambiance and drinks.  Waiter Tim was awesome and the food did not disappoint. Pork tacos, halibut and table side guacamole. Sides of grits and corn!!!

The restaurant itself was way too dark as mentioned, however the service was very good. The food had better then average flavor but the portions were laughably small considering the prices. I ordered the skirt steak tacos which was a snack sized plate that had 3 bite sized tacos. I also ordered a side of Poblano grits that again had good flavor however the portion was smaller then a cup of salsa. All-in-all a disappointing experience so I will not go here again. Taco Guild downtown is a far better meal with a more welcoming atmosphere.

This place lived up to the hype and then some. One of the best meals of my life was here. I can't recommend the pork shoulder tacos enough they are mouth watering. 

The table side guacamole is very good too but you should come just for the pork tacos.

Don't have too much to say except, every time I have been there for dinner and/or happy hour, it has been a positive experience. Good food, and comfortable atmosphere. Dimly lit (personal preference), which is a nice thing if you're on a romantic date, or have been sitting at a desk, in a brightly lit office all day! Never too crowded either. I truly appreciate that...  :-)

I recommend ordering and sharing a few of the starters. 

A couple of my favorites
Duck Carnitas Empanada: duck confit, foie gras, orange habanero glaze, oregano, mushroom & queso Oaxaca. So good!

Pork Belly Pibil: pork belly, roast garlic, black bean puree, pickled red onion, orange, oregano, achiote, avocado crema & banana habanero aoili - mmm... Tasty!

Great atmosphere, fairly intimate, a great date spot.

Some of the best tex mex I have had!  Don't miss this place when you are in Scottsdale.

If you visit or live in the Scottsdale, Tempe, or Phoenix area, do not miss this culinary delight! I am a big fan of high-end Latin American fusion cuisine, and this place did not disappoint. We started with the tableside guacamole, and gorditas. These left our mouths watering and begging for more. When It came time for entrées, we settled on the grouper, the braised short ribs, and the mahi-mahi tacos. Each dish was exquisitely crafted, artistically presented, and tasted like a little bit of heaven on the palate.  We tried a range of cocktails: from the jalapeño-cucumber margarita to the strawberry lime mojito, and each one was spectacular! To top it off, the service was great (ask for Kyle). If I lived here, I think I would have to take out a second job to fund coming here every week...

Sat in the bar, this was just ok.  We had some tacos, fresh guacamole and street corn.  They don't have any happy hour drink prices which is strange. The tacos were just ok, the guacamole was good and the corn was excellent. I would come back just for the corn. Otherwise it seemed a little pricey for the quantity and quality of drinks and food.

Just got back to this place after 18 months of being away. Both times the food was amazing!! The street corn is the perfect blend of spicy and butter. The primarita is a delicate balance of quality tequila and fresh lime. Table side guacamole is a must and the options are great. 

I had the torta with cheese,egg and white beans to make it vegetarian and it was moderately  flavorful. My co-diners enjoyed the chicken on a stick and skirt steak tacos and were not disappointed. The cheese plate is enough for 2 to fill up on. 

Beyond the food the ambiance is very lively. The music made everyone at the table consider dancing if we had been less sober. The staff is very friendly and the experience was great.

Absolutely outstanding visit to The Mission.  Dear friends from Toronto are visiting and we decided to take them there.  We weren't aware that one of our guests has major food allergies.  Adam our Server (and a Manager) is awesome and was so kind to her as he pointed out items she might be interested in and that he would speak to the Chef so her food would be prepared the way she could enjoy.  The table side guacamole is fabulous - LOVE those pumpkin seeds.  The service was marvelous and the food absolutely delicious.  To end the evening, Tom came over with an after dinner drink for us - 1921 - YUM!  We had never had it before - perfect ending to a perfect ending.  Thanks to Adam and Tom for making it so special.

I am a Concierge at a luxury residence club and recommend The Mission to many, many of our guests - they always come back and tell us what a wonderful experience they had.  After our experience this evening, I will continue to send our special guests to this special restaurant!

We stopped in to the Mission after a long day walking around Old Town Scottsdale. We were very pleased with the experience.

The restaurant was a bit slow when we arrived (early honestly), so the service was very attentive and helpful. I assume this is the same when busy, but don't know.

We had the Table-side guacamole with chips/salsa. It was smoky spicy and quite good. For dinner we chose the Skirt steak tacos and Short rib tacos. Both were good. We finished with the Pumpkin bread pudding, which was also very good.

Expensive for the food you get !  Our first time there our experience was ruined by a lady who I assumed was the manager.   She approached our table and told my son and husband to remove their baseball cap stated it was a restaurant policy.  No I 'm sorry or please ,"just you need to remove your caps" .  Very rude and unfriendly. Strangely enough 2 tables away there was another man with a baseball cap on and she did t say anything to him.  Then we saw at least 4 other guys enter the restaurant with caps on and again they weren't told to remove them.   I guess because she was sitting  two tables away with another couple she wanted to impress.   Makes you think why us!!  Discrimination ?   I will never return nor will I recommend this place to anyone.

This is definitely a hot spot in old town.  Very cool ecentric decor with candle lights, mirrors, salt brick wall, and chandeliers.  They are known for their pork so we started with the pork belly wraps which were excellent.  I ordered the Malbec shortrib which was juicy and flavorful.

We were here on a Tuesday date and all tables were full so make a reservation.  Great date spot.

Killer dining. Just awesome. We had the Duck Carnitas Empanada, the Braised Shortrib, and the Chorizo Porchetta. Wow. 

Also, absolutely stellar service by a gentleman whose name I cannot recall, but who wears glasses, has short black hair, and manages part time. 

This is such a great restaurant, so glad they are doing well. There are a lot of substandard Mexican/Latin restaurants in the Phoenix area. But The Mission is so good.  Highly recommend.
For brunch there is no surpassing this restaurant. The ambiance, food, staff at top notch.

The Mission is in the Old Town area of Scottsdale, about a block from most of the shops. The menu consists of modern twists to traditional Latin food. The tableside guacamole is great - right up with the best I've tasted. The margaritas, grilled street corn and butternut squash tacos were terrific. Can't recall what my husband ordered, but I remember he enjoyed his meal also. We both left with smiles on our faces.

Well. Good atmosphere and location. What we ordered was mediocre.  Leaning towards bland.  Flatiron steak and tortillas needed salt but none on the table.  No flavor really. Can get a better bunch of meat elsewhere.  Service was snotty. Overpriced and overhyped.

I've been to The Mission three times now. The first time was for lunch with my coworkers. Half the table got the Tecate Skirt Steak tacos for $10. I guess we didn't realize they were street tacos and so, so, so tiny my manager even took a picture to send to a friend as a joke. The taste was fine, but I wish the waitress had warned us the portion size was so small. 

I went back for brunch on a Sunday and had a much better experience. I had the Chorizo Scramble, which includes chipotle grits. I am in love with chipotle grits. They were incredibly creamy and flavorful. The portion size was very reasonable. There was a lot more food for $9 than the skirt steak tacos. I've been back for brunch and I really love it. 

They have a great front patio as well as a back patio. During the winter months it's great to sit outdoors. Next time I go I'll have to sit inside and see what the vibe is like in there. The abuelita hot chocolate with dulce de leche whipped cream is also a winner.
Lovely place, this is where we like to take out of town guests for local cuisine. Excellent drinks & ambiance, make a reservation in advance weekends are very busy!

Great ambiance as well as quality of food.  Everyone I have eaten with here has been thoroughly impressed.  

Be sure to do table side guacamole and do not hold back on the spicy.  Pork belly is also amazing.

The wife and I had reservations for our anniversary. We showed up at 6:30 for dinner. We sitted right away. We order some drinks and everything was off to a good start. The appetizers came with no issue ( guac tableside ) The food was good and the servie was top notch. The kitchen on the other hand took over an hr to get us our order items. The waitress should have informed a manager of our extended wait for our food. A visit from the manager would have been nice. Wasn't looking for anythign to be comp off the tab But it would have been nice to know that the kitchen was way behind. I would go back but for only drinks at the bar.

The service was excellent, the restaurant is beautiful, the salsa and table side guacamole were delicious, the food (well what both my mom and I ordered) is left to be desired. My mom ordered the mahi mahi tacos and I ordered the barbacoa tacos. Both were dripping with oil and just very greasy. I don't think I'll go back for that reason. Very disappointing as I had high hopes for this restaurant because of the great yelp reviews. Oh well, you don't know unless you try.

This marked our 2nd venture dining on Sunday Pork Tacos and we have loved it both times.  Great deal at $16 for all the pork tacos you can eat (until they run out).  Tecate in the can runs $2 on Sundays (fantastic).  Great food, atmosphere and service.

First time trying the guacamole.  Good Night!  Outstanding.  Literally, the best I've had be it in a restaurant or elsewhere.  Their chips and salsa are also excellent.  Get in try this place out.  One of our favorites.

Amazing variety of food with a Latin twist and for a very non-adventurous palate like mine, I was wonderfully surprised. The table side spicy quac and the Duck Tamales were fantastic and the Asada Filet was literally devoured by the table (shared). Parking is the only downside of the location (Kierland)

Excellent food, great ambiance.  Tried several dishes table side guacamole, chiorzo soup, corn soup, pork tacos & butternut squash tacos...all were excellent.  All food is prepared fresh, was told no "freezers" are used for storage.  Highly recommend.

Luckily my wife was with me or I would have given the mission 1 star based on my meal. 
I was served one of the worst meals I've ever ordered in a restaurant. 
I order a chicken entree from what I thought was a nice restaurant, not a pub. The server placed a large plate in front of me, it had a gigantic pile of fries and 4 pieces of chicken laid on top. The chicken was covered in a ketchup flavored BBQ sauce. That's it... It was comical that the chef actually thought of this meal. I wouldn't serve it to my 5 year old... 

My wife ordered the tacos and out of desperation I reached over and grabbed a taco. It was amazing! I couldn't believe the same restaurant would serve 2 completely different meals. I don't get it. 

Moral of my story is if you go to Mission which has a good ambiance and feel...just don't order the chicken entree!
And if the chef reads this, please take that off your menu.

Located in Old Town Scottsdale, AZ, The Mission is amazing. 

For starters, my partner & I ordered the duck confit empanada, which includes foie gras. Of course, being from California where this is outlawed I HAD to have some foie gras! This appetizer was amazing! I could have had seconds but who wants to be a little piggy? Not me!

Especially when their specialty is pork! 

Mmmm pork. Where do I start? I had the chorizo porchetta & my SO had the pork shoulder tacos. Both were melt in your mouth amazing. I finished off my entree & wanted to lick the plate clean! 

Having heard they are known for their Avocado Margaritas, I was intrigued. You may think WHAT? AVOCADO MARGARITA!??! Rest assured you MUST try one! They are very yummy... You can't taste the avo. It makes it creamy & a uniquely green goodness. 

The service was really really good. Our server was attentive & keen on making sure our drinks & food were served promptly. It was a fine dining experience that didn't feel pretentious. It felt casual and comfortable; the way I like my experience to be. 

I can assure you I will be returning to The Mission the next time I visit Scottsdale. Until then, I'll go back to dreaming about avocado margaritas.
Excellent food, good service, great ambiance outside (a little too dark for my liking inside). Would definitely eat here again.

My go-to for a nice dinner when I feel like a great craft cocktail but I don't feel like dressing up to the nine's. 

A must is the table-side guac!

Small, overpriced but tasty portions. 

5 stars for taste, ambiance, and one lady was really on top of water refills

- 1 star for price: the popular table side guacamole is $14?! Margaritas are $14-17?! I also saw on the menu a 22 oz ribeye for $85. Not even quality steakhouses charge that much. 

- 1 star for portion size: in regards to the prices above, the guacamole we were served barely went past the rim of the bowl. Not piled up like in the pictures. 3 tacos per order and each taco could be finished in 2 bites. 

-1 star for service: went on a Sunday night at 6:30 pm so understandably a bit busy. Took 5 min to get a refill of tortilla chips. After our main course was finished, waiter came by and recited items off the dessert menu. We asked to see the physical menu to see all the descriptions because we couldn't remember all that. Took 5 min to just give us the menu. 


Overall, great tasting food, but restaurant thinks it is more high-class than it actually is.

On a business trip and our hotel recommended the mission. It lived up to the hype, we had table side guacamole and salsa, then went for the torreados (I think I'm still sweating), and then got down on a brisket tortas which had a great blend of flavors. 
A little pricey for lunch though.

Came here last night, party of 7.  We all ordered different food from the chicken, to the swordfish the chorizo with potatoes as a side.  For dessert we had the churros and the pumpkin bread pudding It was all delicious!!  They also have many different types of Margarita drinks.   Ambiance was also very nice.  Make sure to make a reservation because the wait is VERY long.  The manager Andres was very accommodating.  Gracias Andres! You will not be disappointed.

Had the table side guac, pork shoulder tacos, roasted corn, and black bean side. All very good. At first I thought the pork taco serving was small for two people but once you add it to the small corn tortillas and other toppings its plenty. Service was excellent we were seated outside under a heat lamp and someone came over and placed a cloth napkin on the ground where my purse was to protect it. Drinks were my only disappointment but since this is based on personal preference I still gave 5 stars. The mojito mint was not muddled and the wine selections were limited. I tried three different drinks and none really wowed me but the food more than made up for it.

This place is AMAZING!!! It needs to have more than 5 stars!!! The restaurant is beautiful and the staff are wonderful! The margaritas were the best I have ever had, I ordered the jalapeño- cucumber. The guacamole is made right in front of you, and the pork shoulder tacos were the best I have ever had in my entire life! This is one of the top ten meals I have had in all of my life! I highly recommend going to this restaurant!!!!

Wow, where to begin? This place is incredible!  At the recommendation of our resort concierge and the high Yelp rating, we wanted to try The Mission.  This is not an American/Mexican or Tex-Mex restaurant so don't go in there thinking you are getting enchiladas and tamales. The food is more traditional Mexican or Central American but with twists. Let me begin with two things. First, get there early as the place gets busy and get a bit loud if you are inside. We sat on the rear patio at 5pm on a hot day but were quite comfortable.  Secondly, ask for Kate as your waitress.  She is a foodie, is passionate about the menu and will make great suggestions for you. Now the food.

It's seldom for me to eat somewhere where everything is incredible.  The table side guacamole, perfectly cooked chips, entrees, tortillas, dessert, and coffees were all superb. The guacamole is so fresh, make sure you get the shredded cheese and pumpkin seeds on top. They add a nuance to the appetizer that I hadn't had before. As others have posted pics I won't add mine.  We ordered the Marinated Jidori Chicken and Chorizo Porchetta for the main dishes.  My wife's chicken was amazing with wonderful spices overtopped a lightly cheese blended rice.  The roasted chicken was fork tender.  Each part of the dish would stand alone but together they make the dish even bigger, flavor wise. The Porchetta was unlike anything I've had. The house made chorizo is stuffed inside pork shoulder and roasted over pecan and mesquite until it falls apart. The herbs and slices make this a truly unique dish. There is an earthy flavor to the meat with no indication of what type of meat it actually is. I just savored each bite.  I am still thinking about it the next day.  The white bean purée was a wonderful as a stand alone or as a dip for the meat.  I also ordered a side of tortillas which came out atop a warmed salt block.  The were flaky with a perfect body for rounding up all the bits and pieces.  

For dessert we orders the pumpkin bread pudding and, again, were amazed. This is the best bread pudding I've ever had.  It is served warm with a large scoop of ice cream.  There is a scotch syrup reduction in the bottom of the bowl that well compliments the bread.  Be sure to take your first bite without the ice cream so you can really taste all the spices.  The French press coffee is some of the smoothest I've had.  It is a Guatemalan bean with little acid and a full body. Sit and savor it with your dessert.  

Don't miss this place and on our next Scottsdale adventure we will be back.

I would say terrible service, but I don't know if what we got could be considered service. It was open - we came in- were greeted friendly enough... We asked to sit outside. The hostess gave us menus, a young man brought water then they immediately forgot about us. Oh don't be mistaken the Waterboy came back outside but he paid us no attention, and a man who I believe might've been the manager even stepped outside and smiled at my husband, but no one came to ask us if we wanted to cocktail or if perhaps we were ready to order to eat. We kept trying to get their attention and then thought... enough is enough. Customers should never have to work so hard to get waited on. Will never go back or recommend.

The Mission: It's not Mexican, its Latin, related to be sure but also entirely different.

The Mission is located in Old Town Scottsdale, and is situated between the old Spanish style church and the black smith shop for you old school Scottsdale folk. If you're looking for a great place to take out of towners for some refined Latin style cooking, and a taste of Old Town Scottsdale this restaurant really can't be beat.

It's one of the few places that still do fresh Guacamole tableside that you can have mild, spicy or hot. I recommend the hot, as it's how I prepare my Guac at home. Mike the bartender is quickly gaining a following as a specialist in "spicy" margaritas, but make no mistake Mike is a true mixologist and takes his craft very seriously. Mike will usually have two frozen margaritas on tap at any given time and one version will usually be spicy. I've had the habanero, pear & ginger (yes that's right), watermelon and the spicy mango. All are awesome. Ask for a sample. Mike also has other cocktails and non frozen margs always on hand.

The chips and salsa are done in house the salsa is great and has a wonderful smokiness to it. If you want some additional dimension to your chips and salsa ask for the additional salsas that usually have on hand for the asking. It's worth asking for it as they are wonderfully prepared and add another flavor depth to your culinary experience.  However you will need ask specially for the ghost chilies salsa, and its hot, hot stuff comprade so please be careful. In India they use ghost chilies to keep elephants away if you catch my drift.

 I really love the Sunday afternoon pork taco all you can eat special. They roast a couple of pigs on property and serve until the pig is gone. The pork shoulder and the carnitas will rock your world with fresh made little corn tortillas. Its "Delicioso" as Jimmy Dean would say. You can also order the pork as entrees if you're not there Sunday or just want an entrée; however the pork shoulder can't be beat as it explodes off the bone. 

I had the Almegas Al Vapor which is Peruvian seafood soup. This blew me away and wonderfully balanced with a light creamy broth and very unique flavors. The soup is not over powered by the seafood and the whole bowl is nicely done and makes for a great tasting dish just to expand your culinary diversity. The other side order I have to recommend is the street corn. The corn is sweet, wonderfully spiced and makes for a wonderful addition to any meal.  While I haven't had them I hear the sweet potato fries are pretty stellar as well.

Two desserts that can't be missed are the pumpkin bread pudding and the espresso churros. The pumpkin bread pudding is made from scratch down to the caramel sauce. It's great even if you don't like bread pudding, try it. The other desert I really liked is the espresso churros with little chocolate milkshakes. It's a great dish for out of towners that may be a little reserved with food that they are not normally accustomed to.

The Mission is a small restaurant, so make sure to book reservations during the high season and most of all enjoy la dolce far niente.

Staff was great, loved the patio, tasty pineapple ginger mojito, and short ribs had a lot going on!  Jenna was very knowledgeable about the menu and owner Brian stopped by and made sure we left more than satisfied.

This restaurant is WOW! Their home made chips were delicious! The salsa was awesome! It was so good that I bought a big container to bring home. They made mean margarita. It was so good. I haven't mention the most important dish yet. Their pull pork taco was most delicious taco I ever taste. If you are at this restaurant, you have to try the taco.
Food is excellent!!  I have been there over fifteen times and never had a meal that wasn't amazing.  You have to get the table-side guacamole, street corn and a Mission Margarita!
Amazing 12hr cooked pork with pineapple and habanero tacos.  Tableside guacamole was delicious as well.  Cool atmosphere too!  Recommend making a reservation.

Wonderful, visit each time I am in PHX, this was our 5th trip.  We had small plates this time and it was just right.  Of course we had the table side guacamole, it is fun and social, and pretty good.  I do prefer guacamole which has "rested" for an hour or so for the flavors to blend, but the ability customize at the table is fun.  Apps and tacos were very good.  Fish taco was favorite.

They seem to have lost some of their luster.  My steak was over cooked and the margaritas seemed to have very little liquor.  We had three each at 15.00 each and I did not even catch a buzz.  Along with the passive aggressive attitudes of the host, I'll spend my over $200.00 for two people elsewhere.   Too many great Restaurants in this town to chose from!

Ambience...amazing
Drinks...incredible
Food...out of this world good 
Service...Amber was our server and was probably one of the best wait staff I've ever seen.  She made the night even better.

Awesome upscale Mexican with super cocktails. Make sure to grab a reservation. We've been to town twice and they always seem to be packed, even on weeknights. Try the aguacate margarita and table side guacamole!

What can I say...This place has it all! From the ambiance, service, food, and drinks! They serve up the BEST guacamole table side as you choose what you would like put in it and how spicy you would like it. The Pork Belly Pibil is a signature dish that many of my friends have recommended and is the Grilled Street Corn (One of my favorites!) and Green Chile Duck Confit. If you like dessert you def have to try the pumpkin cake with vanilla ice cream! I sometimes go here just for that!
The food was good, expensive for what you get.  The building looks like the Alamo.  If Pee Wee Herman lost his bike here, he'd have to hawk it to pay for dinner and drinks.

The Mission is so beautiful and authentic looking from the outside. Inside, it's "shabby chic" meets St. Mary's Basilica with votive candles burning, crystal chandeliers and whitewashed furnishings.  There are interesting and unusual seating areas throughout the dining room.  My favorite - tables near a cozy fireplace in the front courtyard - so comfortable and inviting.  The patio, where we sat was quiet and comfortable as well.  This place gets six stars for ambiance.

Service was top notch too, Tony served us and others filled in when he got pulled to another table.  The tequila and wine selection was large and varied.  We started with a few signature margaritas and mojitos.  The prices seemed reasonable based on the portion sizes we saw being distributed around the room. The menu is small but filled with interesting options from the standards to the sublime.

We began with the obligatory guacamole, made table side, and an order of Mexican street corn.  Both were uniquely flavored with unexpected ingredients (who puts pumpkin seeds in guacamole?!? - I will from now on!).  

We were already getting filled up on the great chips and mole-like sauce they put on the table so we kept it light and ordered tacos for our main courses, short rib, skirt steak, mahi mahi on top of small hand made corn tortillas - loved them all.  We ordered a few sides too - papetes with chorizo and chipotle grits (unbelievable flavor and texture!).  We finished our meal with the pumpkin bread pudding and coffee, beautifully served in a French press. The bread pudding was good but in my opinion, the only part of the meal that didn't excel.

I will tell all my friends about The Mission, any trip to Scottsdale should include a visit.

Used to come here all the time, and we came for my bachelorette and had a really disappointing experience. Arrived early, ended up waiting 20 mins past our reservation time for a table and were made to feel like it was our fault, when they clearly forgot about our reservation and were scrambling to get us seated. Then, my girlfriend went to the bathroom and saw the hostess crying because her manager was yelling at her for not seating our table fast enough. Really weird experience. Not supportive of abusing employees.
The food and service was awesome! Short ribs were amazing and the presentation of the food was very classy.
Delicious tacos and guacamole was amazing! Fun place to be but noise level was a little too loud for a conversation.

Let me break this down.

The company was a 6 star, but that's out of the subject. 

The food was on the uneventful side with some shining accents. The guacamole was good and they mix it at your table, which adds some charm to the deal. Also you can request more or less spiciness which was good too. the avocados weren't as ripe as I would like them, though.

The roast corn gorditas were really tasteful but a little shy on the huitlacoche and really small, specially for $9. 

I ordered the Chimmichurri Marinated Hanger Steak which description in the menu reads as follos: pan de bono + charred leek & scallion soubise + tomatillo salad. OK, the name and elaboration is for the presentation and for the price tag, I guess, but when it comes to flavor, it was more like an OK steak with some undetermined flavor. 

I guess the labeling takes an important place here. If you give a dish a name, like chimichurri and the person who tries it has never try it before, it might be really good. But when you're expecting something and they deliver something else is kind of deceitful.

BTW the grilled street corn was pretty good!

The wine was good. We had the tempranillo Coto (I believe that was the name) and it was really good and inexpensive. I also tried the house melbac (courtesy of a really nice friend of mine :) and it was pretty good as well.

The decor is nice but there are a couple of things that I didn't like. The lightning is super dark, like in I-can't-read-the-menu-dark. The upper walls (where the ac vents are) looks dirty and stained. It might be that it was so dark that it was painting or something else, but it looks dirty to me.

The men's room has just one stall and one urinal. I guess the place was built before the new rules and so on, but more toilet space would be appreciated.

I would go back but I might lower my expectations next time. And I'll make sure that I have awesome company (like this time) because that really helps!
Trendy & good vibes. Only stopped in for a few apps ( Guac and pork belly - REALLY good) and drinks ( sangria - yum). Great service and def a place to check out!

Love the ambience of The Mission. When you walk in, take notice of the Himalaya salt brick wall and the beautiful chandeliers, giving this place a modern-gothic vibe. 

Now let's talk about the food. We started with the table side guacamole and crispy pork & cola lime glaze. The crispy pork was amazing. Literally one of the best dishes I've had. It is basically a lettuce wrap with pork and peanut sauce but the pork is what makes this dish so outstanding. The texture is soft but has some bite to it. It's both sweet and salty. Everyone at our table couldn't stop talking about it. It's really hard to put into words but this is a must-have when you come here.

I ordered the shaved kale salad, Almejas Al Vapor (Peruvian clam/seafood stew), and pork belly aibil. The kale salad was really good. The kale's finely chopped and the blood orange gave it a burst of sweetness. The Almejas Al Vapor was good but nothing memorable. The pork belly aibil was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor. What made this dish stand out was the skin -- really crispy and melted in my mouth. 

The next time I'm in Scottsdale, I'm coming here for the pork dishes, especially the crispy pork!
Excellent flavors!  Be sure to try the home made guacamole and the corn off the cob! Pair them with the skirt steak and your palate will thank you!  Save room for pumpkin bread pudding!!!

Great Valentine dinner! Loved our sweet server Lexi who completely knew the extensive menu!! Duck empanadas were good- sweet, cheesy & not spicy. I love guacamole & don't usually order table side because I make my own at home all the time but we did order it and it was hands down the best I have ever had!! We had the guacamole guy add a hint of the ghost sauce & it was out of this world!! Chorizo pork was a good meat dish beautifully plated with a flaming sprig of rosemary. 
Margaritas were good and flavors were well balanced & described with perfection but pricey. Their wines selections are nice reserves. Unique ones including selections from Darioush. 

Beautiful atmosphere! Love the salt block wall back lit by kitchen, nice effect. The only disappointment is the very high price. It WAS nice and a lovely evening. But prices were very steep.
We will go back again someday & enjoy another night at the Mission. But not a regular stop at $200 a pop!

We rushed over to the Mission before they closed for the afternoon to have their tableside guacamole before leaving town. We had to sit in the very dark bar because patio seating was full, definitely felt like a monastery...

The bartender was great--knowledgeable and able. The chips and salsa were the best we've had in Scottsdale--house made thin sliced chips got and salty and smoky salsa. The guacamole was fine. Good texture--not too chunky--but could have used some flavor. Dipping it in the salsa made it perfect!

The Primarita margarita was very good, but too pricey at $13, in my opinion. $13 cocktails should be reserved for higher end than margaritas.

We went with another couple to The Mission and celebrated our anniversary. It was dark inside but wasn't stuffy or creepy. Our waiter was relaxed and helpful. He suggested the avocado margarita. Give it a shot--you just may want a refill (I did!).

We started with the delicious guac and shared a few small plates (our waiter was spot-on with his recommendations re: quantity). By far the best part of the night was the pork shoulder tacos. They were make your own with falling off the bone meat. We finished with pumpkin bread pudding.

Never rushed or harried, we had a great time and recommend going with a few people you can sample the dishes with. Make a reservation if you go during peak weekend hours.

Very cool place. The service is fantastic, the food was very good although pricey for what you get which is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. There is a time limit on how long you can be at your table so be aware of that. Overall it was worth trying for sure, just not sure if we would return due to the price and time limit on the table.

My wife and I went to The Mission tonight with some friends during our trip to Scottsdale, AZ, and we loved it! We ordered a sampling of nearly everything on the menu, and everything we ordered was wonderful.  

Some of our favorite dishes were - guacamole made at the table (medium spice), short rib tacos, mahi mahi tacos, pork belly appetizer, and bread pudding.

I had the avocado margarita and was pleasantly surprised that it was a really good margarita.  One of our friends ordered one of the tequila flights, and he said it was the best value he'd ever seen - 4 very nice samplings of tequila and great quality for a great price.

The decor was nice, and we were especially taken by the wall of Himalayan salt bricks.  It really is a sight to see with the lighting behind the bricks shining through. The one negative was that we were at a table with a HUGE painting sticking out from the wall that was a little intrusive, but it didn't ruin our meal by any means.

If you're ever in old town Scottsdale, I recommend you go to The Mission.  It's a good picture taking opportunity too with the mission building next door.
Wonderful dinner on the front patio.  Crystal was an absolute joy.  Food was outstanding.   A true gem in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale.

3/5 solid stars

I walked in with much higher expectations, but walked out a bit disappointed.

We ordered a bunch of dishes (since it was tapas) to share:
1) Savoy Spinach & Date Salad: 3/5 this sounded better than it tasted
2) Table-side Guacamole: 3/5 I enjoyed it but definitely pricey for what it was! 
3) Grilled Street Corn: 4/5 this was delicious--the kennels are off the corn already!
4) Pork Shoulder Taco: 3/5 eh, just okay. very blahhh taco for the price
5) Grilled Chicken Taco: 3/5 again, another eh, okay taco. Not the best I have had


Overall pricey for the quality of food. I was not impressed.

This was the best Mexican I've ever eaten! This is not like I'm used to in Midwest, salsa was spicy and thick tomatoes, we came for guac but that was actually only average in ny opinion. Margarita was amazing, not too sweet but just right. Split pork shoulder tacos with a buddy, fall apart pork with plenty of fixings! I can't wait to come back and bring my wife, little expensive but it was worth it in my opinion.

Great spot! This is our friends favorite spot in town and with their endorsement and yelp ratings, it did not disappoint. 
The table side guacamole is really great - don't let the size fool you, it's plenty for 2 or 3. 
I got he shrimp tacos, the breading was a little thicker than I expected but they were still good. Because we got the guacamole I didn't get a side and portion was just right.

I arranged a reservation for two persons at The Mission for a very special occasion well in advance. The food is excellent, the service was very good but the help at the front reservation greeting area need significant training. I was immediately greeted in a half empty restaurant by the statement that there was a limit of 2 and 1/2 hours that I could remain at the table. Really! 
Two people for dinner? How tactless! This will be my last time that I will frequent this restaurant that had been a favorite for over 6 years. Again, the desk help need serious training! Ideal for tourists who like to spend money and most likely will never return, but for us locals there are a number of exceptional alternative restaurants available that know how to great guests!

I enjoyed my first-time visit with family for a Saturday afternoon lunch. Loved the tableside guacamole. They use all fresh ingredients and don't overmash the avocados.

Taco platters are good portions. You get three tacos, all the size of small street tacos. The pork tacos were loaded with meat. They were a bit too sweet for me but I can appreciate that they would be fitting for someone who likes that style. The butternut squash tacos are good, but I recommend them as an appetizer. They were much smaller (in terms of filling) than the pork. 

This place is ideal for tequila lovers. The waiter told me they do tequila flights. But I opted for the blood orange margarita from their cocktail list. Their margaritas use all fresh squeezed juices. 

If you eat inside, be prepared to turn the flashlight app on your phone. While the interior has a relaxing, candlelit vibe, it is super dark, hence no food photos on this post! The interior has almost a gothic feel. I could almost imagine cob webs hanging from the chandeliers at Halloween! A fun place overall, and service is great, too!

Tried this Latin American spot with out-of-town guests for the first time this weekend and I definitely plan to return. The Mission would be a great place for date night; it's upscale without being pretentious, and the low-lighting, candles, and chandeliers provide a nice, sexy atmosphere. 

We started with the tableside guacamole, which was incredible! Flavorful and creamy, with a great smoky heat from the chipotle. Hands down beats all the other guacamole I've had in town - including Barrio Cafe's - and I'm quite the guac snob because I make a mean version of it myself. The drinks were great too, we just had a couple rounds of house margaritas which were refreshing and on the strong side, but I'm looking forward to trying other margaritas from their extensive drink menu upon my return. 

The staff was friendly, prompt, attractive, unobtrusive - pretty much everything I look for in servers. Service was a tad on the slow side, but that didn't bother me because I was enjoying the food and company and it was a Friday night after all. 

I had the fish tacos which were crunchy and inventive, and also a relatively normal-sized portion. I know I'm in the minority in our indulgent society, but I appreciate it when a plate of food arrives that doesn't overwhelm/disgust me with its sheer magnitude. One of my dinner companions had a pork dish and said it was the best cooked pork he'd had in a long time so I'm sure you can't go wrong with their pork dishes, either. 

I definitely recommend The Mission. It's not your traditional Mexican fare, but it's a great Latin American alternative when you're looking for something beyond your typical burrito, in a cozy, intimate environment.

This was our "splurge" dinner while on vacation over the holidays.  We picked The Mission after visiting the sister restaurant (House Brasserie) on the Scottsdale food tour earlier in the week.  The restaurant is beautiful, but the seating is a bit tight.  We enjoyed talking to the couple seated next to us, however, if you're looking for a more private dining experience this might not be the place for you. 

We started with the guacamole, prepared table side.  It was okay but the salsa was actually much better.  Dinner choices include typical meat/seafood entree dishes or tacos (3 small tacos).  My husband had the Malbec braised short ribs.  It was a very generous portion of meat served on a very minimal portion of a vegetable.  The menu indicated they were "crispy potatoes" but they looked and tasted more like a plantain. The tacos I ordered came as described - three small steak tacos.   As a side dish we had a ridiculously large order of mixed regular and sweet potato fries with two dipping sauces.  We ate less than 1/3 of them, in part because there were just too many and also because they were not as tasty as the rest of the food.  

I can't comment on the drinks, but the menu looked interesting.  The service was great.  Our waitress was very nice and helpful.  Our water and ice tea glasses were filled constantly.  Because of the proximity of tables I could not help but overhear the party next to us and their constant questions and demands of our server.  She handled them all politely and as patiently as she possibly could.  

Overall, I think this is a very solid choice and we would return to try some other dishes.  The service is outstanding

Amazing food, beautiful ambiance, great tequila selections.

My recommendations would be the pork belly pibil, pork belly lettuce cups or the duck empanada as an app. For main courses the flat iron steak or the chorizo porchetta is superb. Your welcome

I must have ordered the wrong thing! I do not get the ratings on this restaurant by what I ordered or the environment. I ordered the street tacos. The plate came and there was three piles of meat. It looked good but where are the tortillas?!? I was informed they were under the meat and about the size of a silver dollar, well maybe not that small but no more than three inches. No way you could pick it up and eat it like a taco. I asked and was told it was the chef's signature way of making tacos. Are you frigging kidding me!!! There was an ample amount of meat and it was good but put it on a damn tortilla big enough for me to pick it up and eat it like a taco!
On top of it I had to sit and listen to loud rap music. Really, rap music in a Mexican restaurant and it was not even Mexican rap. The place was dark, dungy and the wrong music to make me enjoy a Mexican meal. If just the food was bad I would try it again and order something else. But the whole package just did not work for me, there are better options out there in Phoenix.

Amazing food!  The butternut squash tacos were so delish. Also, the fried banana dessert is out of this world good. It tastes like churro covered bananas!! I'll definitely go back every time I'm in Scottsdale!

Came here for a nice dinner to change up the pace with all the bar food and baseball food in March in Scottsdale. Lol. It was a nice slightly upscale spot. Dimly lit with a good vibe and a good looking crowd. The guac was addictive and so were the mini tacos. Not a greasy gut bomb here, more of an upscale spot for some quality food.

I'm not sure how a place that has "loud" "energetic" and "vibrant" in almost every review decides that MY party was the loud one, but being threatened to be kicked out of a restaurant is not how my dinners usually go.

Yep. the food is good, if overpriced.

Yep, we had a couple of cocktails.

But we were seated in the BAR-clearly the noisiest part of the entire building and my friend was approached in the BATHROOM (really?) by the manager and told we needed to quiet down. Same manager came to our table a bit later and told us that he had received complaints about our noise level and that we needed to decide if we were going to quiet down and stay, or "shake hands and part friends right now". WOW-pretentious much???

If I'd had a gaggle of bubble-headed Scottsdale Barbies with me maybe I'd have no reason to make a complaint, but the youngest person in my "party" was 32 and the oldest 80...how noisy could we have been???

So, thanks for buzzkilling my birthday party.
Very decent Mexican restaurant. We enjoy sitting outside by the fireplace. The food is very delicious. I highly recommend the pork shoulder taco. The guacamole is also pretty tasty.
Service was great. Table side spicy guacamole was superb, just not a big enough portion! Tacos were tasty, the waiter recommended the Tecate Skirt Steak tacos.

Awesome Mexican in Scottsdale! The mahi mahi tacos were so good with the small tortillas. The tacos look tiny but were really filling. The fries are also a nice side to share. The yellow sauce that comes with the fries is really good and has a nice kick to it. Loved the decor and vibe. Didn't try any of their margaritas but they looked delicious.

The Mission has been a favorite of mine since it opened.  I had my Farewell to Scottsdale, Arizona brunch on April 27th, and it was very disappointing.  After we were seated at 11 a.m.,  ordered drinks, and were given menus; the waitress advised us upon taking our order that their fryer was broken, and wouldn't be repaired anytime soon, or at least while we were dining.  Really problematic for our party, as we were looking forward to splitting their fabulous french fries.  There was a rather dismissive apology by the waitress, then she advised us that any of the entrees that would normally require a fryer could be prepared as grilled. I really couldn't think of what that was on the menu, but I ended up ordering a couple of "safe" appetizers to split, and left disappointed. We also ordered chips and guacamole, and the chips were either from another establishment or yesterday's as they were stale and uninviting.  Not what you would want to pair with $12 tableside guac.   It was even more entertaining to watch the very large touristy family next to us who wandered in with 7 kids under the age of 12.  There was nada on the menu for these little ones to eat except a quesadilla I guess.  After they ordered, their waiter came back to their table to let them know that their whiny kids would be ordering something else besides french fries and empanadas.  Sort of a metaphor for me and Scottsdale as a whole, glad to be back in Cali.

Went for Sunday Brunch with my mom and sister to celebrate sister's birthday as she's always wanted to check this place out.  I called in advance to make reservations, but probably didn't need one as it was fairly empty when we arrived. It's really dark inside, but the beautiful chandeliers above our heads provided enough light for us to see our food. On Sundays (not sure if all day) they have a taco station where you can make yourself unlimited tacos for $17 per person. We also ordered their guacamole as recommended by our server which was so fresh and tasted so good; they make it right it front of you! Since we were there celebrating a birthday, they gave my sister a free pudding which was also very good! Everyone loved their meal here and the service we received.

The Duck Carnitas Empanada is absolutely INSANE. Seriously, just get it. Awesome food, great staff, cool spot. 

Seriously though, order that empanada like now.

Went here w/ a group of friends right before closing time, but the staff was still very friendly and willing to hang out late so we could eat. 

The table side guacamole is a MUST! I consider myself somewhat of a guac expert and I have never had it any better!  I thoroughly enjoyed the steak tacos. The meat had the most amazing flavor!

Primarita was a great, skinny margarita!

Service was slow and she was forgetful.  The food was so below what we expected.  We were shocked it was so busy. We ordered the street corn and guacamole. Probably the best things we ate there.  For dinner we had the short rib and the steak. Tough steak and pretty ordinary short ribs. Portion sizes are small. We would never go back. The only thing nice about the restaurant was the decor.

After 11 years of living in the valley, this remains one of my favorite restaurants. We're crazy about the table side guacamole and crispy-cola (pork belly) appetizers. For dinner, the duck confit never fails to impress. Their cocktails are delightful: Try one of their custom mules or margaritas! Don't miss this Old Town favorite!

If you are in need of a light meal, don't overlook the Pozole.  It is amazing, assuming you like the flavor of ham.  The little corn tortillas are perfect with this, and the guacamole.  Also, don't overlook the corn on the cob, street style.  Really yummy.

We also thought they make the best margaritas we'd had in a while.  Loved the ginger & cilantro one, and also loved the pink grapefruit, which was in the soft-serve freezer that they use instead of a blender for slushy margaritas.

The decor is very cool.

When I called for a reservation they said they couldn't seat us until late.  When we arrived many tables empty.  Not sure why ??   Booked online all time slots open.  

Food was good but overpriced.  Patio nothing special at all.

Had lunch here twice during Spring Training. Great service and delicious food on both occasions. Our server on the first day even offered me a linen napkin to set my purse down on the brick--that's a first! The guacamole which they make in front of you and ask how hot you'd like it is out of this world along with the lightest and freshest tortilla chips. Be sure to have the plantains with cinnamon ice cream for dessert, its worth the splurge in calories.
I was very impressed with how friendly and professional the wait staff is at The Mission Old Town. We really appreciated it.

Out of the hundreds of restaurants in Scottsdale, this one is my favorite. Great atmosphere, food, and drinks. Duck Empanada was absolutely delicious and you can get a side of foie gras for 5 bucks! Enough said, check it out!

Before Zeus damned Prometheus for giving mankind fire, he revealed another gift; a man that could show the world how to use it. That man is Chef Matt Carter. Part man -part titan, Matt Carter wields his otherworldly craft above all who stand before him, casting a shadow upon the culinary world. It is in the town of Scottsdale where you will find this man; working his magic - constantly revealing new cuisine and enlightening the pallets of those willing to take a pilgrimage. In his sanctuary, Matt Carter brings a taste of Mount Olympus to Prometheus' beloved creation.

By divine twist of fate I stumbled upon The Mission, Matt Carter's take on Latin cuisine. Having conquered dishes the world over, Carter set out on a quest to create the Latin experience in the Heart of Scottsdale, Arizona with a smashing success. Offering a variety of traditional food including Pozole (Mexico) and Anticuchos (Peru) one can literally travel Latin America in one restaurant. From Swordfish Veracruz to the Grilled Sweet Corn, and Braised Shortrib to the splendid array of tacos; The Mission's menu is one of shear cunning and beauty. Each dish is eloquently decorated to match the rich artistic heritage of our neighbors to the south, and carries with them an exquisite flavor leaving you yearning for more. Complimented with a drink selection that not only arouse the curiosity but accommodates those seeking their exotic escape, The Mission creates an experience all will remember.

To complete this unique tour of Latin America, The Mission takes you there with its authentic decor. To bask in the atmosphere of romance is what a trip to this restaurant  will provide. Its rustic ambiance whisks you away to a land rich in culture and decadence. It will truly show you the splendor of our American brothers and sisters.

So come one come all, The Mission promises the experience of a life time!
Very good food and ambiance! Order guacamole...Only downside is the table booths are very close to each other. Make reservations.

This is my absolute favorite restaurant. I don't live in AZ, but make it a priority to come in whenever I'm in town. The best margs (try the cucumber jalopeno for something different, or the primarita for a low Cal option). Literally THE best tablesixe guac you've ever had in your life. Try the butternut squash tacos. The corn side is sooo good, as is the cheesy Spanish rice. Literally cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. And the decor is fabulous-love the chandeliers. Wish I lived closer!

Excellent atmosphere!! Couldn't have pictured a better setting than the back patio where the breezes were welcoming and the twinkle lights under the tent were relaxing!

The tableside guacamole was good, not great.. lacked seasoning and definitely  not enough portion for a table of four... wish they would have suggested a double portion?? 

We all had the taco platters.. one chicken two steak, one pork... The pork  was definitely the best! Snack portions... So order extra appetizers, or plan on dessert.

The street side fired corn was amazing... Off the cob.  The cucumber jalapeño margarita was amazing -wish they had put a lot less ice in it however... Two sips and it was gone.

Definitely overpriced... Prices high, portions low... But I'd say the atmosphere makes that easier to handle.

The Mission is one of my favorite restaurants in town.  I have eaten there several times and the food is consistently excellent.  The street tacos for two that is served on a big rock salt block are particularly good.  Be aware that as of spring of 2015 this is one of the hot spots in town and you will likely need a reservation several days in advance.  There is a large flat parking lot across the street and a garage around the corner that is free.

It pains me to give this place 4 stars because the conchita pibil will change your life, but our service was *so* bad I can't give it the 5 stars the food merited.  Great food and inventive menu. Awesome drinks. Get the pork belly conchita pibil.

Three stars because the food is AMAZING but the experience... Meh. 

It starts off by us calling to see the wait. We are immediately put on hold for almost 4 minutes. The waits about 45 minutes which considering it's a Saturday in old town when all the snowbirds are coming back its not bad. We get there and are told at worst an hour... Totally fine. Until they never put our name in the system. 

My fiancé goes up after quite awhile to ask how close we are to being sat when the hostess shuffles papers and then says we can just be sat right now. Which is nice except the couple that just walked in an hour after us is being told the same exact thing. We could have sat much sooner. 

Then we get sat in the bar at a corner table where my fiancé is getting bumped into by the waitress, the guacamole table and other guests. 

I order a Diet Coke and my fiancé gets a gin and tonic. My Diet Coke is forgotten and we had to ask the food runner for it 10 minutes later. 

We had the wings and street corn for an appetizer both of which were incredible but then we finished and waited 25 more minutes for our actual meal. On top of that our table was so small it almost didn't fit what we ordered. 

Again the food really is so good. It's worth the long wait (if they don't forget to put you on the actual list), but when we spend over $100 on a meal for two we would hope for a much better experience.

Excellent guacamole but surprisingly that's about all this overhyped restaurant has to offer. Food was otherwise very bland. Not worth the money with so many other great Mexican restaurants in the area.

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. It was a first for the both of us. I highly recommend getting a reservation like we did if you are dining here on a weekend night. It gets very busy. We enjoyed a nice glass of wine at the bar as we were a little early. Our waiter was fantastic as he helped greatly with the menu.
