The corn was, in a word, amazing. My serving consisted of nearly an entire ear of corn, served as two skewers, each bathed in a luscious chili-laced butter sauce and lightly coated with more cotija cheese. Yum!

My husband's tacos were very good as well. They were served as three mini-tacos, each on a small, handmade tortilla. The proportion of filling to tortilla made them something you'd want to eat with a fork (like a small, not-fried, tostada) rather than try to pick up. The filling was well-seasoned and had a very good flavor.

I also had one of their house margaritas (on the rocks), and it was very well-made. You knew you were drinking tequila and not some cheap-o candy drink. Good flavor, with just the right amount of tartness.

Very glad we stopped here! We'll be repeat customers!

I'm glad I decided to try a few new places this past weekend because this place is refreshing. Not only did I get to enjoy a nicely decorated and well designed place but I also had the pleasure of enjoying the taste of Mexican food without the heaviness that usually is accompanied. The appetizer I started with was the guacamole which might I add was made fresh and table side exactly the way YOU want it. The customer service was wonderful which is something that can make or break a persons visit. So if your tired of the same 'ol heavy traditional Mexican food, you should definitely try this place I'm sure you will find yourself a new favorite Mexican restaurant.

Wow!  I don't write enough about the great places at which my wife and I eat, but this one CANNOT be dropped!  We're in town with friends for a little R&R when a chef at another restuarant, also excellent, suggested this place among 10 or so others.  This food is AWESOME!  We started with margaritas: she had the pear basil, I the Aguacate.  I thought hers was sweet but tasty; mine was out-of-the-ballpark fantastic.  So good, in fact, that my wife got a second margarita, an Aguacate.  It's loaded with avacado -- yes, avocado!  Weird, but really good!  You MUST try this one.  Then we went on to a grilled street corn appetizer.   Fantastic!  We had it off the cob (easier to share).  It had a sort of chipotle aioli, which I guess was the chile paprika, with butter, cilantro, and cotija.  Then came my brisket torta:  smoked brisket, habanero, barbeque, aji amarillo, coleslaw, yucca bread.  I love this place!  My wife had the butternut squash tacos -- and I really didn't think any non-vegetarian could get this excited about a vegetarian dish!  Superb!  We tried the sweet honey chipotle grits as a side, which I thought were too sweet, but interesting, and we tried the Mission fries, a mix of sweet and regular fries with seasoning, lime, and chipotle ketchup or aji amarillo.   The damages with all of the above (total 4 margaritas) came to $86.00, sans tip.  The service was wonderful -- thanks Simona!  Lots of other cool selections.  Had I room for more I would be telling you about dessert.  Until next time (tomorrow?), I continue to be your

Incognito Connossieur

If you go to the mission, you'll enjoy some great food and an elegant setting. I highly recommend getting the guacamole that they make fresh.

You must also be prepared to deal with the worst service in Scottsdale. The waiter asked me and a friend how we found out about the place, and he made us feel out of place. He also assumed that we were having trouble reading the menu because the quality of food was too good for our tastes.

This is fancier than your average Mexican food, but it is so delicious!! The outdoor seating is my favorite as the side patio is beautiful. Sit there if it's not too hot out and you can see Camelback mountain while you enjoy your meal.

Probably the best guacamole I've ever had and it was made to order table side. Simple ingredients, but incredibly tasty.  We also had Duck Carnitas Empanada: duck, foie gras, orange, habanero, oregano, mushroom, and queso oaxaca and pork shoulder tacos with a pineapple glaze served with handmade corn tortillas. The tortillas were placed on top of a large brick to keep them warm. We also enjoyed a side of fresh corn made with butter, chile paprika & cotija. It typically comes on the cob, but we made a special request to have it shaved.

Very hipster & trendy vibe.  Right up my alley.  What a great looking group of people dining at this awesome establishment, except none were Asian.  Yeah they're lacking with the Asians in Arizona.  At any rate, I can totally see Bobby Flay dining at this joint.
The food was amazing. Had the guacamole and the shrimp tacos. The pablano grits are amazing. I will definitely be back.

There are 800+ reviews at "The Mission" for a legit reason, the place is really good.
You can come here casually and chill on the patio or go inside for a more classy, intimate environment. This restaurant truly provides an amazingly tasty experience and from what we were told, hosts a renoun chef. Now take what I'm saying with a grain of salt, I am not hispanic so if you are looking for 100% authenticity it might not be here However, this food is still amazingly tasty. Definitely a bit pricy, but for a tourist you should definitely come by here if you are in Old town scottsdale.

I'm on a mission to find good Mexican food in AZ.  I'm not talking about Sonoran or fresh mex.  The mission is probably the best restaurant I've been to in AZ!!!  The outside of the restaurant reminds me of the alamo in San Antonio, TX.  We had the skirt steak street tacos, street corn, crab and corn pancakes, and the banana and blueberry pancakes.  It was brunch on a Sunday of course!  All the food was superb!  Skirt streak came in 3 small tacos, but was very filling.  Skirt steak itself was so tender and not chewy!  Crab and corn pancakes reminded us of the crab salad at zinc bistro and find out later both are owned by the same person! Win win!  Lots of fresh crab on top of corn pancakes!  The street corn was amazing!!!  We asked the server to cut it off the husk and it was made with some sort of sauce that had a huge kick!!! It was crunchy and sweet and then spicy from the sauce!  My husband and I still cannot stop thinking about it!!  I have no idea what was in that sauce!  The children had banana and blueberry pancakes! So yummy! The bananas were fried and caramelized! This place rocks and it is so affordable!! We can't wait to go back!

My first experience at The Mission went a little like this....

Where & how do i begin to describe a middle of the week lunch here,  that was akin to sex to the hundreth power.
You know middle of the day sex that you weren't expecting and now it's all you're thinking about and you find yourself smiling all day long ...yeah baby The mission was that damn good .

At first glance,  * curbside*  it is aesthetically pleasing,  and as you make your way inside,  the beautiful people greet you,  and escort you to your table ( our's was outside on the courtyard style patio) even in broad daylight this is a sexy place with it large brick fireplace and intimate seating ( corner booth).

Anthony  our waiter was nothing short of fabulous. You could see he takes pride in doing his job well. He asked if it was our first time and like a gentle lover he explained what we were about to experience while we let our hands and eyes travel over the heavy soft leather covered delicate pages of the menu .

The Mission is a Spanish- French fusion style eatery The chef was trained in French Cuisine and he has melded that training carefully into the Spanish style dishes .

I had the Brisket Torta (actually i think it had me)  thinly sliced  tender beef that literally melted on my tongue that was lightly drenched in a mild yet flavorful BBQ type sauce that sat atop coleslaw, which added a cool crispness to the hot soft beef.
This Torta was texturally stimulating and the Aji Amarillo gave my taste buds a subtle barely there sting. Nothing within the soft bun competed for flavor it was harmonious ..A Fait Accompli .
Presentation was lovely. The made before your eyes table side Guacamole is    wonderful. My companions lunch consisted of 3 petite beef tacos that looked amazing.

The food is not to be rushed as something so well executed needs to be savored, felt .

Like an afternoon of great lovemaking,  I  left limp, floaty, sated,  eager for more. A wicked soft grin upon my lips as i walked away. And  i had to turn back and look one more time ...

Mission accomplished ......an orgasmic experience !
5 stars for the stars in my eyes ....

Update:

I have eaten at The mission at least twice per month. I love their Mango and Jimaca salad, and the Spinach & Date salad. 

For dessert the fried bananas rock! But,  the pumpkin bread pudding...OMG OFF THE HOOK.

I went to this restaurant with 9 other girls as part of a bachelorette party weekend.  We actually picked this place based on all the Yelp reviews and now here I am writing one of my own.

First off - make a reservation and get there on time!  This place gets packed, and I can see why.  The ambiance is really nice.  Kind of laid-back, soft lighting everywhere, some pretty chandeliers and this sort of industrial look that went well with the antiquity of everything else.  Our server was AMAZING.  He took the time to go over any item on the menu and explain how it's cooked, and made great recommendations for some of our girls who were vegetarians.  

Myself, I was going to order the chorizo pork shoulder but decided to get the chicken tacos instead.  I was a little worried that I'd made a mistake with that order because when the food was served, all I got was a small plate with 3 cute lil tacos.  What I didn't realize was how packed full of delicious meat those tacos were.  They were, literally, finger licking good!  All the other girls in my party loved their food, so I think I can go as far as saying most everything on the menu is delicious.

Finally, the mixed drinks are delicious, too.  They have so many tequilas, it's mind-boggling. I had one of their mojitos and it was to die for.  The bartender also hooked us up with some kind of sweet drink in a shot glass for some of us chicks who can't handle hard liquor shots.

Anyways, I highly recommend this place!

I've been sitting on writing this review for a while now because I really wanted to LOVE this restaurant. But I left kind of just feeling like it was okay. 

First of all, I was on a work trip and dinning with my colleagues. The service was fabulous and I really felt as if our table was catered to. We had lots of questions for the server and he answered them all with great sense of humor and attitude. I felt he not only really knew the menu, but he really loved the dishes he recommended. 

My favorite, FAVORITE part of the meal was the chips and salsa. The chips were fresh and the salsa was delicious. I also liked the guacamole, but it was also nothing too special. Just your average, fresh, restaurant guac. We also ordered a salad to share, which I wasn't too jazzed about. I know a few of my colleagues didn't love that the salad didn't seem to match the description. And they were right, the actual dish didn't really match the description. 

For my entree I got some tacos with a side of their street corn, served in a bowl. I'll start with the corn because I'd never had Mexican street corn before. So, yea... I'm not a mayo fan and I really felt like this was a bowl of hot corn in a bunch of mayo with crumbly cheese on top. I took one bite and decided it wasn't for me. However, I really feel like if I tried traditional Mexican street corn on the cob, I would like it better. Maybe the ratio of creamy/cheesy/corn is better that way. The tacos were good, but didn't really leave me thinking about them after I left. 

Overall, I just didn't really like much beyond the chips and salsa as much as I thought I would. However, I do feel like I'd come back to try other menu items because this is one of those times I feel like I just ordered the wrong thing. My colleagues tried the pork tacos for two and I think that's what I should have done. And just reading the reviews about them proves that I need to come back to try them.

This restaurant has a great atmosphere and very nice service. The menu is not vegetarian friendly and the margaritas are super sweet. 

Food is really good, had the salmon and pumpkin bread pudding. 

Would recommend for a night out with friends or with a date.

Celebrated my birthday here a couple years ago and I'm just now writing a review for it. Hands down best guacamole I've ever had and I love that they make it table side. We got several different entrees that had great flavor. The pumpkin bread pudding was such an amazing dessert I would probably go back just for that and the guacamole. Restaurant is a little dark so it's definitely a restaurant for a specific or special occasion. Great place all around!

Great food and great drinks! Tried a few margaritas and was happy with the flavors on all of them.

I really like the tableside guac. What a great concept to let the diner decide what they want in it and how spicy they would like it. Also tasted super fresh. All the food we ordered was delicious and if you have room for it I would recommend getting dessert. I had the espresso churros and they were amazing!!

Outstanding deliciousness!!  Our waiters recommendations were spot on!  The street corn appetizer, duck, and the chorizo were our favorites but everything was delicious.  Amazing margaritas.  Make a reservation in advance or be prepared to dine at 5 or 9:30pm.  So delicious!!
If you prefer a "hip" atmosphere to good food, you might like this place
Great atmosphere, great food, great location. Located in Old Town - Scottsdale. Menu leans towards smaller plates, but that makes for great sharing. Best margaritas in town!
We never actually got to eat here; even though we had reservations, the hostess was snippy and snotty and inflexible.  Completely off-putting.

When we first arrived I thought our server was going to be snobby - the music was blasting inside and the restaurant seemed to be filled with only 20-somethings, so we decided to sit outside even though it was butt-cold.  To my surprise our waitress was very cool and made accommodations for us like moving the heater over to our table, offering to split our dish (we shared a main and ordered several other appetizers) and offering us hot water after we pulled this next thing off...  

Because I can't drink freaking ice water when it's 30 degrees out, I asked for a cup of hot water to warm up the ice water we'd been given.  Then I realized I had a bag of tea in my purse and put it in the hot water.  When our waitress came out she look shocked and said, "did you bring your own tea?"  Well, I hadn't planned on sneaking in tea to the restaurant it just happened to be in my purse from another event we went to before dinner and it seemed like a good idea when she brought me the hot water.  When I explained that we'd just been to the Botanic Garden's annual Holiday Luminaria event and the tea was from that, she asked if we wanted more hot water.  How cool is that?  We act like near vagabonds at the restaurant and we still get the royal treatment.  That's good service.

Oh.  You probably want to know about the food.  BEST GUACAMOLE I've ever had.  Ever.  Really.  Made table side, to order, leave out whatever you want.  Freaking amazing.  The homemade salsa also rocked the house.  I asked if there was cilantro in it (because I can't have it) and our waitress asked and returned with an answer - no.  Just good, good service even though this joint seems almost like a nightclub after 8pm.

Our dinner was tastefully made and delicious.  We almost went back to do two nights in a row and honestly, after eating at Frank & Albert's instead, I pretty much wish we had eaten at The Mission two nights in a row.

Superb.

I tried The Mission this past weekend while in town for a bachelorette party. Great place for a party, very accommodating of our large party. 

We started out with the skinny margaritas (delish, not too sweet) and guacamole. The guac was good but I've had better. However, I'm also from San Antonio and could live on Mexican food. We also ordered the duck empanadas which were out of this world; rich, with great texture and flavor. I had the steak tacos as my main dish which were good but not outstanding. I'm wishing I had conned someone in my party to split the pork shoulder tacos with me. We ended with the pumpkin bread pudding which was just as good as everyone says. 

Great vibe and decor although the lighting was so dim it caused eye strain and dried out my contacts.
Great place to eat! There guacamole was fantastic. Also tried the skirt steak tacos. Amazing. Highly recommend.

This place was delicious. It got one less star that probably only applies for dinner. The dining room is very dark. People were using their phone flashlight to read the menu. Kudos to the attentive waitstaff though for operating in the dark! We had the pork shoulder tacos for two which did not disappoint. We also had the duck confit empanadas with four gras and grilled street corn. Both were very flavorful. I plan to go back during daylight.
Loved it.  So much so that I went back a 2nd time a week later.  Table side guac is a winner as is the street corn.  Have them cut it off the cob so you can pass it around.  Muy Bueno.
The flat iron steak was tender but not much flavor. Duck was tasty but nothing special. Bread pudding excellent!

Easy 5 star. Staff was friendly from start to finish. The food was a 6 star! We had the guac to start and  tacos for meal and will be coming back just for that. One of the best Mojito's I have ever had. The pricing was surprisingly good priced. We will def be coming back.

I'm giving 3 stars for the food, but our service was ATROCIOUS. We went on a Tuesday evening and our waiter took it upon himself to order a margarita WITH an extra shot when my husband requested a surprise of which ever margarita he recommended. I thought that was tacky and rude and of course we didn't know until the bill arrived...and he had had 2 drinks. The duck empanada was very good...but it took OVER an hour to arrive at our table. Ends up, there was a party of 50 in the back and rather than explaining this, our waiter just ignored us for the hour. I'm not sure if we were supposed to get chips and salsa, but every table seemed to have been served them and I didn't see it on the menu.

The waiter convinced me to order his favorite dish, the chorizo porchetta and I didn't love it - it was okay. It definitely needed the tortillas that I later ordered to go with. The chicken tacos my husband ordered were great, but more of an appetizer size.

The real kicker was that our waiter PROFUSELY apologized to the table next to us for the long wait (they arrived after us, however) and brought a dessert on the house to their table. What did we get? The check. So rude!! We hardly left a tip, the service was that poor.
Great food, good prices. Got exactly what I ordered, with amazing service! Will definitely recommend!

Plain and simple, The Mission Old Town is great whether you're enjoying brunch or dinner thanks to their excellent service, atmosphere, menu, pricing, and execution.  

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

My party of six couldn't have been taken care of any better, and our server was absolutely out of this world. The great atmosphere at The Mission is complimented by things like table-side guac stations and a great indoor/outdoor setup. Excellent. Star. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

The Mission could get away with charging much higher prices than they do, and I was shocked to find that virtually nothing on the brunch menu was priced higher than $15.00 for what were generous portions. Well done. Star. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

My green chilaquiles dish was excellent, and my girlfriend's cinnamon pecan waffles were worthwhile as well. Solid flavors all around. Single Star. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Definitely, I'll come back for the tacos. Star.
Blown away by the service, ambiance, and finally the food.  Try the butternut squash tacos.... And, stay for the company you may meet at the bar ;)

Asked my boyfriend the highlight of our weekend getaway and his answer was "probably dinner at The Mission." We came from chicago and finding Mexican food was top of our list of priorities as Its hard to find authentic Mexican out there. We decided on The Mission to celebrate his birthday based off extensive yelp searching and some recommendations from friends-- had a 730 reservation on a Saturday night. It was poppin (you definitely want a reservation). Ambiance was very lively. Room is dimly lit, making it great for a date (there was a first date going on at the table next to us), but there were plenty of groups eating together as well. 

Food breakdown:
-Started with the Skinny Margarita and Smokehouse Marg, both so good we ordered another round with dinner :)
-appetizers: tableside guac is my favorite and The Mission didn't disappoint! Sadly due to how crowded the restaurant was, she couldn't make it at our table but was a few tables away. It was delicious, however. Then we got the skewered corn but requested it off the cob, so we could dip the chips in it and mix with the guac-- highly recommend you do the same :) (warning, there was definitely a little kick to it)
-for the main course we got beer battered mahi mahi  and the barbacoa tacos. Both were great, but the mahi mahi were both of our favorites-- the breading was very light and the fish was fantastic
-Dessert: our waiter Arturo was amazing and brought us a complimentary pumpkin bread pudding dessert for the birthday celebrations. Holy. Cow. I do not normally eat dessert but this was one of the top five desserts I've ever had, and the birthday boy felt the same way. The pumpkin bread pudding is served warm with cold ice cream which balances the flavors, and there's a scotch caramel esque sauce and sunflower seeds and pomegranate on top. The flavors really mixed well and i was so sad when it was over

I can't wait to come back to Scottsdale and come back to The Mission. I'd Recommend It to anyone!

Delish! Our group ordered table side guacamole, chicken, skirt steak and barbacoa tacos. All were wonderful but the steak ones were our favorites. We shared the spinach, date salad. It was fantastic and large enough for 2 to share. Finished with the unbelievable pumpkin bread pudding. We'd go back for that alone! Service was stellar. It's pricey but for a special meal, we would definitely recommend it.

I want to love The Mission. I really do. The decor is awesome and the margaritas ROCK! But, the food is not doing it for me and I'm so disappointed! 

I have had the guacamole and I thought it was fine but nothing so special it should be three times the price of guacamole anywhere else.

The cheese plate, on the other hand, I'd say that's where it's at  - the cheese portions were fair and the grilled pan de yuca was warm, soft and delicious!

The pozole was good but while I thought it was cute that the "heat" came on the side (you add your own serrano and garnish) I would have liked more of the flavor to come from the kitchen. 

I actually have to say I did NOT like the mahi mahi tacos and it had nothing to do with the size (they ARE small - the tortillas can't be more than 4 inches in diameter but the filling portions are generous). It was the fat little fish sticks that served as the filling --  all I could taste was the batter! By my second taco, I was trying to pick the batter off and come the third - I just gave up and left it in hopes of enjoying dessert.

Dessert was good - I had the churros on the recommendation of the many Yelp reviews I had read and they were OK. I actually preferred the fried bananas - more specifically, the peanut butter mousse that they were plated with! 

OK, I was going to give this place 2 stars but I'm going to round up to 3 with a caveat: For dinner, "Meh. I've experienced better." but for sharing a cheese plate, maybe some pozole, a couple margaritas or a romantic setting for dessert with a bottle of wine, it's "A-OK."

Salt, salt & more salt... We were in Scottsdale for a few days for work and took co-workers here based on reviews. Food was near inedible. Every single dish had more salt then the next. Even the chips, guacamole & salsa were covered in salt. How do you mess salsa up?? Staff was wonderful and accommodating, setting is really nice. Room noise was beyond loud and the food probably would have been decent otherwise.

We were in town from Seattle on a girls' weekend and came here on our last night. We definitely saved the best for last! We sat out on the patio and it was just lovely.
Lauren was our server and she was the most knowledgable server I've ever had. She was also very attentive without being annoying. 
We ordered drinks - all of the margaritas were excellent - and the table-side guacamole (a must!). Rueben came to our table and some of us wanted spicy and some didn't. So he split it in half. He even topped it with pumpkin seeds. I asked him if he was sure they weren't nuts because I have an allergy, he actually made me a small portion with nothing on it (so sweet!)
We ordered and shared the braised short ribs and they were the best I've ever had! So moist they just fell off of the bone. The steak tacos were so flavorful. I wish I could describe the flavor - it's smokey and just excellent! 
They even brought us the pumpkin bread pudding at no charge (although I cannot guarantee they will do this for anyone else!) and it was amazing! 
Over all, our experience was one of the best we've ever had.
If you go to Scottsdale, you HAVE to go to The Mission - you won't regret it!

Came here for my birthday with my father and boyfriend.  Inside is very nicely decorated and dimly lit so this would be perfectly for a date or even a professional type happy hour with the coworkers.  The noise level is average, people are here to have a nice night out and enjoy themselves, but by no means do you have to yell to speak to the person across from you.  The wait-staff was also very friendly and they all seemed to be working together so you're not just relying on your one waiter.   As for the food, it was very good.  We ordered the guacamole per suggestions on Yelp.  It's made at your table and taste very fresh and was probably the closest thing I've ever eaten to actual guacamole.  My father and I also ordered the tacos, which were a good size and the meat was very tender, not fatty and had good flavor.  My boyfriend had the larger order of tacos where you are given meat, and tortillas on a slab of rock salt and you assemble your own tacos...basically what my father and I had except way more food.  If you can eat a lot I would go for it!  Overall, I would go back.  The prices aren't the cheapest, but the atmosphere is really nice and chic and the food is really good.  If you're looking a whole in the wall Mexican food place where they yell at you hot plate, (even though those places are awesome), this is not the place for you.  It's more of a night date night place or place to take the parents out to.

i came here for dinner the other day while in town and although i had a great dinner here...the only thing that really stood out was the dessert i had....its the only thing that im writing the review on.

sat down at the bar for a bite and to watch the world series game...had some drinks. had tacos. wanted something sweet...so i ordered dessert.

FML. MIND BLOWING DESSERT ALERT.

we've all had churros at some point and time in our lives right...its kinda like eating a donut really...when its fresh, its amazing.  fried, sweet, and tastes like cinnamon...cant go wrong...

i USED to think this UNTIL i had the churros here at the Mission.

they serve up these mini churros here WITH a tres leches milkshake/ice cream that will make a grown man cry tears of joy.  i mean, im over there taking bites and barely able to control my emotions...knowing that i dont live in the area and will not be able to eat this anytime i wanted...

little deep fried churros that simply put, are the most delicious churro ive ever had...
crispy, fried, buttery, sweet, cinnamon-y, just simply amazing little things...

go to The Mission. eat the churros. you will geek out when you do....

The restaurant is so hip and cool and the cuisine is outstanding.  We started with the duck carnitas empanada which was truly savory.  Then, we had the Malbec braised short ribs which were melt-in-the-mouth tender with wonderful flavor.  I love the location being in the old town part of Scottsdale.

The only negative was the sweet but overly descriptive waitress.  If the owner/manager is reading, it is unnecessary to describe the minute detail of every single dish.  I have had lectures on black holes and the big bang theory that were less involved and shorter.

This is a great place to take out of towners to show them that AZ has some talented chefs.

I was very impressed with The Mission.  Immediately walking in, I was struck by the romantic atmosphere. It was dimly lit, but had lots of candle light and chandeliers.  I really thought the restaurant was just beautiful and felt intimate.  

Our service was excellent.  We had table-side guacamole, halibut, and porchetta. The margaritas were really good- I love margaritas!  

My boyfriend took me to The Mission at the recommendation of some friends. I'm so glad we went because it was a really special experience. I want to go back the next time we are in Scottsdale!
Definitely try the guacamole, crispy pork belly, and the margaritas! They make the guacomole right in front of your yable! So delish!

I was a late addition to my family's dinner in the back patio and much of their talk was about the quick service they were already getting. From the knowledgeable waitress to the entertaining table side guac -- I can truly say they've trained their staff. But much of the show was a hostess with a tattoo consistently resetting tables around us, carrying trays, running food the next second, and then going back to hosting. Lastly she charmed us even more by stopping what she was doing to guide my folks out. Many restaurants lose their sense of hospitality when it's busy but this place isn't one of them and she's was a gem to our experience.

I knew I was in for a great meal as soon as we tried the chips and salsa. The salsa had just the right mix of heat, acid, and smokiness. Everything we ordered was actually delicious. The pork shoulder tacos were a stand out. Great drinks too!

What a disappointment! We where looking forward to enjoying some tapas and tacos for an authentic southwest meal. We should of just said 4 orders of grey leather and fat please! because that's what their "famous porchetta" looked like it was obviously sitting and left over from the weekend.
The waiter introduced himself and said "before anything get it out of your head that this is a Mexican restaurant because is not! don't even look at the tacos and order from the main course page"
We were a bit surprised as the taco selection looked excellent and that it was we went for. So after the waiter basically saying the tacos suck we order some apps fresh guac at the table, Mexican corn both excellent but the pork belly wrap wasn't crispy as advertised it was like jerky and the duck empenadas were sold out. Then the grand finale we order from the "main course page" so we decided on the duck and halibut after about 15 minutes and being up sold to doubles on our drinks by the waiter who obviously wanted to jack up the bill not to receive a "taco tip" we are told they are they are out of the coveted main course items he pushed on us leaving the option of the porchetta that was . Have a feeling the dishwasher was cooking and not the weekend chef and we still tipped 20% because that's how we roll but thanks to this horrible experience we would never come back or recommend this restaurant. The decor is great and I'm sure with the right waiter and chef working it may be good. 
Update:
Unreal! 2 days after I get home food paradise featured the mission and the tacos looked incredible I couldn't believe it.
The food here is spectacular, and the ambiance is great.  Servers are always friendly.
My favorite restaurant EVER. Best piece of pork I've ever eaten and amazing service. My boyfriend takes me here whenever he wants to butter me up :-)

The Mission is in Old Scottsdale, a nice area for good restaurants and shopping.  

We went on a Sunday early afternoon for brunch.  It was busy but we were able to find a table in the bar area (first come, first served).  Otherwise, if you want a table, I'd suggest making reservations (we had one for dinner originally and times went quickly...we called a week in advance and the best we could get was 6PM).

Brunch is a choice of the regular menu, which is small but has some good dishes, or an All-You-Can-Eat taco bar, which is done well.  They have someone carving beef and pork.  They put it on a small, soft tortilla for you, and you add your own toppings.  Very good, reasonable price (think it was $16).  They also offer table side Guacamole, made to your preferences.

Overall, very enjoyable.  Might give it a 5-star if it were in another location, but with the competition in that area, there are a few that are slightly better.

This is the best restaurant in Scottsdale.  I order the healthy margarita and the hanger steak every time I go, and they are both easily the best I have ever experienced.  My husband orders the scallops and we have had almost all of the appetizers and sides, all of them extraordinary.  One note, they do try to rush your experience so make sure you take your time, otherwise you will be out of there in an hour.
Shrimp tacos are amazing. Servers are excellent. Great ambiance. Not over priced for the quality. Food takes awhile but it's worth the wait.

About a year ago my mom showed me a menu from this place and I couldn't wait to try it! Finally got around to trying it out for lunch today. I was super impressed! We came in and were seated immediately. It was incredibly dark inside which was one downside. The restaurant had a cool feel to it, I really liked the setup. 
We got the tableside guacamole and it was cool to watch them make it. Also it was incredibly delicious. I ordered the butternut squash tacos, it was either that or the black bean torta. I will get that next time I go! I am glad I got the tacos though. The tacos were incredibly small so I'm glad I had Guac to fill up on a bit! My mom got Huevos rancheros and my sister got the steak tacos. They both really enjoyed their meals and I did too. I left feeling very satisfied! Overall the lunch menu wasn't too crazy expensive too, pretty reasonably priced. Also the servers/hostesses were all incredibly nice which wins points in my book!

I ate here once and enjoyed it very much. I returned and after going inside discovered that they are posted "no firearms."  Unfortunately they are not properly posted and are, in fact, posted in a way that can cause problems for themselves and especially their customers.

When posting, the posting must be prominently displayed. It's bad enough when places post because it only affects Arizona residents who hold a concealed carry license. However, their posting is well hidden behind some stuff at the bar making it difficult to notice. Either have the courage to post properly or remove the sign. The sign is so easy to miss that someone, someday is going to get in trouble.

Excellent service and great atmosphere, but food wasn't really worth the hype. Table side guac was a hit. The tortilla for tacos were all too thick, so kinda skewed the taste. Mahi mahi tacos were my fav. Steak and barbacoa were just alright...

For dessert, I would recommend the bread pudding with the warning that the sauce is very very sweet. Don't get the churros!! I didn't heed the warning and it was way too oily and over fried.

You guys delivered another delicious meal and fabulous service, but Jesus, Joseph and Mary why so freaking dark? I want to see what I'm eating. What are you hiding? Please consider backlit menus, I gave up and ordered the same thing as on a previous visit simply because I could not see a damn thing.

One word.....FUN! As my friend Patti said as we were leaving, "I haven't laughed that hard in such a long time!" That could be due to too many house special margaritas (which were really YUMMY!) or because we are a fun group of gals! 

Either way, The Mission delivers. Service is great. The people working there are friendly (always a must for me to ever go someplace more than once). Food is good, but the portions would be too small for my husband who still eats like food like he's a teen preparing for a football season. For us girls, it's a great reminder to keep our figures svelte- and still feel pleasantly full. 

TRY- Table side Guacamole. Guaranteed to be the most heavenly Guacamole you've EVER tasted! They add everything from cilantro to garlic, to hot peppers (to your taste), to cheese sprinkled lightly (or more heavy handed if you request it) on top. Last time there, 4 of us ordered 2 servings of it since the 1st time 1 serving wasn't enough for 2 of us (because it was so good I practically licked the bowl clean). 

Maybe it was due to having a margarita first, or not being as hungry the 2nd time, but 2 servings + a drink + the chicken tacos was PLENTY of food (I even had to save 1 taco for later). Those cute little itty bitty 3 tacos don't look like a lot of food, but once you pair them with other offerings The Mission has, you will find yourself quite satisfied. 

If you go to The Mission, be sure to bring good friends (or a significant other who doesn't eat like a football player). Be ready for great margaritas, great guacamole, nice servers, and a "chillaxed" environment. 

Enjoy!

This is not your local taco joint. It's a classy hip Mexican restaurant/bar backed by an award winning chef know for inspiring twist on cultural dishes. The decor his rustic, gothic, and hip. The food is on a different level that most places and will introduce your palate to  favors so full and interesting you will smiling and taking about it for the whole time there. Just like the food, the drink menu is on a higher level. The service is amazing friendly and not snobby at all. Workers greet with a smile you as you walk in and out. Waiters know their food as if they were the chefs. With all this combined you would think that this place could break your wallet but to the contrary! It's affordable! Mission has it right!
Fantastic!!!!!!!! I love the pork shoulder tacos. This isn't like your normal Mexican restaurant. The flavor is out of this world.

One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. It's such a nice departure from the Mexican food you find on every corner. This "Latin American" food is flavorful and fun, there is really no comparison to anything else around. If you're a fan of pork, you'll be in heaven. Sure, the tacos are tiny but they are filled to the top with the good stuff-meat and seafood. Who cares about the tortilla? 
Tableside guacamole is fantastic. Pork belly can't be beat. The pork tacos, seafood tacos (especially the scallops), and the beef short ribs are some of the best things I have ever tasted. The drinks are expensive but they are yummy.
I like the presentation of the tortillas on the salt blocks and the salt wall around the kitchen is pretty cool. The decor is very nicely done with two huge patios that are perfect for Arizona evening dining or enjoying a cocktail in the sun.
They get knocked one star because service is not consistent. I have been here four times now, twice the service was over-the-top, best waiter/waitress I've ever had. The other two times were just average wait staff, not bad, but why go back to the Honda when you've had the Bentley? Otherwise, everything else is perfect.

What I loved most was outdoor seating and I recall most enjoying the live entertainment. I went with waiters food suggestion, tasted great yet can't recall what I ordered, I was far too distracted by the outdoors and music in the best of ways.

Despite having some delicious tacos, my family and I had a very frustrating experience while visiting Old Scottsdale. We were hungry and stopped there for lunch. The menu was very limited, and we got the tacos we were faced with 3 tostadas intead. The tacos were so small that they should not be called tacos, nor a meal. The meal did not have sides included and the menu also didn't have sides so we didn't order anything. The environment was ok, the food was delicious, but they definitively should not be called a meal. This place is great for a happy hour, don't go for a meal.
Awesome food, atmosphere and service. The guacamole that was made fresh at the table was incredible.  The salsa was even better. The fish tacos were great!   Loved the outdoor eating area.

Sorry I was disappointed with such a highly rated restaurant.  Prices did not meet value.  
1. Shrimp taco, 3 tasty but tiny tacos. Maybe you should rename them Shrimpy shrimp tacos.  Even the shrimp were shrimpy. Repeat- they were tasty.
2. Negra Modelo on tap- served warm. Nice fumble.
3. Pork sandwich- it was a ham and cheese with a stale and over cooked old fatty piece of pork which was inedible. Not cool chef.

I would have loved to eat here when the other chef with 4 stars was cooking.
The best.  Get the guac and don't come here expecting chimichangas and enchiladas covered in yellow cheese.
food was whatever, overpriced and not that great tasting. But the house made guac is really good, def would recommend that.

There's a lot to love about The Mission.  The experience comes so close to 5-star that it makes me want to nit-pick about all the tiny things that fall juuuust short so they can fix them for my next visit!

The Bar: What a lovely, refreshing Basil margarita!  It was just sweet enough without being syrupy.  But bartender, why is getting a recommendation out of you like pulling teeth?

The Food: Excellent table-side guacamole; it lived up to the very high expectations set by all the other reviewers.  My dinner partner's Hangar Steak was very juicy for such a thin cut and the dressing from the tomatillo salad give the whole dish a tangy, acidic bite.  My Chorizo Porchetta was very unique and flavorful, but a little more sauce would've saved it from being slightly dry.  I love though how the star of the entrees really is the meat here, the portions were generous and the sides were an accompaniment, not a competitor.
***Almost forgot about the pumpkin bread pudding we shared!  He loved the scotch-carmel sauce which I thought was too sweet.  I loved the moist, fragrant bread which he thought was missing pumpkin-y spice.  To each their own!

The Atmosphere:  It's a gothic romance come to life with beautiful dark metal chandeliers, warm, glowing salt bricks, and dim lighting.  I just wish the table of 6 old men talking golf wasn't sooo close.  A little more room between tables would complete the intimate decor.

The Service:  I have no complaints here!  Our server was excellent and never overwhelming, the lady who made our guac was all charm, and kudos to the chef who sent us complimentary street corn (yummy by the way).  

A note on the street corn: I felt like this was a dish that would've won the Top Chef competition where they had to re-invent convenience store food.  The grilled, slightly salty & crunchy corn topped with creamy spicy cheese sauce beats any AM-PM nachos I've ever had! :)

Lots of wonderful food still to try here.  I will be back very soon for brunch with mom!
You must get the corn tortillas, served on a salt brick. Seriously the best. Also, get the guacamole (made in front of you). Absolutely loved the decor. Staff is friendly.

Beautiful place and ambience. Server and table side guacamole was great, must try the Guac! I came here with my fiancé and it has the whole romantic feel to it, however our entrees and drinks failed to impress us. Drinks were expensive and weak. My steak wasn't that enjoyable had a weird taste to it, however the little bread it came with was good. My fiancé ordered 2 diff tacos, and wasn't impressed. We've been to taco stands in Cali & Philly that was way better. Presentation, atmosphere, the Guac and sever was on top.... so for that I give 3 stars. However I've been to plenty of higher end restaurants with better tasting food that I didn't mind pinching pennies for. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but I don't think I'd come back.

Jamar is saving this account their dumbass manager. Their manager has horrible customer service he is an ass and I can't believe he has a good job. This place is beautiful but come on- ure in the industry and u gotta talk to ppl and not lie about seating. Jamar is the man- a great server. The free samples of marg are tasty. Hands down the Margs are the best I've had for a while. The salsa is delish!!!!! The tacos and chips and salsa are great. This is coming from a huge Mexican food  fan ( born and raised in Cali) and good is delish!

Don't go here unless you really like attitude, obnoxious crowd, weak drinks and waiting and waiting....
Once at our table the service and food were good - 
but given the chance I would NOT return.

Legit. Well made cocktails, incredible food and friendly service.

If you order tacos... order 2 orders! They are baby street tacos. But they are Delicious!

Cucumber jalapeño margi is a must... enjoy!

Too bad you can't award six stars!  Service and bartender were knowledgeable, fun and engaging.  The food choices are amazing, but the food and quality of the beverages are amazing.  Guacamole table side, incredible tacos with hand made tortillas, great wine...  Wow!

I was visiting Scottsdale and looking for something to eat for lunch.. So I checked Yelp and found The Mission with 4 stars reviews overall.. serves mexican food (which Arizona is known for)... and within walking distance from where I was at, so I gave it a try.
First I was confused with the church next to it but then I walked further.. and was so glad I found this restaurant.  So.. here I am ... at The Mission! 

The atmosphere is very cool... they have outdoor seating areas at the front and at the back, in the middle is the bar area and indoor seating which is very dark.
We chose to sit outdoor since they have heater and blanket.

The food? Meh! What I really don't like is: Our server offered Chips & Guacamole, and later I found out that they cost $14 which is about the same as the cost of most entrees in their menu.
Since it's Sunday we chose Sunday Pig Out, which is all you can eat pork tacos. The downside is since we sat outdoor at the back, we had to walk inside to get our pork tacos.
They tasted ok.. nothing special.
We also ordered Lunch Mahi Tacos as recommended by our server, which consists of 3 small tacos with small portion of deep fried mahi. The deep fried mahi is really really dry!

The drink? I ordered Blood Orange Margarita, again, as recommended by our server, which I later saw there was an additional $3 on the check for adding Solerno, which our server did not explain. It was served without the salt rim, it tasted just ok.

The service? Quite disappointing. Our server did not explain about the cost of Chips & Guacamole which was not on the menu. He also did not explain the additional charge on the margarita. He rarely checked our table either.

Despite the cool atmosphere and the great company I had, the food (tacos), service and drinks are not impressive at all.

It was a culinary delight visiting this restaurant! Everything we ordered was delicious and had amazing flavor!  We ordered different things to give everything a try.  There was nothing we didn't love!!  Very cool interior design.  Our server couldn't have been more gracious.  Great place for a date, business, party - whatever you desire!!  I truly can't wait to come back.  Thank you for such a treat!!

i looooove any kind of tapas style menu and adore old mission-style buildings and furnishings, so i was madly in love with this place when i spotted it while driving around scottsdale one day. 
so i suggested meeting up here with a good friend for dinner one day...

what a pleasant surprise! aside from a really clumsy and spacey (but really nice) waitress, the food was AMAZING! 

we ordered the duck carnitas empanada to start. uhm. sooooo goood! this was my definite favorite of all the things we ordered. i will warn you - this baby is deep fried, so clear out your arteries first! but honestly... it might be worth a little clogging....
the tecate skirt steak tacos are also delicious! they ARE tiny.... but again, if you remember to come w a date/friend you can order a few things and share and it's plenty.
we also ordered the mission fries - yum! sweet potato and regular fries. served w a funky chipotle ketchup and some kind of mayo-spice dip. 

highly recommended.

When a restaurant has over 1500 reviews, clearly something is going on.   so during one of my regular business trips to Phoenix, I took some time to venture over to Scottsdale to see what the buzz about this place is all about.

I live in Boston.  Old Town anything to me means pre-Revolutionary War, not the Wild West.  So what a fun and different look this area is!    Bonanza meets Beverly Hills.    Ok, on to the restaurant...

Being by myself, I ventured through the cool outdoor patio area and into the renovated historic building and found a seat at the bar.   Greeted by a friendly face, I ordered a drink and took a look a the menu.    I was surprised to see how limited it was, but it didn't really matter, I found something I could sink my teeth into.

I ordered the short rib tacos and brussel sprout tacos.   The bartender said "You know you're ordering 6 taco's right?"  Haha.  Yes I know.   Being on a low carb diet, my intentions are just to eat the innards and these are about half the size of normal tacos.

Although a tad on the pricey side for the amount you get, both were absolutely delicious and I highly recommend this combo!  Getting a nice flavorful beef followed by a tangy vegetable was making my taste buds do a happy dance!    

Based on my short but tasty experience, I can see why this is a fan favorite.   Located in a popular and trendy area, super cool atmosphere, friendly staff, and tasty food.   I'm glad I went and would definitely come back again!

Great quality food and ambiance for a 1:1 meal. The only reason this place didn't get 5 stars was b/c the portion sizes were small. For the price I was a bit surprised I didn't see a bit more come out.

Everything else was fantastic and I would visit this restaurant again.

This place really has a great Scottsdale/Southwest/Sexy vibe.  Walking in I am always impressed by the sexy southwestern decor.  Kinda dark with mirrors, candles and a glowing salt block wall that separates the kitchen from the dining area.

These guys have a great tequila and margarita selection.  It would be a mistake to head straight to the dining area without stopping in the bar first for a drink.

I've been here on Sundays for the "Pig Out" all you can eat pork event which is great.

This recent visit they were offering a five course fixed menu with wine pairings for $65/person.  I love these type events because the chef can experiment with new recipes and as a guest I get to try many new flavors and wines.

This meal progressed from scallops to roasted guinea hen to halibut to Berkshire pork to chocolate cake.  My favorite was the pork and least favorite course was the chocolate cake with the lime sorbet.

The wines were mostly from Spain with a Malbec and Champagne added to round out the pairings.

Get on their email list for upcoming events or just stop in for a meal.  This place is consistently good.

As a "die-hard" foodie that spends way too much of his income eating out...I'll state emphatically that The Mission is one of those very special places that only comes along once in a long while.  Matt Carter has an unbelievable palate for flavor and a creative approach to his menu and presentations that are so unique - his food just should not be missed!  Complimenting that, GM Brian Raab and his team execute service flawlessly with just the right balance of informal poise and professionalism.  They have great passion and it shows in all the details.

Stopped in for lunch yesterday after shopping at the farmers market. Incredibly friendly staff, beautiful restaurant (I plan on coming back for a date night with the husband!) and delicious food! I had the mahi mahi fish tacos....sooooo good! Really wonderful experience! Baby friendly!

reservation today Monday feb 20. hardly anyone in the restraurant.
they wanted to seat us in a long bench with small tables where people would be
touching elbows. we said no...
they then put us at a little bigger table but said it was reserved at 6:30.
we said no...never mind..

I am going to spend big bucks to be elbow to elbow with other people...how can
they do quac at the table...the person would have to out in the isle where no one could
get buy...

put your little leather covered pretentious menu away and your little tourist trappy selves
away cause it wont fly with me....
went to a much better place with real tables, pleasant servers and really good food..thanks
will never go there and will not recommend it to my friends who come here for spring training...
Relativly new joint in Old Town.   very innovative margaritas.  Went midday so we had the quac and tostadas.  The patio is lovely.  bring your wallet though... not exactly cheap

Came here for a late night pre-game before a bachelor party. Parking kind of sucks but the food was good. 

I had the Creekstone Filet rare which was delicious. Drinks were well done. Had a few shots of something that tasted like coconut and it was well made by the mixologist. 

Pricing was reasonable. All in all, well worth the trip.

Their food is phenomenal!  I love their white bean puree with chips.  Smooth and tasty with a bit of a garlic flavor.  I had the Kobe dog and it is absolutely to die for!  The people at the next table commented and said they would have it the next time.  The waiter said that they only have a few at a time so if you go, go early or you will miss out!

Great spot! Came here for lunch and split:

Table side Guacamole: great!
Street Corn: amazing- asked for it off the cob so that it wouldn't get stuck in my teeth!
Brisket Torta: ok, brisket was a bit dry
Pork Shoulder Tacos: tasty but not much meat

Our service was good, the patio was beautiful and the food was tasty. I'd come back for sure!

Very disappointed with this over-hyped restaurant. Getting a reservation was hard and upon arrival I could not figure out why. If you enjoy being able to read the menu or see your food without the use of a flashlight, this is not the place for you. The food was average at best and some may say subpar (myself included). The service was okay, but did not make up for the overrated reviews of the place. I never mind paying more for good food, but this was not worth the expense at all.
I am not sure what the secret is but The Mission has it.

Mission is one of my favorite restaurants, my first dinner visit was so awesome I couldn't stop talking about it. This is what I want from latin fine dining. The ambiance, the food, the service, and everything else will gave me a very memorable experience.

First off, it's fine dining as I mentioned above, please don't expect the same meal you get at your local Mexican restaurant. I've noticed at several of these types of places the main complaint is the price, this is much higher quality!

The food is amazing, the table side guacamole is so flavorful, one of the best I've had. The pizole soup is so rich, you will want to take a pot home! For the entree, I had the jidori chicken that blew me away, super juicy, tender, and full of flavor. My wife had a pork shoulder tacos that she felt the same about. The quality of everything here is so excellent. I would consider this a must try.

I took a trip from the NY metro area to Phoenix this weekend and local took me here to get a taste of "real" Mexican food. I'm pleased to report that the food here is worth a try when you're in town. 

The restaurant had a wonderful atmosphere, whereas it was dimly lit and had a ton of strategically placed candles. It really made me fee like I was in Phoenix. 

For those of you who've tried Dos Comino's in NYC, Mission is right up there with them. The guacamole was made table side but was a little too spicy even though we asked for medium. Even with the extreme spice it tasted extremely fresh and authentic had the crispy pork belly appetizer and shared the pork shoulder entree with a friend. The corn tortillas were fresh and the pork was fork tender. 

They had negro modello on TAP which I've never seen in the northeast. I ended up dropping $50 on the meal but I thought it was well work it. This place is by no means a hole in the wall southwest US Mexican food restaurant and it knows it.

Yum! Always love it here. The tacos are very small, but very delicious! The table side guac is to die for. The last time I was there I wanted a good Mezcal and the bartender pulled down a few recommendations for me to try before ordering! Great low lit atmosphere!

Yum! Went for lunch and had the table side guacamole (which was fresh and chunky) we ordered the pork belly tortas and pork shoulder  tacos (orders of 4 each, we split) the tortas were amazing! The tacos were also good. Both of us left full.
Be careful of what you eat. 8 of us went for lunch. Two of us had the brisket and we got food poisoning.

Sadly this place has become like most restaurants in Old Town, watered down. What happened to the margaritas?????! $15 for what?! So disappointing. And the food, so basic. The Mission used to be the spot and could justify those prices with the food and drinks - now it's just...sub par. Such a bummer.

Wow.  Once of the best dining experiences I've had in a while.  So happy I got to check this place off my list!
The weather was actually tolerable out last night so we opted to eat outside, which I honestly preferred since it is so dark inside the actual restaurant.  Our server, Kate was amazing.  She was knowledgeable and quirky and gave great recommendations. To drink, my bf ordered a Negra Modelo and I ordered the watermelon basil mojito. It was delicious and also quite strong!  Maybe it was because I had skipped lunch that day but man it hit me fast!  We started with some chips and salsa and an order of grilled street corn cut off the cob.  Street corn is one of the foods that I can't resist and can be a make or break for me with Mexican restaurants.  The Mission's take on it was fantastic!  I can't emphasize enough how fresh the corn was.  So delicious!  
For our entree we split the pork shoulder tacos since an order serves 2 along with a side of white bean puree per Kate's recommendation. The meal comes deconstructed with a large serving of pork shoulder, a side of red onions, cilantro, cotija cheese and a pineapple habanero glaze with 10 small tortillas served on a Himalayan salt rock.  The pork shoulder was some of the best I've had and the pineapple habanero glaze provided the perfect balance of sweet and savory.  
Keep in mind when coming here that it is on the pricey side, especially compared to the portion sizes you receive.  The portions are definitely on the smaller side, but as far as quality goes, you get what you pay for.

I went here for dinner the other night and was pleasantly surprised. I was dining alone, but the patio with the fireplace was a nice quiet place to hang out, read a book on my Kindle, and have some tasty food. The prices were a bit crazy. I'm used to excellent restaurants that have talented chefs, but I thought the prices were a bit much. I ordered a Margarita. It was $14. I expected more than 2 oz. of Margarita in an 8 oz. glass FULL OF ICE. It was an OK Margarita, but not worth $14. Chicken soup was very tasty, and the Chipotle Caesar had interesting flavors. 

So, apart from the ridiculously overpriced drink, I think it's a perfectly nice place to eat. Be prepared to spend about $50 per person (minimum). Unless you just have an entree and a glass of water.

I've been here about 10 times and I would have to say the quality has really dropped dramatically in the last month or so really disappointed I'll try back in a month or 2 because I really want to like this place

Whenever we have guests visit us, we always take them here.  I love their food, I love their atmosphere and they have such a great wine list.  Honestly, I loved everything that they have. We always get their Guac, their pork shoulder is always fantastic and I love churros.  I think this restaurant is a great way to introduce people to Mexican/Hispanic food that has been elevated to the next level.  Make reservations though, because otherwise you could be chilling at the bar for quite a while.  Though with their Briar Rose and wine list, it wouldn't be such a bad punishment.

Absolutely do not miss this gem!! I seriously think I could eat here every day. The guys at the bar make amazing drinks and the menu will NOT disappoint! The merlot braised short ribs was fantastic and we had a hard time deciding! Don't miss the street corn!

Since The Mission is getting ready to celebrate their one year anniversary, I figure it's time for an update.  I went in for my first visit last November, shortly after they opened, and I've been in countless times since.  The atmosphere is amazing, the staff welcoming, the food unique and tasty... oh, and the drinks go down easy too!

The Mission has become Jared's second home - he's there much more than I am!  I go for an occasional drink or dinner.  My favorite menu item is the tableside prepared guacamole.  It's fantastic!  I am also a huge fan of the white bean puree, the street corn, and the salmon.  I wish they had some lighter options on the menu though - just a suggestion on behalf of those of us that are health-conscious!

If you enjoy Latin-inspired fare, for sure go check out The Mission... Or at the very least, go in for a drink and some guacamole.  Look for Jared at the bar when you're there!

I"ll for sure be excited to celebrate The Mission's one year anniversary in late October.  I'm sure it will be one helluva party!  It always is at The Mission!

Highly recommended for Latin American food, but make reservations.  We went for dinner on 4th of July.   The dining area was pretty dark, but I later realized it was because we were outside and our eyes needed time to adjust.  I loved the black chandeliers everywhere.  Very lively atmosphere.

I started off with the Watermelon Basil mojito.  Very refreshing!  The table next to us had ordered the tableside guacamole so although we had chips, salsa and guacamole for a snack earlier in the day, we had to get some.   We ordered medium spice and it had a good kick to it.  They do make it in front of you and for 2 people, it was a whole lot of guacamole!  

For appetizers, we ordered the Duck Confit Empanadas, which ended up sounding better than it tasted.  It was not the pie crust dough like most empanadas.  Instead, it was like crispy wontons.  The crust was overcooked and it came with a sweet sauce so I felt like I was eating Chinese food instead of Latin American.  That was a disappointment!

By then, we were pretty full so although we ordered two types of tacos, we ended up canceling one.  We just had the Mahi Mahi tacos which were Tecata battered with a nice sauce.  It came with 3 street size tacos.  It was delicious.  The table next to us ordered the Pork Shoulder tacos which serves for 2.  That looked good as well as it came with a whole chunk of braised pork.  If we were hungry, we would have ordered that.  

Overall, service was great.  Enjoyed most of the food and drinks.  If it wasn't for the duck empanadas, I would have given them 5 stars.

My wife & I dined for dinner. We are vegetarians & we were accommodated, though I do wish they had more vegetarian & eggless options the menu & were more mindful of not frying vegetarian items in oil where non-vegetarian items are fried. We had guacamole (this is prepared in front of you with you picking what you want in it), street corn, & kale salad. We were not happy to be charged $12 for corn tortillas to replace the meat oil fried corn chips, but our server offered to take it off the bill. The ambiance is really nice inside or in the back courtyard (they have warmers if you go outside). This is located in Old Town Scottsdale.

I went to the Mission with a group of 7 girls. We were a large group but since it was restaurant week, we thought it would not be too complicated for us all to enjoy a great meal with no issues. 

The decor of this place is beautiful! It is so cool and so hip! I loved it but keep it mind it is pretty dark. There is a great little patio in the front of the restaurant, a bar with some seating available, and a small to medium sized main dining room. 

The restaurant week menu was very enticing and I was immediately drawn to the Ahi Tuna appetizer, halibut entree, and churro expresso dessert. Unfortunately, they were out of the Tuna (which our server did not tell us until we were all ready to order. I ended up getting the pork belly salad which was yummy but we were a little annoyed we were not told up front that the restaurant week menu was limited. But no big deal, not the end of the world. We all ordered and were enjoying our cocktails when the waiter came back and said the kitchen only had two halibuts left and three of us had ordered it. It was disheartening to change my order yet again. I ended up ordering the filet. To be fair, it was amazing. Whatever they put in it rub seasoning was fantastic! I just had my heart set on the tuna and the halibut. (I have been studying the menu on-line days in advance!) The three desserts: expresso churro, fried bananas, and pumpkin bread pudding were all OK, nothing spectacular. We did get a free mini margarita with our meal but I am pretty sure there was no alcohol in it. 

The staff was very polite and the place was packed. It was overall a great time but I have to go with 3 stars instead of 4 or 5 because I was forced to order things that I was not intending on having. They should be pretty stocked up considering how popular restaurant week is. Additionally, if they were out of something, it would have been nice if they could have offered an alternative third app. 

I would go back because it was a great location, nice staff, cool place, and really good steak!

Had a lovely dinner on the heated patio last evening. Love how they have shawls on the backs of chairs for guests who might be chilly. Our waitress made great recommendations- from drinks to their soup. We shared the pork tacos with a side of white bean stuff. It was great spread over the tacos. My boyfriend drank a briar rose- a bourbon based cocktail with hibiscus syrup- while I had a blood orange margarita. Both were yummy- I don't love margaritas, but loved mine so much I had two. Our table side guacamole was incredible- some of the best I've ever had. But what killed me was how good their wings were. My boyfriend was in heaven. It's a little loud, so be prepared if that's a concern.

From the moment we were seated, this was a solid "2-star" place. Terrible service, no greeting from the hostess, over 15 minute wait before we got our water and placed our orders. Honestly, I wanted to walk out at one point. But as soon as those chicken tacos were placed in front of me, my mind was changed. The food alone was enough to earn The Mission two more stars. The only problem I had after that point was that I didn't have twelve more tacos waiting for me.

The Mission is wham, bam, thank you ma'am.  I absolutely love this place.  It's perfect SW food and even more so for the spicy food lover.  When you go for dinner, make sure you get there a little bit early and imbibe in a couple of drinks from their very experienced and knowledgable bartenders.  Yes, they can even make you an Avocado Margarita.  Sounds gross doesn't it?  Give it a try. 

A couple of must-try's on the appetizer menu include the Street Corn (it's a bit sweet but very flavorful) and the Lamb Ribs, which is one of the tastiest things you will ever eat.  The entree menu is filled with several excellent choices- my two favorites are the Chilean Salmon and the Chorizo Pork Shoulder.  Both are melt-in-your-mouth amazing.  Make sure you add the poblano grits for a side.  

As for dessert, well I'm usually back at the bar drinking mine.

My 3 year old (going on 10) daughter accompanied myself and a friend from out of town last Thursday ( around 7:30 pm).  There was a 45 minute wait for seating inside: we opted for the patio.  The ambiance is great in and out! I loved it!  The staff (hostess, server, busers & manager) were all VERY attentive! Service is outstanding! 

I want to emphasize how AMAZING our server was!   She was so attentive to my daughter's needs: which, was a wonderful surprise seeing as it's not really a child friendly restaurant (would have never known by the star treatment our server gave her)! My daughter had a good time and enjoyed her specially made dinner at the request of our server! 

Last,but not least, the food was delicious!  :)

Practically a landmark in Old Town Scottsdale, this place is lively and charming, with charm with a great atmosphere. The menu is a nicely executed update on traditional Mexican food. The tacos are delicious! Wait times can be long without reservations, but what great place doesn't have have that minor inconvenience.  Great drinks are abundant, as is the friendly staff. Tables can be close to each other and it's often difficult to have a conversation. For that reason it's best to bring sometime with whom a conversation is not necessary; or just be quiet and eat!

In town for a conference and found this place on yelp. 
Don't waste your time or your $. Took forever to be seated and that's after we reminded the hostess (I use the term loosely) twice that we were waiting.  
The guacamole was just ok, nothing special. We had the steak tacos and all we could taste was the liquid smoke. TERRIBLE. (We have a smoker and know what real smoke tastes like.) 
Plus it was SO loud we couldn't even hear the waitress. S L O W to get our food and even slower to bring the check and cash us out.
 Then the kicker was the toilet seat in the bathroom was smeared with poop.....GROSS!! 
That's 3 hours of my life I'll never get back.
Took a late lunch here and indulged in appetizers. Fantastic! If you want a truly authentic meal, try The Mission!

I was here shopping in Scottsdale's Old Town just around lunch time. I got hungry so I checked the best place for lunch in the area on Yelp and found The Mission, was highly rated. It was across the street from where I was standing so we headed that way.

When we arrived we were able to get a table in the outside courtyard in the front of the restaurant. We informed the waiter we had very little time for lunch. The three of us ordered margaritas with salt at $8 each. They charged an extra $2 for one with Cointreu. We ordered two Almejas Al Vapor stews for $14 each and one shaved Kale salad for only $10. The shaved kale salad consisted of aji amarillo vinaigrette, baby heirlooms, blood orange, goat cheese & marcona almonds. My friend loves kale. The Almejas Al Vapor is a peruvian clam stew, rock shrimp, chorizo, pan de yucca, aji amarillo & roasted corn. I especially enjoyed the unusual appearance and spice of the stew. See my pic. The stew made me want to go to Peru for some more. I have never been to Peru. 

The waiter was very expeditious in serving us.

My total bill for the three of us for lunch was a very reasonable $69 without gratuities and we were all happy with our meals, margaritas and service.

Very disappointed in this highly rated restaurant   Arrived at the Mission without a reservation and was told that we would have a two hour window before a large party would be arriving.  This timing changed by 30 min which lead to a very rushed and un satisfying experience 
We felt rushed , we felt that there was an effort to upchage drinks and other parts of the meals 
It was like eating at the end of the assembly line 
While the manager acknowledged our unhappiness he did nothing to resolve the problem 
When leaving he said come back and I will  buy  you dinner.  He will not have to worry about this 
Rushed ,dark ,cramped setting  with a confusing menu that left us totally unsatisfied
Amazing restaurant .. The margaritas were awesome and the pozole was the best I have ever had !
Beautiful atmosphere!! Amazing ambiance, great wine selection. I ordered the Posole, which I love Posole, but theirs was too greasy. The pork was pretty lean though. But wont get it again.
Restaurant is beautiful. Food can be pricey but is very good. Service was okay. I Recommend a reservation.

Spinach and date salad was excellent!
Short rib tacos were the best I have ever had!
I didn't enjoy the shrimp appetizer.  My friend ordered it and I had a bite.  Shrimp was very fishy.
Table side guacamole was very good.  Serve left the hot peppers out for us per our request.
Chips and salsa were excellent.  Salsa had a nice smokiness to it.
One person orders flat iron steak and said it was the best he'd had.

VERY dark inside.  Servers were a little busy and not very friendly.  The short rib barbados tacos were worth the trip!

My husband and I have been wanting to try this place since we moved to the area.  We didn't have a reservation so we went for an early dinner at 5:00PM.  The hostess asked if we had a reservation and we did not and she said she could seat us but we had to be gone by 6:30.  I understand her concern, but the place was 25% full, and who takes more than 1.5 hours for dinner?  We didn't start out with the best experience.

Then we ordered the fresh guacamole and it was probably the best i have ever had - i highly recommend it!

I had the Grouper which was great, but my husband had "the chef's favorite dish to make" the pork shoulder with chorizo and it was below average.  Dry and lacked flavor.

I had to ask for another glass of water because my glass had a huge crack down one side.

The couple next to us ordered the salmon (i think) and it smelled awful when they brought it out to the table.  Everyone in the restaurant turned to look to see what it was and my husband and i almost decided to leave, but stuck it out.

I don't think we will be back except for the guacamole maybe.  I've also heard the tacos are good, but we didn't try them.

Cool place with outside patios on both sides. Came here during the Street Eats and Taco Truck Festival so it was cray...waited for about 25 mins for a table even though there were multiple tables open. When asked, the host said the kitchen's backed up. The manager seated us immediately when he noticed us waiting. The manager was super attentive.

The food was good here. Best guacamole I've ever had! The spices and pumpkin seeds worked amazingly with the chillies....ah I want some so bad right now!  

My skirt steak was just ok...very chewie but it's not the best cut of steak overall. Didn't get pics of the tacos we had but my pork belly cubano was awesome! It was sooooo good! I didn't get an egg like the picture on the menu tho...not sure why. Anyways, this place is cool and would def come back!

I have been to several UYE's but this was my first office hours so it almost makes it an OYE.  I got to meet several folks I had not met before and see others that I had.  The nice thing about Yelp events is for the most part they are filled with people who really want to be there rather than having to be there because of work or family or some other obligation.  Gabi is a wonderful hostess.  Not familiar with where I was going I made parking harder to find than I needed to.  I passed on the tequila as I wouldn't know a good one from a bad one, and I had to navigate home.  I had a great time.  Thanks Gabi for putting it together.

Wow, the SW food was some of the best I have experienced in this part of the U.S. Everything was fresh and made to order. Our waiter Angel was very attentive and knowledgable about the menu and ingredients that went into everything we ordered.
A couple of call outs: table side quacamole, white bean purée, squash tacos and the Mahi Tacos.
It is worth the trip!

So much has been said and written about this wonderful establishment, I am not sure how much I can add except we concur with all the positive accolades. Great vibe, great food, great guacamole, great tacos, great margaritas and great staff. This is a must visit for locals and tourists.
This place is good.... not sure why the hype.. the table guacamole is awesome.... I got the pork tacos and they were a bit greasy.   Give this place a try .. love to see local businesses succeed
Absolutely the best guacamole in Old Town. Upscale and happening spot, and excellent cocktails!

we came here with a group that i work with.  I am very impressed with the architecture and decor.  our waiter was a young man named sam (I am) who was very entertaining and knowledgeable.  He suggested a tequila I had never heard of, it was very good.

i shared the pork shoulder, thinking it would be huge, but it was not that much food.  still, very high quality and many new flavors.  

as with other reviewers i am completely addicted to the pumpkin pudding.

for those of you who like tequila, this is the place.  i think i counted about four dozen different kinds.  (but no jose Cuervo reserva de familia, the very best in all the land!)....also flights of tequila so you can sample.

altogether, the mission is a delight, especially if others are footing the bill!

mike

I met a decent sized group of people at The Mission for a Sunday brunch and it was a treat.

My friend and I each had the Chicaquiles, which were prepared wonderfully and served very promptly (hot plate!). I had a mimosa while waiting and while it was very good, with fresh squeezed orange juice, the eleven dollar setback for a single drink was a bit much. While we waited, the wait staff brought out a guacamole cart and prepared a bowl of it especially for us based on what we wanted in it. The ingredients looked very fresh and the guac was delicious.

I decided on some coffee with my breakfast and I must recommend it to anyone who enjoys a brunch with some java. Apparently (as told by our waitress) the coffee is a blend prepared for The Mission exclusively. It was definitely a highlight during the meal.

Our group ordered almost one of everything from the brunch menu and I heard no complaints about quality, quantity or freshness of what we received. I'm sure I will make another visit to this lovely establishment in the coming months, when I do, I'll be sure to update my review and add any new comments.
Went with a large group. Preset menu, underwhelming, service was sub par, food was decent, and way over priced at $135 a person (for the quality of food and service exemplified). Don't recommend.

This is the real deal - the straight up tastiest tacos in the valley. We went on a business lunch (5 of us) and ordered some of everything. My favorite were the pork - the right combo of crunch, sweet, tender meat, spice - amazing.
