We were able to sit at a table in the bar- no big deal. The table side guacamole was good- I really like when you can see whats going in it and choose what ingredients you don't want. I ordered the short rib tacos which were great. They were on the sweeter side, but not too sweet. Our waitress suggested the corn to go with my meal. It had a creamy sauce and was spicy, but I really enjoyed it. My husband got the skirt steak tacos and grits. He also really enjoyed his meal. Overall is was great food- I just felt it was a bit pricey for the amount of food you get.

Don't expect burritos etc, but much more creative dishes with a mexican take.  You might browse right by it, but it would be a serious oversight not to consider the mind blowing Kobe hotdog.  

Great bartenders, one who took considerable time to talk tequila with us.  All around fantastic experience.

This place is about as cool as they come, great decor, awesome lighting - you can tell they spent a lot of time and attention to detail. Food is great, LOVED the tableside guac and the cocktail menu is fun, different and reasonably priced for such a great joint in Old Town.

Amazing food and delicious skinny margaritas!  Julian, our table side attendant, not only made a perfect guacamole, he over heard me talking about salsa verde to my husband and next thing we knew it magically appeared.  Rich, our waiter was spot on with his drink recommendations as well as directing us toward the slow roasted pork tacos for two.  Only down side was the price of the drinks and the "burn and turn" feel.  While staff was very friendly and attentive...The Mission did not feel like a place to comfortably linger over a meal.

First time here! I loved the chips - they have a nice smokey flavor! The tableside guacamole was delicious, fresh, and unique. I had the butternut squash tacos - also very yummy! They are very small but you get three. I got the mission fries with it which is a mix of potato and sweet potato fries with a yummy mustard sauce and is a huge portion. The white bean purée is also delicious! 

The margaritas are good and strong!

My only complaint is that it took an hour after we ordered to receive our dinner.

Overall - great experience!

We had lunch here after conquering Camelback Mtn...  ; )

The table side made guacamole is OUTSTANDING...my wife got the steak tacos and really like them and I got the pork tacos and they were okay.  The tacos portions are smaller, but the prices are fair, the service is really good and the guacamole is well worht the trip!

Fantastic experience. Food was great. Teq flights wonderful. Only criticism was the service. The server who did the table side guacamole was totally disinterested, and void of personality.  This could be a 'real show' opportunity, and she was quite dull. Otherwise, a great meal.

Semi empty for lunch, but there was 15 min wait.  We were not in hurry so no biggie, but we left because woman at front desk & bartender not happy or interested in making us comfortable for our wait for table.

My husband and I came to The Mission as a getaway from the kids and just a night out. It was a perfect place for a nice little date with the love of my life. It wasn't too loud there, the service was good and on point, and their food was delicious. If you are looking to come here on a date or with a friend, this may be the place your looking for! I just wouldn't recommend bringing your kids
Chipotle Grits  way  way way too watery. flavorless steak tacos. Great shrimp. Guacamole ok,salsa ok,margaritas ok Bloody Mary blah.Service was great and parking was good.

Eclectic menu and food was good.  Always love tableside-made guacamole made exactly as we wanted it.  I had a Kobe bacon-wrapped hotdog on a brioche bun with avocado whole pintos.  A bit pricey but yummy.  Sat outside in the beautiful patio area.  Inside also was just as stunning.
Mediocre and overpriced food. Horrifically slow service. The flies in our food didn't help either.  (We dined indoors.) Never coming back.

The mission was amazing. The atmosphere was wonderful and romantic. The food was just as wonderful. The table side guac was delightful and their filet was a great cut and was cooked perfectly. I would recommend this to anyone.

It was great! We were for dinner and I really recommend this place! The food it's absolutely delicious, true Mexican food, the waiters are so kind and the drinks are so good!!! And the prices are amazing!!

Great food, pretty terrible service. We ordered guacamole and we had to ask 4 times before we received it. Of course after finally getting the quac our meal came. The tacos we ordered cane as beef and of course we ordered chicken. So we had our appetizer at the same time as our meal. We also ordered fries and of course we never received that! We gave up at that point. We then proceeded to ask for our check and that took us 3 times to ask and of course when we received it they charged us for another meal that we didn't order. That took 15-20 to get settled. Embarrassing

Only reason it deserves 3 stars is because of the food. If you can handle the frustration of the service I guess you should come here. Probably not worth it. This is Scottsdale there are plenty of other Mexican restaurants.

Great food, nice ambiance.  

Hope it's just a rumor that this restaurant isn't doing well and will be closing down soon.  

I understand the economy has been devastating the past few years.  I've seen far too many great restaurants close.

Hope this one won't be another casualty...

Yummy Guacamole, and they even ask you how spicy you would like it.  I ordered hot and got exactly what I wanted. The best I have had in Phoenix.

They brought over their hottest salsa, it was TOO HOT!  Holy cow, be careful on that one.  The burn doesn't go away for a while, my eyes were running it was so hot.  

The prices could be a little less expensive, but overall, I will be back.  Great for date night.  The bar staff was awesome, great service overall.

My coworkers and I held our annual Holiday Party at The Mission and we could not have been happier! Timo was our server and he was incredibly knowledgeable, thorough and funny! We are a tough crowd and definitely gave him a hard time (jokingly) and he dished it right back; awesome service! The food was flavorful and serving sizes were true to a lunch menu. The Sangria was delicious and the salsa was so good I tried to buy some for home. THANK YOU to The Mission Old Town for making our Holiday Party fun, we left with full bellies and smiles on our faces!
Food was amazing, ambience was swanky, menu was pricey but definitely worth a visit! Pork shoulder tacos and tableside guac were on point

Great food and could have been a even better atmosphere except that it was way too dark.   I could not see the food at all.  It tasted great but I'll never know what it looked like.     In order to read the menu you will need a flashlight. Just turn up the lights for a perfect 5 star review

My hubby, a friend and I went there for Yelp Restaurant Week (I'm just a procrastinator) for dinner.  I had been there for lunch which I really enjoyed, but the dinner was delicious.
We each had something different on the tasting menu so we got to try many dishes at once.  The drinks were sooooo good and the desserts were to die for.  OK, we'll be going back and making The Mission a household favorite.

I read the yelp reviews and had high expectations. Great social setting and really good ambiance. Nice selection of margaritas  which is a must for a good Mexican restaurant. The claimed house special is pork shoulder. Unfortunately, I came away disappointed. It was dry from the long smoke which means the meat was not wrapped or injected. Apps were good to very good and the guac was very good. Nice blend of jalapeños, Serrano and chipotle purée. Overpriced but at least every dish is made to order.

I can't wait to come back and sit on the patio when the weather is cooler. It's huge and lit up with beautiful lights. Service was nice, food even better. Only complaint was the weather was hot so we we tightly squeezed into the small indoor area. Wait till it's tolerable to sit outside and you will love it.

Overall a nice evening.
We made a reservation and arrived on time. We were placed with children section while many tables up front were available. Did I say were in the back. Noisiest place I've been in.
We finally convinced them to find us a table out back. We went to the bar ordered a drink and magically a table opened up.
The house speciality crispy pork belly was not crispy just tasty. The rest of the meal was fair. 
Tourist trap

Best restaurant experience I have ever had, and I've been to some really amazing ones all around the world. Our server Jammar was the biggest reason for this. He really broke down and explained everything you needed to know about The Mission. From the restaurants history, to the chef, to the food. He was totally on point with all his recommendations and knew exactly when we would want our next course. We started off with the table-side guacamole that was by far the best guac you could possibly ever have. In addition to that Jammar also recommended street corn dip which really balanced the heat of our guacamole. For dinner we had the pork shoulder tacos which were melt in you mouth good. Finally, for desert Jammar brought us their pumpkin bread pudding. Best dessert I've had in awhile.  It was truly an incredible dinning experience.

Very overrated.   Rude and very full of themselves.  Have been many times before but are not worth the money.  Many better places in Scottsdale to get good mexican food.  Don't waste your time or money on their schedule.
Simply love it! Great margaritas and creative dishes. On the pricey side but totally worth it.

No complaints here! The lady sitting next to us suggested the pork shoulder tacos for 2. Apparently, that is their signature dish. It was super good. We also got the poblano grits- ummmm yum!
Dark inside... but nice overall. Yay for date night

I thought we were going to have a problem because two out of the four diners were picky eaters.  However, everyone was happy with the appetizers and the meal. Our waitress Amber was fantastic.  Her descriptions and recommendations of the apps and entrees made ordering much easier.  Her attentiveness and her energy made our night even better.  I would recommend this restaurant.

Went there in March 2015 after a Giants Spring Training game, as we did the previous year.  Not sure what happened, but the food is just not all that.  The guac was OK, the drinks were too measured.  No need to go back there next year.

No availability via Open Table but was able to snag a Monday reservation for 4 by calling the Mission directly.  I was asked if there was any special celebration and I responded that we were celebrating my Dad's 81st birthday.  We also mentioned "birthday" when chatting with our waiter.  I was disappointed that there was no acknowledgement or offering of a birthday dessert.

The interior was so dark it was a struggle to read the menu.  This wasn't just a "mature eyes" problem - there was a near-by tweenager using his cell phone flashlight to read his menu.  The place was also very loud making it difficult to converse.  Our waiter was good at adding extra dollars to our bill - we were asked if we wanted our margaritas with Grand Mariner not realizing that we would be paying for both a margarita and a shot of Grand Mariner, and when my dad was asked if he wanted tortillas with his entree we didn't realize that this was also an add-on.  It was very busy and our waiter was not very attentive to us. 

The tableside guacamole wasn't - it was too crowded to fit the cart by our table although the result was tasty.  My father raved about his chorizo porchetta, and my mom and I were very happy with our diver scallops.  My husband's fish entree was also very tasty.  I'm glad we ordered a number of sides as the portions were quite small.

Overall, not the birthday dining experience that I had hoped for.
Food was great. Loved the guac and corn (off the cob) apps. Mahi, grilled chicken, skirt steak, best tacos in order

Our waiter was so rude that a table next to us asked for a new one, he then alienated another table to the point where they were so pissed that they stiffed him on a tip. He was somewhat normal with us but the vibe was so weird we couldn't really relax. The drinks and food were pretty decent but nothing to write home about. The guacamole was really good and the atmosphere was nice which redeemed the experience somewhat.

Got to this place at around 4:30pm and they told us they don't start serving dinner until 5. We had to order from the lunch menu which is pretty small and didn't offer much more than 3 or 4 types of tacos. The guac was.. Different - not horrible but not amazing either. If you're in the old town area I would recommend Barrio Queen which is down a short distance away.

A modern take on traditional Latin cuisine, the Mission is a perfect option to try something a little different while in Scottsdale. From start to finish I was impressed. Our group enjoyed a 3-course meal which included a sweet, savory and crunchy pork belly lettuce wrap. It was heavenly. Second came the kale salad. I wasn't too much of a fan, but it seemed to pretty popular with my dining companions. It's probably a matter of preference as it was accompanied with a unique tangy dressing. Lastly, we had various tacos. Sounds simple, but they were a far cry from your typical tacos. Seasoned, juicy and garnished with toppings the chicken, beef and pork were anything but ordinary. On top of great food, the ambiance is reason enough to drop by. Apparently Autumn in Arizona means pretty much perfect weather. Their gorgeous patio is a large, romantic dining option that added that much more to our overall experience.

We celebrate bday for good friend 
The mission hit the spot, the food  the atmosphere and all the rest was super.... will get back there soon

Very tasty, but over priced... guacamole is made table side and is very good. Not a big tequila fan, but if you are I hear they have a great selection. Cool part of town, good lunch spot if you don't mind dropping a few dollars.

No Bueno! Very small portions, food is so-so and server had an attitude. We went there last year and had a good experience so we were looking forward to revisited.  Very disappointed. We had the tostadas, the grouper, two types of tacos, the pork shoulder and the braised ribs. THEY WERE THE SMALLEST PORTIONS I've ever seen! The food wasn't good. The much talked about table side guacamole was tasteless.  The place is small and wayyyyyy over crowded and very loud.

If your looking to impress a lady friend this by far has a great atmosphere. However it can be a little noisy weekends so it may be a little difficult to communicate on a date or whoever your company is. The only things I would say is your going to have to pay to really enjoy the Mexican food. It's fine dining Mexican and yes it exists believe or not in Scottsdale. No 2.50 bean burrito is sold here. Anyway I had the soup which was rich and creamy with seafood mixed in but not worth $14. The chips and salsa were tasty and the hot salsa was very good with a kick. Portions are small yet very filling. Another con is the seats are hard and not very comfortable. I saw some people getting they're cell phones out to look at the menu because it's so dark inside. So if you get to dine in the patio do it because it's a great atmosphere. My server was black and very professional he knew the menu hands down and was on top of our table the whole time.

Dude, this joint has a HIMALAYAN SALT WALL...THAT PEOPLE ACTUALLY LICK.  

Yes, let that sit with you for a second.  Strangers, lick a wall, over and over and over...and over...lick.

Supposedly, it has antibacterial properties. Still, I won't be licking the wall.  

This joint is cool.  Decor is dark wood, candlelight tables, and swanky music pumping in the background. The staff is attentive. 

The star of this meal:  Roast Corn Gorditas. AMAZING.  Highly recommend this trio of goodness.  However, this shouldn't be all you get.

The shaved kale salad had a kick, courtesy of the dressing. The portion is big and can easily serve 3.

Notable mentions: Cheese plate, chicken tacos, and table side Guacamole. 

Props to the staff for correcting a snafu with one of our meals and being attentive. When one of our dishes came out with an "unexpected" addition, they corrected it immediately by offering us a replacement and comping dessert.  

We didn't oblige, but appreciated the server and managers quick attention to rectify the situation.

Dope restaurant, and highly recommend if you are in old town Scottsdale.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. Honestly, I hesitate to write a review because it will only make it more difficult to get in. :-)

But, honestly. Great food. Great atmosphere. AMAZING staff. Love them. Love this place. It's my home away from home. xo
The best Mexican food I have ever had!  I had chicken tacos, husband had steak tacos. Pumpkin bread pudding was off the hook!  Service 5 stars!  Definitely will be coming back!!

Believe every good review you see on here, and get your tail down to the Mission!

Try the pig roast on a Sunday.....

Have a romantic dinner with your special someone....

A nice family get together....OR....

Have a kick ass wedding on their patio out back!

We had the best time with family and friends at the Mission on St. Patrick's Day, March 17th 2011.  We invited just over 50 people, and the patio was the perfect size, and that included having one the best chefs in PHX manning the grill, and putting out creative freshness on every plate.

The staff was nothing short of awesome, serving with a smile the entire night, and they seemed to be having just as much fun as we did.

We had a very special 3 days, and The Mission was right up there at the top bracket...just behind the ceremony next door.

Now stop reading these things and make a rezzie!

This place is awesome, some of the best southwestern food in the Valley, some of there meats are awesome.  I can almost live on the enture app menu without even hitting the dinner menu.  The margs are also fantastic.

Each dish is made with precise flavorings.  Come here if you want to taste a nice Latino dish that's not typical with sauces and salsas. 

the servings sizes are enough to share and savor.

Very much enjoyed my dinner experience here. My favorite dish of the evening was, by far, the Duck Carnitas Empanada (duck confit, foie gras, orange habanero glaze, oregano, mushroom & queso Oaxaca). It's so rich and flavorful that you're going to have to order it, no matter what.

Other recommendations:
Shaved Kale Salad
Crispy Pork & Cola Lime Glaze
Short Rib Barbacoa

Short and simple. The food is worth it and the ambience is perfect for a date night. If you're looking for the wow factor then please make a reservation at The Mission. Bread pudding was to die for. Our server was pretty bad but he might have just been having an off night. Definitely worth checking out for a special night out.
Very upscale spanish fusion food, everything will be top notch, service, drinks, food. It will be rich and seasoned, not for the lovers of bland.

This place is over-rated!  It is Cinco De Mayo at about 4:30.  The place is empty for all practical purposes.  We're told unless we have a reservation, they can't seat us. So we're pointed to the bar area. It is now 6:30 and the dining tables are still half empty.  This is a good indication of bad management.  One doesn't tell a customer they can't be seat and must go to the bar to eat and then 2 hours later those same table are sitting there empty. 

The drinks are watered down and extremely pricey.  It is one thing to charge a high price (small Margarita $13 and a Mojito watered down $13) and to give value, it is another thing to rip-off the customer. 

The guacamole needed help as well.  We had to send it back to the kitchen for help.  You need to add Cilantro, onions, salt, etc. to the product, otherwise you may as well be eating raw avocados. 

The fish tacos were good I thought, but my wife hated them. The duck empenada was different.  I didn't like it, but my wife did. 

The service was slow to get to us, but once it did it was good.

I wouldn't go back to this restaurant.

Great food. Nice setting. I had the Jodie Chicken which was extremely well seasoned. It was served on a fantastic paella like rice smothered with Oaxaca cheese.... sounds rich but this was delightful to my palette.  The table side guacamole is a must.  We had it spicy and it set the tone for a flavorful meal to follow.  ....this is definitely a place to revisit.  The wait staff was very knowledgeable, attentive and helpful.

We live this place. The duck empanadas are so yummy!  Margaritas are great too. And don't skip the tableside guacamole! A friend of ours came to dinner Weds night with us, he said I don't like guacamole but I'll try it. He now likes guacamole!

Meh food and drinks, oh and bring a flashlight they keep the place pitch black. Sometimes seeing your food adds to the flavor perhaps that part of the problem. We had the skirt steak fairly mediocre. There are better both in Old Town and around Scottsdale
High quality good.  Very flavorful. Lights were very dim so bring a flashlight to see your menu and food.

I think I could have enjoyed my experience more here if I did not make an ordering mistake.   So overall I say 3.5 stars for my experience, but i can certainly see a 4 and 5 star review for this place.  

The table side guacamole was incredible...some of the best I've had.   I would say its a must-get every time you go.   Instead of ordering an entree I ordered two appetizers for my dinner.  The reason I did this is because I had these two apps suggested to me by several people - the pork belly pibil and the crispy cola pork.  As you can see, thats a lot of pork belly.  I ate the crispy cola pork first, and it was very tasty.  It was quite sweet from the cola, but it was a nice app.  I probably only ate 1/3 of the pork belly pibil, but like i said, I think i was just overwhelmed with pork belly.  It was a pretty big block of pork too, maybe enough for a meal in itself.  It was tasty as well, but certainly more fatty than its crispy counterpart. 

You can take my review for what its worth.  I'd say everything I got was worth getting again, but maybe just not all together.
Great food and atmosphere! One of my favorite in old town Scotttsdale. You won't be disappointed.

I love the tableside guacamole and would go there just to eat it even though the price is a bit much for it.  I've been there a couple of times and both times my food was very good.  I also like the atmosphere, it has a upscale but yet comfortable vibe.  The milkshake with churros we had at the end were oh so yummy!

This is really 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up.  The food is interesting--sort of a nouveau Latin cuisine with strong Mexican influences.  I'm only giving The Mission 3.5 stars because I thought the food was more beautiful than delicious.  My dad had the pork which was cooked appropriately for medium rare, but was a bit on the bland side.  I had the butternut squash tacos which looked wonderful--extremely colorful, but were also on the bland side in spite of the fresh lime wedges and slices of red chili (these tacos were also a bit pricey, $12 for 3 and the tortillas were the size of small sugar cookies).  My husband did seem satisfied with his hanger steak tacos.  Even though we planned on getting dessert, the consensus was that our dinner hadn't been particularly impressive so we opted to go elsewhere.
There are a lot of rave reviews on yelp for the guacamole.  It was good, but not phenomenal and, at $12, it tied for the most expensive guacamole I've ever had (tie with a Mexican restaurant in NYC).

this place is fantastic. fresh ingredients, authentic with a twist.
can't go wrong with this line-up:

Guacamole: chunky haas avocado + jalapeno + cilantro + sea salt + lime

Mahi Mahi Tacos: battered mahi mahi + citrus escabeche + olive crema

Green Chile Duck Confit: cheesy fried hominy + smoked mushrooms + sultana serrano peanut mole

enjoy!

First time here this evening.  I'm in awe. The crispy pork belly with cola lime glaze is the bomb! The duck empanada with foie gras is delicious... The table side guacamole is amazing!!! I order the skirt taco for my entree but had to take it home there was sooooo much food. So I ate it cold 2,hours after and it was still delicious! I didn't expect to have such delicious food here. My hubby ordered the porchetta and he loved it! I had a piece and if I only had more room in my stomach I would have had it too.. Our 10 year old daughter was feeling vegetarian and ordered the roasted organic butternut tacos.. She devoured it!!! ... Will be back!!!! ... P.s. no  food photos due to candle light.. Didn't want to ruin the atmosphere with the flash.

I had low expectations as all the places we had hit prior to the mission was whatever but this place gave me hope for AZ. We came here upon native recommendation. I brought my 8 month old and did not know in advance this is not a place to bring ur kid, although the waitress was super nice and understanding and they do have high chairs. It was so dark inside, that was the only annoying aspect of eating there. 
There were 5 of us and we shared a bunch of apps and one entree. We got crispy pork, duck empanadas. Street corn, pork shoulder tacos. Everything was delicious and very filling. I like the modern Mexican food. My mojito was nothing spectacular but I do really like this place.?
Best Guacamole ever! Service, menu and quality always on point. The original drinks are a plus too! Cant wait for the new location!

Came here a year ago, almost to date to celebrate my friends birthday and here we are again for another birthday dinner. I forget how much I like this place, a bit pricey, but the food, atmosphere and service has always been good. I had made an Open Table Saturday dinner reservations for 2. Daniel our server who made our evening experience enjoyable

Upon arrival we were greeted and seated toward the back, which was a better location than last time here. A bit loud when you sit near the bar area. We started off with Cocktails, Primarita ( tequila, organic agave nectar, pressed lime - no sugar, 1?2 the calories, all organic )
 and a Mezcal? Flight. The flight of 5 tasters, presented on a beautiful tray was big for our small table, we only had room for our Tableside Guacamole. Eventually we ordered our entrees, we shared was the Pork Shoulder for 2 and Green Chile Duck Confit (worked out perfectly because there were 2 duck legs). All the dishes were wonderful!  especially the Birthday Pumpkin Bread Pudding that came with a Sparkler at the end. 

Only Negative is the lighting. No food photos to go with the fan review and my friend and I had to use our phone flash light to read the menu.

Atmosphere: great, Service: excellent Food: very good.

Excellent Margarita (Primorita)  We shared the tableside guacamole, the corn gordita (comes with 3 we added an extra), the shrimp tacos (also comes with 3 but added an extra) and scumptious shrimp taco.  Everything was excellent.  Great ambiance and very nice waiter who gave us great advice, thankyou Angel!

The Mission is a great place. No excuse but today was a bit of a hit and miss. Arrived and the initial contact by the server was quite delayed. I would say he was maybe having a bad day or I made him mad somehow lol.  His name was Pepe. I overheard him introduce himself to another party which he did not do to us.  Maybe he was just hating for some reason  I ordered a corona and my tacos came out before I even got my corona. Whatta? We sat close to the bar/entrance so we were able to ask the hostess for help many times. I think she mention something to Angel, the manager. He immediately came over and gave us great service, apologized for the delays and poor service, offered me a free beer and a desert for my wife. He saved the day. Food and atmosphere incredible as always, skirt steak tacos and table side guac  Mission and Angel 5 stars! Pepe... wouldn't give him 1/2 a star

Loved the ambiance. Got the spicy guacamole and it was a 10. I got the blood orange margarita and my friend got the cucumber jalapeño margarita and both were delicious. We just stopped in for guac and some drinks but would definitely come back for dinner. The only complaint I had was the lighting was a bit dark considering we came in the afternoon
The quac is the best in town - they also have a prickly pear marg that's blended and is so tasty! The tacos are small but with an app are a decent meal

I love, love, love this place!!
We happened upon it right after it's opening & have been regulars ever since.
Everything about it makes me happy.  The cuisine is modern Latin fusion and it's sooo tasty and unique.  I try to order something different every visit and have yet to be disappointed.  The tequila selection and cocktails are one of a kind.  I highly recommend giving the blended ones a taste, even if they're described as spicy!
Prices are absolutely reasonable for what you get and the owners are just about always on the floor.
Go for drinks, small plates, brunch, lunch or dinner and you'll be satisfied.  The ambiance also lends itself to being a sexy, but cool date spot.  We've also brought some important clients for dinners there.
Very cool.

Overall this was very nice...ambience and decor was trendy and fit very well with local flavor/culture

Price range...4$$$$, as this place is expensive

Presentation...5 stars...plates food and seating are superb

Portion...small portions...eat something before you go here

Guacamole made tableside is good...asked for more...never got it...maybe it is rationed..

Once upon a time there was a man named Matt Carter who was hugely successful because he built a beautiful restaurant called Zinc Bistro that transported the diner to another world.  Today, Zinc is slipping and sadly, The Mission fails.  You will not be transported, but subsumed in noise and carelessness.  You might wait 90 minutes for your food ostensibly because the classically trained French chef wasn't satisfied with the initial effort.  Despite the redux due to someone's quest for perfection, the quality is inconsistent, vacillating wildly from damn good to downright shitty, but never sublime.  Matt doesn't need to worry though, because the throngs are here.
Street corn amazing! Table side guacamole awesome... lots of vegetarian options... food served quickly... everything with great depth of flavor

I'm def. a fan of this place. The food is awesome and the staff is super friendly.  Even the bussers will chat with you and smile. 

The atmostphere is awesome as well. With dark wood and low lighting, you do feel like you're in an old mission.

Great find in Scottsdale!

First visit to Scottsdale and The Mission should not be missed! Exquisite atmosphere with top notch service from the host, server and table side guacamole preparer. Obviously we had the guac which was to die for, impressed by the amount we were served. Being a fan a Mexican food these were thee best chips ever tasted throughout the US!
For our entree we ordered the pork shoulder tacos for 2 and The Mission fries.
Again, the servings were ample, the presentation was lovely and our tastebuds we're delighted with every bite!  
Mission is pricey but worth every penny!

Was in town and went with some friends and family.

The place feels like a New York restaurant.  Great ambiance.

Started with the grilled street corn, which they were nice enough to take off of the cob.  Was decent.  Could've been more spicy (although my order may have gotten mixed up with another diner who wanted less heat).  Had the duck confit for my main which was delicious.  We order the guac for the table.  Full disclosure, I didn't taste it, but it received a resounding "meh".  The salsa on the table was decent but nothing to write home about.

As for the drinks, I see others saying that they were watered down, which I have to agree with.  I had the smokehouse margarita which was not bad and the cilantro margarita which I couldn't taste.  

Overall decent dining experience (waiter was very attentive and helpful).  I'd give it another shot.

If you are 21 and don't know what good food is, but want to drink with your friends in a loud room, this is your spot.  "Soulless Mexican food" is the only way I can describe The Mission.  We had some tacos and guacamole that were expensive and really mediocre.  Drinks were fine but nothing great.  We sat in the courtyard patio area and busboys and waiters hovered annoyingly over our table for the duration of the evening.  It took ten minutes for us to be seated even though we had reservations and the restaurant was half empty.  I don't understand the appeal here at all.  Only way to justify the one star rating is the outdoor fireplace.

Ah the ambience of cacophonous blasting tunes like a Soderbergh soundtrack, the romantic hustle and bustle of sitting near a kitchen watching servers amble to and fro like hockey players during shift changes, the allure of being feet away from the prep station of the guacamole carts, the culinary joy of brittle greasy chips, cardboard like tortillas, flavorless chewy two bite tacos for $12 - all while basking in a cavelike decor.  

Next time I'll take $100, walk down the street to Wadaa and feed all the people at Whiskey Row some wicked good real street tacos.

Here for a long weekend and visited this great establishment!  Been here once before and loved it as well!  Had the Pork shoulder for two and it was amazing!  Drinks are yummy as well!!! Love the atmosphere!

Extremely good. Kinda pricey but if you want to do something nice and celebrating something go here. You will not get in without a reservation. I couldnt even get a reservation 2 days in advance. Go on sunday for pork taco all you can eat. For dinner get flat iron steak. The best part doe was the salsa with house chips

We came to The Mission for brunch at the end of our weekend stay in Scottsdale, bags in tow, before heading to the airport. They let us store our bags in a back corner and set us out on the patio. The whole patio is shaded. Although in hindsight it was a little too hot and we should have sat inside. It's decorated in the southwest, adobe style and was really beautiful.

The food was amazing. We got guacamole and the grilled street corn for appetizers to split and they were so flavorful! They make the guac table-side. The tacos were delicious! I tried the butternut squash, chicken, and mahi mahi (split with another person). The tacos are really small so keep that in mind when ordering! The mahi was probably my favorite. I don't usually like fried fish tacos but the breading on these wasn't too heavy!

Food was good, service was just ok. They were pretty slow and it wasn't that busy.
Highly recommend the guacamole, street tacos & 5 pepper soup. Love the ambience... Warm, elegant and always inviting!

I would give better review because their food is very good.  But, the restaurant is so dark at night, we cannot see any thing!!!  If I don't have a flesh light, I wouldn't be able to see what I was eating.  It was to a point of disturbingly dark.  We had a birthday celebration and none of us can read the cards nor see the gifts.  We had the flesh light turned on while the birthday girl opens her gift.  In no time, some one from two tables down came over told us to turn the light off!  Is such darkness necessary? 

I will not go back again, I don't want to eat in a dark cave!

Went here for lunch today after a Segway tour, the ambience is great, lowlit and has an upscale feel with affordable prices. It would be a great place to go on a date or out to dinner for ladies night. The chips were delicious and the salsa was too, it was a chipotle salsa which is different than the normal restaurant salsa. The guacamole is made freshly in  front of you and it was fabulous. I had the shrimp tacos and was very surprised at how tastey they were. They were upscale street tacos, battered in a sweet breading topped with cabbage, a heavenly sauce, cotijo cheese, avocado and a thin red bell pepper. They are tiny, but filling. I do wish the menu had more options and some healthier items for those who are health/carb conscious. The service was great! I wouldn't call this authentic Mexican food, but it was delicious and I will be back!

I'm giving this establishment a two star rating not for the food but for the customer service at the bar. But of course, one of the main reasons we came to the restaurant was because of the 4 star rating.  My husband and I always prefer to sit at the bar especially when we're out of town. We showed up before the busy time and there were still spots at the bar. You know how you can sense when someone is just not interested in you or simply have no interest in talking to you?  This pretty much sums up the bartender's attitude towards us.  We first asked if they had any specials going on and basically told us they did not.  Again basically with an attitude of "I don't really want to talk to you" or "Can you order your drink already so I can be done with you."  Since we we're already there we ordered one drink and left.

The service was excellent and the location was great in Old Scottsdale.  For the price, I was shocked at the small portions of food, although nicely presented.  I'm not a big eater, but after we ate an over-priced dinner, appetizer portions, we had to go elsewhere to eat.

Could not have been more satisfied!!
Tara, our server, was so kind! She did an awesome job recommending foods to us. We enjoyed all her recommendations. 
I enjoyed the flat iron steak. Wow!!
My girlfriend had the red snapper and she loved it!
Overall, an amazing dining experience. This is a fantastic restaurant.

Really enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere at this eatery! My companion and I tried the short rib and steak tacos - both were delicious. The poblano grits were just the right amount of creamy and amazing. Amber was very gracious and took good care of all of our needs. Definitely coming back here!

LOVED LOVED LOVED IT! Came on Saturday night for my cousin's bachelorette weekend celebration. We were in a group of 9, and all of us loved our meal choices! Definitely worth the price! I had the tostadas, delicious, and a few of us had the short ribs...AMAZING! The restaurant on the indside is really beautiful and great ambiance! I had asked for them to have balloons and flowers on the table when we arrived and it was really pretty, they did a great job!! Our server was sooo sweet!!  We had a great time! Highly recommended!

Absolute staple for everyone who comes to visit PHOENIX or Scottsdale. It's an elegant twist on southwestern cuisine that never disappoints. The tequila selection is by far amazing. Drinks and service never disappoint. Top 5 restaurant in the valley

My family was visiting AZ and we found this restaurant on Yelp.  It was outstanding.  We had lunch where we ordered steak and mahi-mahi taco's with a shrimp salad and guacamole appetizer.  We sat in the outside dining room and received excellent service and excellent food.  The banana foster with peanut butter flavored ice cream was delicious as were the chorizo's .  The food portions were also very good.  When you finished eating you were full but not stuffed.
Good food and great service. The facilities are amusing: a lighted wall of blocks of brazilian salt

Very rarely am I blown away by a restaurant (especially one out of town) as we are kind of Vegas Food Snobs but our experience here was amazing! Very high end southwest cuisine (no quesidillas or enchiladas in sight) go for the short ribs, filet and fried bananas (with peanut butter mousse, swoon)  and the tableside guacamole is the best I've had in my life!  In case you haven't been here before we were both exceeding impressed!

I have mixed feelings about this place. The setting could be called warm and romantic and the main attraction is the patio, which is hard to secure, so you will end up sitting in the loud inside area. 
I am not sure why the place is so popular. If you call, they are usually fully booked, but if you just walk in, there is a big chance you would be seated within 10 minutes. 
The décor is a mix of Latin and American steakhouse and doesn't have a unique identity in my opinion. It would definitely need a makeover to stay popular, given all the cool places that are popping up in the old town.
As for the food; I have been there three times already and the experience has always been average. Based on my last experience, I don't think I would go back. Most of our hot appetizers came late and cold. The taco dishes were mediocre and there were not enough staff to attend to our demanding party.

Great tacos and you can stop in the old mission next door to say a few prayers before or after your meal. Praying and eating is what makes you happy and healthy. A little expensive but lunch isn't so bad

I love a place that has excellent food, impeccable service and is in no way snooty. In Scottsdale I normally have my guard up at upscale restaurants, but this place totally put me at ease. 

I made reservations, which I would highly recommend since the dining area is surprisingly small. The decor is nice, a little on the dark side, but they have this cool wall around the kitchen of back-lit glass that provides just enough light. 

The cocktail list looked good, but opted for the red sangria, which was pretty good. 

For appetizers, we had the crispy cola pork belly. If you get nothing else, get this! The texture and flavors were amazing. We also had the duck empanada which was flaky and good, but the pork belly won hands down in the appetizer round. 

The Chorizo Porchetta was really flavorful and the meat was so tender you could eat it with a spoon. The white bean puree was our favorite side. We also got the creamy grits, there was just something off about these I couldn't put my finger on. The were slightly sour and only a little spicy. I kept eating them thinking they would get better, nope. 

The other thing we had were the scallops. The sauce was excellent and the scallops were cooked perfectly. The serrano ham on the scallops was a bit too crispy, and crumbled like bacon when I tried to cut it, I was trying to get a bit in every bite.

For dessert, the churros and milkshake finished things off well. Not too much, just right.
The Mission was tons of fun! Drinks were very good especially the jalapeño cucumber margarita. Tacos were solid. The duck empanadas were amazing. Wish the menu was longer.

Tableside guacamole was the best part, super delicious and made to order. Hot chips and bbq salsa. The food was extremely mediocre and the smallest portions I've ever seen. The street
Tacos were so small. 3 for $14, no thanks. I would like to try the crazy corn again but maybe just that. Skip the food. $50 for 3 tiny tacos and guacamole is not something I would do again.

What gem.  We were walking through Old Town and stopped in for street tacos. The atmosphere is fantastic and the food was even better. Ignore what you originally had in mind...... order the Brussels sprout tacos.  THEY WERE TO DIE FOR.  The Mexican street corn was on point as well. Table side guacamole is good, as expected, and the traditional margaritas are not overly sweet.

We had reservations for the patio a few months back. We arrived on time, we seated promptly at a nice table and brought water immediately. However. It went down hill from there fast. Two different servers came up and introduced themselves as our servers. It felt rushed. We gave one our drink order, only to have the other come up and ask what we would like to drink. What...? The wine came a long while later. We put in an order for a jidori chicken appetizer with a server and some guac made table side. Both were good. For dinner we ordered the diver scallops and another chicken item. Right after one server took our order for entrees, another came up and dropped off dessert menus. What...? Did we not get our entree order in? We will never be sure when the entree orders were put in. Did the server forget? Why did we get dessert menus? It took almost an hour for entrees to come out. Which was fine as the appetizers filled us up. But still. Both entrees were good but I've had comparable food with proper service at other places. My scallops were perfect although I realized I wasn't a big fan of the set it was with. Boyfriend liked his chicken. We were planning to get dessert but after all was said and done I was full and completely turned off by the service. Our bill was somewhere around $130 before tip. I've worked fine dining, I'm still a server. This was the worst service I've ever had, not because the people weren't nice but because it was so chaotic and stressful and the energy was reflected onto the guests. Def not worth $160, which is a lot to us. Lastly, I forgot my sweater there and didn't realize until we got home. I called the restaurant and the host said they had it. I gave them my name and number and said I would be in the following day. I went to pick it up the next morning and it was no where to be found. Kind of ridiculous if you ask me. Save your money. There are so many other wonderful restaurants in Old Town with service that isn't so stressful.
Amazing pumpkin bread pudding, but the skirt steak tacos took all the glory! Wash that down with blood orange and cilantro margaritas- pure heaven!

From the outside, this restaurant is beautiful. The patio is cozy & intimate. The inside is chic with authentic decor and fancy chandeliers. Unfortunately, the substance of the restaurant (food & drinks) fell flat. 

We sat on the patio for a late lunch so some of the items suggested by fellow Yelpers were not available on that menu. The restaurant was not very busy during this time so our service was quick and attentive. Here's the lowdown on what we ordered:

- Table-side guacamole: obviously b/c it was recommended by everyone here! The portion was just enough for 2 people but not outstanding at all. In fact, it was very bland (even with all the ingredients added to it). For $12, I expected much more.
- Short Rib Barbacoa Taco: topped with a massive slice of pickle on top, I wasn't sure if this was for presentation or they were too lazy to cut it into smaller pieces for easier handling. At least the pickle gave it some bite, which is more than I can say for the other Taco.
- Skirt Steak Taco: the steak was chewy and the taco as a whole was very bland. I had to dip it in the salsa that came with the guacamole to add taste to it. I wouldn't recommend ordering this on a date b/c you'll be too busy trying to chew the steak to talk.
- Drinks: Papaya blended margarita. They usually have 2 rotating flavors a day for frozen ones and she brought both out in a sample glass for me to try!

Overall, the experience here did not stand out and I found it to be quite pricey for what we got. Not only was the food mediocre but the portions were tiny. Perhaps the tacos should be recommended as an appetizer instead? Our food also came out almost immediately, which made me question how fresh prepared this place really is. Based on my skirt steak, I wonder if it was just sitting out on the counter all day. 

I was hoping to experience some outstanding, authentic Mexican food here but unfortunately I can recommend better ones in Vancouver!

Vegans/vegetarians get no love here, carnivores and tequila lovers..this is for you. My hubby and I came here for our anniversary and it was packed so we said we'd sit at a table at the bar. They smushed us into a corner with a wobbly table and no room for my hubby to stretch his legs so we decided to wait for a real table in the dining room which they were happy to accomodate. Restaurant and atmosphere is spot on and romantic. Amazing architecture and very polite staff.  

We got a tequila flight which was sloppily poured, each shotglass had differing levels of tequila which was the first turnoff. Then our vegetarian taco appetizer came which was like 3 mini dumpling sized buns with unseasoned veggie inside with no toppings. I figured ok, hopefully the main entrees make up for it..

my husband's plate arrived and it was very pretty and he loved it. My vegan tacos on the other hand were just as bland as the appetizers and was the exact same size as the appetizer!  I asked the server if there was anything else they could offer because I was not happy at all with my dish. He said he would talk to the chef and upon his return told me that was all they had to offer me and sorry.  Our bill ended up being well over $200 and it was definitely not worth it for being happy with 1 out of 3 offerings. .

I would get a picture taken in front of this place again because the building was very cool looking but I won't be stepping inside again.
Very cool ambiance. Table-side guac is great. The chef does anything pork very well. Had the pork belly last visit. Excellent!

The Mission is beautiful inside with baroque chandeliers, dark lighting and a salt wall (you can actually lick if you want). It's great for an intimate evening with a date, friends or a big group. Outside is nice as well, if you want a little less noise. 

I came for Restaurant Week 2009 with some family and friends. The hostess immediately greeted me and had my table set up and waiting. 

The potato side was awesome. I would have ordered a whole side of that, if I hadn't been ordering off the Restaurant Week menu. The bread pudding and banana desserts were really good. 

The proportions were just the right size, not too big, not too small. Other Restaurant Week restaurants offered way too much food. The food came out very well presented. 

I would recommend The Mission for a nice dinner or special occasion.

Took my fiance' there for Valentine's day/ Birthday.  I did a lot of research of romantic places around the Valley, and this one really caught my eye.  Immediately after walking through the door, you'll notice a dark and romantic ambiance with a lot of candle light.  Seating is a bit tight, but it wasn't bad enough for me to give it a lower review.  We began with an appetizer called "Table side guacamole" which was incredible to say the least.  It literally is made in front of your table.  Then it was onto the main dish... Build-your-own  Pork tacos.  Talk about tender meat!!  The shoulder of pork literally fell right off onto the fork.  The tortillas were exceptional, and so was the tasty sauce which included pineapple glaze.  So, the food was absolutely delicious...but the service was equally impressive.  My water level never reached the bottom of the glass the entire night, and I drink plenty!  Everyone was incredibly nice and cheerfully said "Happy Valentine's Day!" and "Happy Birthday!" to my fiance', which made the experience even better.  A fantastic place that I'll have no problem recommending to others to visit!

I'm stingy with my 5 star reviews, but this place deserves it. I'll admit, I was hesitant to go when my brother suggested it. I assumed it would be trendy, touristy and kinda show-offy which are 3 things I am not, but it wasn't like that at all. 

We met here for dinner New Year's Day and this place was packed. We had a reservation for indoor, but decided to change it to outdoor. There was a 10 minute wait for a seat so the hostess gave us complimentary mini margaritas. There is outdoor seating in the front of the restaurant which is kinda small and intrusive so I was delighted when we were led to the back outdoor area. It was spacious and nicely decorated. There were several large heaters throughout the patio which kept us comfortable. 

We started out with chips and the best salsa I've ever had....it was so good we ordered another bowl. We also got mission fries & guac. The guac was very original: avocado, cheese, onion, cilantro, tomato, lime and pumpkin seeds. It was great. I went with the pork belly lettuce wraps, 3 come in a serving. I think I died and went to heaven, I only wish I had 10 more. My husband got the chimichurri hangar steak. He asked for medium, but it was more like rare. I don't eat red meat that often and the fact that it was literally red turned me off. My brother ordered the mahi mahi tacos, 3 come in a serving. The waited suggested he order a 4th taco because they are on the small side. The tacos were fabulous. He aslo got a side of Tennessee, chipotle grits. They were creamy, smoky and yummy.

This is the first meal since moving to Phoenix that I really enjoyed. I wish I had more of everything. 

A shout out to Sal, our wonderful waiter. We will be back.
Always a good choice. I have never had a bad meal here & the owners and staff are all very friendly I love the dessert - peanut butter, bananas, chocolate churros. Yummy goodness!

Don't get me wrong, as I mentioned last time, the servers and the quality of the food are top-notch.  However, this is the second time we have visited the Mission and its the second time we have been treated VERY poorly by the host-staff, specifically a man with dark hair in a hip button-down shirt.  He stands at the desk prepared to seat people, but if you don't look the "Scottsdale" part, he is condescending and rude.  We decided to give it a second chance BECAUSE the food was so good the first time, but we will not visit again.  The host left a foul taste in our mouths one last time.

The mission is by far the best place for elegant Mexican food. The atmosphere is hip and urban, the service is excellent, and the food is legendary. Make sure you call ahead and make reservations! We especially love the chicken tacos and the street corn.  Tableside guacamole is to die for.  The perfect place for a date night while still eating Mexican food!

My friend chose this restaurant on a whim for her birthday lunch, and definitely no regrets here!

We went there on a Saturday during brunch expecting a long wait but they got us seated within ten minutes!  

What we ordered: 
Table side Guacamole: excellent and fresh!
Street Corn: went along nicely with the guacamole

And then for our main entrees we each shared:
Mahi Mahi tacos: one of the best mahi mahi tacos I've ever had!
Crispy Rock Shrimp tacos: average but still good
Tecate Skirt Steak tacos:  different from what we expected but was delicious!

For drinks we had the strawberry banana margarita. 

Service was friendly and polite. We didn't even tell them it was my friend's birthday because we didn't think that they did anything special for birthdays, but when our waitress saw my friend's birthday card on the table she had dessert immediately sent out for the birthday girl when we told her it was okay. 

Overall, great food, great service, great ambiance. Would definitely come back again!

Whoa! I was so happy when I was taken here while in Scottsdale.  This food is great and seeing as we don't have the best Mexican food where I'm at this was perfect.  There was quite a few of us that were here - total of about 8 people and we were seated quickly.  I heard this place is really popular so calling ahead is suggested.  I started off with the drink menu and I got a variety of drinks, honestly, I forgot what I drank prior to the tequila that we got.  Anyways, I was told that I had to get the guac both spicy and mild so we ordered them both.  The spicey had a nice kick to it and it was delicious.  It was so good that I was craving for more.  It was a little insane to have such a guac crave after lots of drinks but it was the best guac I've had thus far.  We ordered so many appetizers I think we cleared the entire menu and then went straight for the tacos.  There were so many of us that we just ordered a variety of tacos and they were amazing.  At the end we were so stuffed I wasn't sure i would be able to go out dancing again but needless to say the Mission hit the spot!  You can't miss this if you're in town.  I'm planning my next vacay to Arizona and we are definitely going to be going here and then hit up the nightlife.  Awesome spot and could really be dangerous if you came for a happy hour -- 6pm will turn into 12am very quickly!

I've lived in Tempe for about five years, and if you asked me what my favorite restaurant is, I would say The Mission.  If I were to try and pin down the reason for my favorable opinion, it would be something about the entire dining experience.  Located in Old Town Scottsdale, the actual restaurant is an old church.  At least on the outside.  It always feels like a party is happening on the inside.  Indoor and outdoor tables are available.  There is a vast array of margaritas, most come with actual lime juice, and other sundry drinks.    The dinner menu also boasts a myriad of options.  The food is always great.  I'm always trying to decide between several drinks and several entrees.  Although, I usually order several drinks.  The ambiance is festive and loud with dim lighting.  If you want a quieter dining experience, come during the day light hours.  Often, my daughter accompanies us.  There is free parking near by, and a variety of after dinner locations within easy walking distance, such as ice cream parlors.

Beautiful venue..... met some friends here. First time for all of us! 
Greeted and seated! Our server Sara was lovely. 
My biggest "complaint" is with the drink prices. Really? I think it's crazy to pay $15 for a drink. 
Can you say rip off? Geez. 
No Happy Hour? That's just wrong in Scottsdale. 
I would rather go anywhere else for Happy Hour. 
Pork shoulder tacos were excellent. Very small street tacos... but just delicious. 
Will I go back.... no.... glad I went once to say I've been.... but I like to linger with my food and cocktails... at that price.... one drink and dinner is enough. Go somewhere else to catch up with friends over drinks.

The food was excellent, but everything was pretty pricey, as the $$$ suggests. I didn't have a drink, but the person I was with did and commented that everything was worth it, except for the drink. The drink was good, but not worth the price. The chicken street tacos were excellent, as was the table side guacamole. Again, the guacamole was great but very expensive for the little bit that you got. As far as the taste of the food goes, this place is definitely 5 stars, but for what you pay for and what you get for portions is why I didn't rate it 5. The person I was with had a brisket torta, which was spicy and amazing! Food was excellent. The atmosphere is really nice. It has low light, which is enjoyable. The service was good as well and everyone was very nice.

I was in town for work and decided to walk from HGI in Scottsdale... I figured I'd go over budget (work allowance) but was surprised to find they serve a short menu on Sunday before 5 and there were a handful of items right around $15. 

I ordered a fresh margarita of some sort with a floater - those were also just under $15 (well worth it) and were so delicious - budget was blown after all!

I had tableside guac - amazing - with chicken tacos. 

The atmosphere is a little swanky. I just rolled off of an airplane and was definitely not in sync with other patrons dress - waiter/hostess didn't bat an eye. 

I'll definitely be back!

The meal at The Mission was AMAZING!  The only thing I regret is not having more room in my stomach to eat more.  

We started with the Grilled Street Corn and the Crispy Cola Pork.  Both were flavorful, unique, and worthy of being ordered again.  For my entree, I ordered the Sopa de Elote (I wasn't too hungry) and my husband ordered the Chorizo Porchetta.  True to the starters, these entrees were unlike anything we had tried before, and they left us wanting more.

We ended with the pumpkin bread pudding which can only be described as God's gift to bread pudding.  It was rich, decadent, and had me wanting to like the plate.  

This place is a must try!

The tacos are small. There, I said it, I ordered the two most basic things on the menu, the other being the tableside guacamole. I just thought I'd get that out there up front. 

When you walk up, it seems like it's part of or used to be a church. It actually isn't. You can tour The Mission next door... they were actually quite welcoming in there when I peeked in to get a glance. That's a review for a different day. 

There are two outdoor seating areas here. One in the front and one it the back. We sat out back at a two top, umbrella-covered table. It seemed to be a very busy area, with staff members going back and worth to a kitchen or storage area. So, if you're looking for a more intimate atmosphere, don't sit in the outside seating out back. 

The menu and Yelp featured photos remind me a tapa themed restaurant. The prices seemed a bit steep, but this was my first Scottsdale restaurant experience in years. $14 for tableside guacamole... yeah, I know it's fresh and made in front of you, but with only one avocado used, the portion size is smaller than what I've experienced with other tableside guacamole offered at elsewhere. Later during my stay this year, I learned that the avocados in Arizona do not taste as good as the ones in Kentucky. So, I wasn't impressed by the taste. As I mentioned, or warned you, I only added an order of three tacos, steak tacos to be exact. The steak was ok, but nothing other than the avocado really stood out within the tacos. And I'm not kidding, I think they were the smallest tacos that I've ever been served. Each about the length of my index finger. Definitely, don't assume that the photos of the tacos accurately depict the actual size. 

Service was wonderful. Our waiter was fantastic and friendly.

So I have tried this place twice now and I am still not a fan. 

I do have to say the ambiance is quite beautiful, but the food and drink are a total rip off. 3 half dollar size tacos with no sides for 16 bucks blows my mind. And $12 for half a cup of guacamole is outrageous. I'm sorry!

I haven't had food this good with such great atmosphere in a LONG time.  Most new restaurants are usually lacking in one, but The Mission is great all the way around. 

Every item I have tried has been fantastic, their margaritas are new and different and the atmosphere - for both brunch and dinner - is perfect.  I highly recommend if you are looking for a semi-nice/nice night out on the town and enjoy Tapas-style food.

Wanted to love this place. The food was delicious, but service was not at the level expected for the price paid. We were the first seated in our section for the evening, and our waiter would disappear for long periods of time before checking in to provide water, take orders, and check on the quality of the food. I did notice other waiters who were far more attentive, so this may have been just a singular incident. Also, there were three tables near us using their phone flashlights to see menus or simply light their table throughout the meal - If the restaurant is this dark, I suggest that the management do something to meet the needs of those who need additional light without disturbing others in the restaurant.  Like I said, food was great.  I recommend for that reason alone, and hope your overall experience is better than ours.

My dinner here was so stunningly delicious that I had to sit quietly for a few minutes after my meal and just meditate on how happy my tummy was. A friend that used to live in Scottsdale raved about this place, so I came here for dinner with my coworker on a Wednesday night. 

I was a little worried about not having a reservation, but we were seated immediately on the patio (they have misters so we stayed cool even in the 100+ degree heat). The service was so prompt, which I appreciated because I was starving!

We ordered the tableside guacamole (spicy) and grilled street corn to start. They also gave us some fresh tortilla chips and hot salsa, and honestly, I could have ended the meal there and been happy. The guac is so chunky and filled with all sorts of good stuff (cheese, pumpkin seeds, onions, hot sauce). The grilled street corn is decadent; it was so creamy and had just the right amount of kick to it.

For our dinner we shared the pork shoulder tacos, which was SUCH an unexpected standout. The pork shoulder is marinated so well, and just falls apart when you cut into it. They give you mini tortillas on a Himalayan salt block that you can make your own tacos with. We had to get two orders of tortillas because it was so good! 

We were stuffed by the end of the meal but this didn't stop us from getting the famed pumpkin bread pudding, which was AMAZING. It had a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top + fresh pomegranate seeds, and lots of pumpkin bread pudding sauce that wasn't overly sweet. 

Best part was that the prices were SO reasonable. The bill for 2 appetizers, a giant entree, dessert, and 2 margaritas came out to around $50/person, and this was us definitively overeating.
tried the pork app that was very tasty, however the flat iron steak was very cold and not much flavor , kinda bummed since it was so hyped from friends.

We had a reservation at 8 for a group of 7. We showed up a little before 8 and they told us they were just getting out table ready and asked if we could wait. Literally 5 minutes later, a waiter brings by free mini sized margaritas as a thank you for being patient. Already in an awesome mood.

The drink menu is extensive, and just about everything is great (I would know because we all swapped drinks and tried each others).

Food: you must get the guacamole as a started. But caveat, do not overeat chips or you will be full by the time your entree arrives! I ordered the butternut squash tacos, which were so good. Everyone else got steak or fish and also loved their dish.

Great ambiance, great service, nothing but raves about the food and drinks.

What an amazing place to dine while in Scottsdale.
The decor here is stunning, love the Himalayan salt block wall.

The food is flavorful and the drinks even better.  Try the watermelon basil mojito, its refreshing and you can taste the alcohol!

The pork belly appetizer was beyond tasteful and the skirt steak cooked perfectly. This place does not lack on flavor and is a must try if visiting AZ!

I adore this place. It's cute and quaint, but trendy. The mahi mahi tacos are refreshing and light, some of the yummiest in Phoenix for sure. The skirt steak tacos were extremely tender and flavorful. The only dish I've tried that I didn't enjoy were the chicken tacos, but probably because everything else had so much more flavor. I also love all the drink options, there is a great deal of unique liquors and specialty cocktails to try! 

This place is delicious and unique! Will definitely be back!

What an amazing dining experience!! My girlfriend and I shared the best spicy guac I have ever had... Jamar was such a hospitable server with amazing menu knowledge. The grouper with paella reduction was a seafood lovers dream. Rich and beautiful. Thanks for a memorable dinner Jamar!!
The absolute best guacamole I've ever had. It's been over a month since my visit to Scottsdale but I still dream of that guacamole.

Went to this place yesterday for dinner....amazing food, great ambience, good service! A tad too dark though.

This place was really happening even on a Thursday night but, it is too dark to see your food. It is perfect for a romantic setting where it does not matter what you eat till you date looks good eating it. My boyfriend and I shared the pork taco plate, the tacos are bite-size, never seen such small tacos. We had to order extra tacos (of course, they were not free), but the meat was just awesome. A great place for fun dinner, a little on the expensive side but worth it if you do not want to look at what you are eating.

Really fun restaurant with great flavors.

We started with the kale salad (yummy), followed by the flat iron steak and sides of torreados (blistered peppers) which were to die for, and chipotle grits.  

Service was wonderful -- when we couldn't decide between two desserts (the fried bananas with peanut butter and the pumpkin bread pudding), our server brought us both!

Cocktails are also great -- especially those with tequila.  :)  The cucumber jalepeno margarita was excellent.

Ambience is a little dark/clubby for the desert but comfortable.

Definitely worth it for a night out!

Tami

I have been at the Mission a couple of times before for business lunch. I decided to go today with my husband, he ordered stake tacos and I ordered the shrimp tacos for our entree. I have to say the food taste delicious but the tacos are very small I will consider more the tacos as appetizers than an entree.
Our sever was very nice and helpful.
I will go again for business lunches, if this is the place chosen by our hosting party but I will not go for personal entertainment.
I think the restaurant is too dark.

This review is for lunch.  When you arrive at The Mission you enter into what looks like a very nice restaurant with attractive decor, comfortable seats and a quiet, refined atmosphere.  But you get your first of three disappointments when the menu comes.  There are very few options -- six varieties of street taco, four tortas, a hot dog, and roasted chicken.  There are a number of sides and starters; perhaps you should make a meal of these??  

The second disappointment is the portion size.  The guacamole, advertised by our server as "for the table" is about one small avocado's worth.  The tacos are tiny - a single byte of filling in each of three.  The sides are not much bigger.

The third disappointment is the price.  $12 for the guacamole, $10 for the three bytes of taco, $6 for a small portion of fries?  Really?  Mission, you are nowhere near that good.

Great food and a good place to go after the Old Town Farmers' Market.

The guacamole is delicious and not over-rated. They know how to make a great margarita here!
This place has amazing food. I have tried several things here but my favorite are the steak tacos. Yum!!

What an amazing restaurant!!! You must start with the tableside guacamole!!! It is a must! The drinks and service were amazing!!! Cucumber jalapeño margarita was to die for!!! We also ordered the chicken torta and barbacoa 3" tacos!! Delicious!! The only taco I probably would not order again would be the mahi mahi the grilled one, the fried one was much better. The salsa and chips were soooo good as well, a roasted flavor that was delicious. A great outing with friends on a Saturday afternoon. We will be back soon.

Pork shoulder tacos for two.  Street corn. Duck empanadas. Table side guac is good but not sure it's worth the 12$ as it's a small portion and hello-- so easy to do at home. 
It's fun to make dinner into a tapas affair with a bunch for the table to share. Portions are small so the bill can get high quickly especially with drinks but it's a cozy and romantic ambiance. I love the fire outside on the patio and the banquette seating inside isn't too terrible either but for a truly special night I'd ask for a booth inside if you can't sit on the patio. I'm not sure how accommodating they are as I've never had any issues but it was a yummy dinner. 

Service was attentive but invisible which is kind of nice sometimes! No problems except fitting into my jeans the next morning!

I went to The Mission for lunch with my bosses and it was great! I've been wanting to go for some time now and I really want to check out their brunch on Sundays which I heard was amazing.

The ambiance is really laid back and mellow but in a cool, retro hip way. We sat at the bar for lunch and everything was great. I had the skirt steak tacos which were absolutely delicious - I was so full but I wanted more! We also got the basket of french fries...a combination of traditional fries and sweet potato fries. OMG. so good.

You should definitely go check it out if you haven't already - the food and drinks are great!

Lovely setting but be sure to check the cost of a glass of wine.  Ordered the standard Kendall Jackson white and amount was very small, so ordered the second with our appetizer and when I got the check was blown away.  13 bucks for very small portions.  Thought the prices were really out of line, when you compare to better restaurants that charge less.  think the whole comcept  is one of greed.  won't be going back. too many other places that offer more.

The service was mediocre. The waitress was kind of rude as when she took our drink order we were ready to order food, she said "oh I'll be back I'll take their order first" and she left to another table! Then she went to another table, came to us last! It was the weirdest thing, as I've never had a waitress leave the table to get another customers order, when we were ready to order. 

Then after waiting a long time for 4 small tacos, they took our tacos to the wrong table so we had to wait for them to remake it. We waited 30-45 minutes, and it wasn't that busy. The drinks were amazing, but there are too many great restaurants in Scottsdale for us to come back here again.

Located in Old Town Scottsdale, this place has the best guac! We had the table side guacamole. One of the servers pulled a side table with all the ingredients to make guacamole right in front of us. He placed the avocado into a bowl, then tossed in salt, onions, garlic, tomatoes, cilantro, serrano peppers, jalapenos, cheese, and pumpkin seed. It was fresh and delicious.  I'm definitely going to try to make this at home. 

We had the crispy pork & cola lime as an appetizer. We split the pork shoulder tacos between the two of us. The corn tortilla were fried, giving it a nice texture. I love how they put all the tortillas on a salt block.  

We made a reservation for patio dining. I love their patio - definitely dine outside if it's available. They have a huge fan that keeps it comfortably cool, especially in this hot AZ weather. Great food along with candles, wine glasses, and music in the background made my dining experience amazing!

The best food in the entire world. Service is slow but the food is so amazing. Get the three shrimp on a skewer with EXTRA soy aoli. Get the Malbec braised short rib with extra cheese balls . And THEN get the pumpkin bread pudding with the pomegranate seeds. Also the micheladas are to die for . This is for the owner - If one of these items go missing you will not have repetitive customers. Please don't change the menu. These are the best items on the menu.

Out of this world good. Amazing service, amazing food. Sam took great care of us multiple visits. One of the best places in old town...seriously. Try the Kobe dog, it will have you telling all your friends.

Great service - provided same level of professional service toward our party with kids as if without.  Delicious food with beautiful and thoughtful presentation.  Chic and trendy interior atmosphere, with a comfortable well designed outdoor space.  Would recommend in a heartbeat.

I have been wanting to come to The Mission for so long,  and I'm so happy I finally made it.  My boyfriend and I came for our three year anniversary. We were treated like royalty. Greeted by the hostess with a friendly "happy anniversary! " she seated us right away on the back patio. The patio was  romantic, strung tastefully with clear lights,  lush greenery, and a charming fountain. 

Our server came to greet us immediately. I was incredibly impressed with how much knowledge our server had about the menu(looks like a foreign language) and his ability to help me understand what everything was and what it would taste like. Looking over the drink menu there are so many great options, but I had to try their avocado margarita. Who knew avocados and tequila could go so well together!?  I had the tostadas to start; three crunchy delicious tostadas with all kinds of cheese, chicken, and yummy sauce. I had the salmon for my main entrée, I've never had a better cooked piece of fish. Our server was always available to answer questions and always kept our waters and cocktails full.

All I can say is thank you to the entire staff of The Mission for creating such a memorable night for me and my hunny. We can't wait to be back!

Delicious food and amazing ambience. The chicken antichuchos were incredible, covered in a wonderful mole sauce. The pork tacos were also amazing.  The meal was topped off with refreshing blood orange margaritas and unique ambience. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

We only popped in for a little nosh, but my life was changed. The table side guacamole was amazing and elevated to a whole new level.  I loved the addition of the pepitas on top. This weekend, I had to attend a picnic and brought guacamole.  I stole the idea from the mission to add the pepitas and it was a big hit. 

We also sampled some of their tacos, the carne asada being the favorite in the group.

The back patio is a great place to spend a meal or two.
Unique flavors and very good. Very small portions for $40-50 per plate plus drinks so just know for some unique Mexican food your going to pay $100 for 2 people.

This restaurant is great. Great food, great atmosphere, great service. The Skirt Steak tacos are a must have. Best steak tacos I've ever had. The steak is very tender and melts in your mouth. The restaurant is very loud so it can be hard to have a conversation at times.

Drove from California and stayed in Scottsdale. I looked for a real good Mexican Restaurant to bring my family to and read the reviews for this restaurant which were highly rated. Unfortunately we were disappointed. The food was not good at all, and extremely over priced. $267 bill for some tacos, guacamole, a couple of plates and 4 drinks! Unbelievable! The only reason I rate this restaurant a 2 was because it had awesome ships and salsa. I give credit where credit is do. The ambiance was wonderful too. The service was great. My only complaint was the food and how over priced it was. Not to mention a very small selection of food choices. Normally I would not complaint about the price if the food can back it up! 3 adults and 3 kids with a $267 bill, crazy ... Definitely not an authentic Mexican Restaurant.

One of my very favorite restaurants anywhere.  It is a special mix of old world and new.  The ambiance is alluring, the food delicious and cosmopolitan.  The huge selection of tequila is an added bonus!

Very nice atmosphere, staff is very friendly. The food is good but extremely over priced same with the margaritas. I had to order 3 entrees to call it a "meal" the tacos are silver dollar sized and you get three to an order. The breakfast dishes seem average (normal) size servings.

We're from out of town and asked a friend where to go for dinner, and she said hands down The Mission. After going, I agree with her. It was a packed scene at 7pm tho it quoted down a bit by 8:30. Service was excellent despite the heavy crowd and they seemed to have a choreographed dance down moving through the restaurant in and out of the kitchen. Our waiter was knowledgeable and steered us through the rather full menu choices. The table side guac was fun, and the pork belly app was creative. The mahi tacos were a bit heavy with the breading. And overall decor was very well done. Would go back if we're ever back in Scottsdale.
