We continued on our food tour of ten foods to try in Phoenix and we ordered the grilled street corn on the cob.  It doesn't seem grilled at all.  More like boiled in hot water?  Then covered  with an amazing Sauce.

Yum yum

We were so full because we had already eaten at the restaurant an hour ago  with the salad to try.  The waitress recommend the chicken  Anticuchos on a stick, and it was so flavorful.  It has mole and balsamic and pepitas and more and we thought it was great.

Good bye Scottsdale.  We had a whirlwind time eating during our 12 hour layover.

We were visiting from the Bay Area for a few days and a friend told us about this place and said you HAVE to go! Well he was right on the money. This very upscale Mexican Cuisine was simply awesome. 

The quality of the food and the ambiance makes this a must for anyone who has not had the pleasure of this exquisite dining experience. The staff is young , hip and super friendly, they make sure that your meal is perfect. 

My wife and I stopped by for lunch before we had to head back to the airport, we couldn't decide between the skirt steak or Mahi Mahi taco's so we ordered them both! The marinade on the skirt steak was perfect it melted in your mouth, the Mahi Mahi was breaded just right and cooked to perfection with a nice compliment of crunchy cabbage citrus escabeche and a olive crema on top. 

All I can say is next time were in town were coming definitely coming back to try some of the other dishes. We didn't get a chance to have drinks, but their selection of hand pressed cocktails looked very enticing as well. 

You won't be disappointed for sure!

We were there this evening from Chicago, 5 pm reservation. I had been before and it was excellent. Tonight, just OK,  wouldn't come again. 
The Chips were extremely Salted, too much. The Guacamole had too much lime. The first Kale salad we sent back, way too salty. It was the dressing, way to salty. Not sure why this French trained chef needed to use so much salt in dressing. Next salad was better.  
My fish was delicious as was the duck. 

When we were asked twice how things were, we answered the second time with, Many folks are using phones and flashlights to see, maybe you need some lights over here! I presume it was the Manager who didn't even listen to what we said and went to speak with the waitress. He seemed pretty Arrogant. He should lose the attitude because dinner this evening was very disappointing.  Presentation is very important for customers. With no lights, we couldn't see the presentation or what we were eating.

I dined here for the first time, while on vacation, because of all the good Yelp reviews. 

The atmosphere is tranquil looking but loud with a mixed aged-crowd.
It is apparently customary to be given a small light to look over the menu, because it is so dark . Our server did not offer us one , even after she saw me using my phone. 
Being our first time, (and we even told her it was our first time) she did not run through any specials or anything. I had to ask and she just told me the Chef's recommendation.  The server next to us told his table all the specials that evening.
The guacamole was different with the toasted pepitas in it. It had a nice flavor.
I had the chicken tacos and ordered flour tortillas vs corn. It would have been nice to have been told that I would have had to put everything together myself, vs if I had ordered them with corn tortillas. It came with two flour tortillas and a bowl with the chicken and avocado and then a side of the sauce. The chicken was  a tad dry and overcooked. I have had better tacos elsewhere.
The blood orange pineapple margarita was the best thing I had there. 
The server was not very inviting and seemed uninterested in helping us . She only came around to take the order and check how the guacamole was and then handed us our bill. 
I think there needs to be some improvement on the service.
I would try it again and ask for a different server.

Something is very off and awkward about this place. I found The Mission while looking for upscale Hispanic cuisine during my trip to AZ. From the pictures and some reviews, it seems like a great place to eat, and it really would be if the staff and chef were replaced. We had multiple customer service issues that spanned across multiple employees.
-First we came 1 hour and a half earlier of our reservation so we arrange to sit at the bar and socialize until our table was ready. The hostess advised that she could get us something much Sooner than our original reservation, and offered to notify us at the bar when she was ready to seat us. Almost 45 minutes later the waitress never came to us and offer to seat us, so we walked back to the hostess stand and asked of something opened yet. The hostess said "go ahead and close out of your tab and we'll get your table ready". So she forgot about us. We closed out our tab and then went to the hostess stand, at which time we were told to wait a few minutes because a table wasn't ready just yet. A few minutes went buy and one of the girls began to walk us back then said "oh wait they're still clearing the table". This was sloppy from the start, but was willing to give it a chance, because the food sounded so good.
- We were sat at the outside patio area. It was pretty chilly out, and they did have multiple heaters outside to counter the nippy air. A few minutes into our meal we both felt a little chilly, but didn't really make an issue out of it, however, the waitress noticed my girlfriend holding her arms like she was cold, and attempted to turn the heater up, but it seemed like it was running out of gas. A group of 8 sat next to us on the opposite side of the heater and one of them made a comment about the heater needing to be turned up. Their waiter put that request on the back burner and said he would do that in a bit and began taking orders from the rest of the table instead of prioritizing the physical comfort of the guests. The same patrons from that table brought the heater up for a second time after he took all of the orders. Smh, VERY poor decision there.
-The food. Oh the food, smh. I got the duck confit, and my girlfriend got the pork shoulder tacos. The tacos were just, okay, nothing to write home about, but the duck confit was bad. Whoever thought it was a good Idea to deep fry it and turn it into chewy duck chicharones needs to go back to culinary school. I felt like I should have been paid to chew through that leathery, crunchy fowl for an hour like I did. We also ordered the chocolate churros, and man were they oily. Like, have you folks even tried those things? They taste like they were fried, then fried again just to let them soak up more oil. They were really bad. 
-When handling the check my girlfriend and I split it down the middle, so when the waitress asked us what we wanted to do, my girlfriend and I both said "yeah we'll just split it down the middle". The waitress then replied with "Okay are you sure thats what you want to do?". I reassured her that it was, then me and my girlfriend both looked at each other with wide eyes like "what was that weirdness all about?". Never had someone ask me if I was sure how I wanted to pay for my bill.... Awkward, but then again, it seemed to go along with the overall trend of this place, which was awkward. When I got my bill back I noticed a pamphlet advertising that the restaurant was hiring, and a questionnaire with questions like "was a manager visible? This was awkward advertising and questioning for an establishment of this size and style. It was also Ironic, because a manager should have spotted the fact that our heater was running out of gas, seeing as it was clearly dim compared to the others. I don't know but nothing sat right with me about this place, and for the money I'd recommend you take your money elsewhere. This establishment is obviously ran by people out of touch with their food and customer service. The pros to this place? Yeah there is a pro, and its in the Decor.

08.30.14

Cute spot for brunch. A dark contrast to the blazing sun outside. Great cocktails (and the waiter is extremely knowledgeable and can recommend some delicious drinks).

Must order: tableside guacamole. Just do it.

If you like steak, order the Tecate Marinated Skirt Steak. Make sure you add an egg. They may throw in an extra egg, just for kicks. Accept this gift.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-mission-scottsdale?select=m4ERxBHYvOyp4rsMGkjorw#m4ERxBHYvOyp4rsMGkjorw
Best meal in Scottsdale!! Try the appetizers less expensive than the entree and tasty!!
Table side Guac and salsa were the best parts. Very tiny tiny entrees. That was highly disappointing.

We  both liked this place, but I definitely like it more than my wife. Fun outdoor patio, really nice but we sat indoors. We split the grilled Romain salad which was delicious ...Yum...  especially the black beans. Whatever you do, try the Grilled Street Corn, it was the best corn we've ever eaten! The Roast Corn Gordita were delicious too and the Marinated Jidori Chicken good. My wife's Mahi mahi fish tacos were really the only thing that were just okay. But the presentation of everything was beautiful and the service was excellent even though the place was really really busy on a Sunday night. The seating is kind of crammed and jammed in... it was a little like we were sharing conversation with both of the couples on either side of us so that's the only not perfect part of the atmosphere. But it's a lively place an we think it's worth a try if you like latin flavors.

Trendy location hopping with customers.  I had the duck which honestly was good but disappointing considering how the waiter had built it up as his favorite dish.  It was basically the same duck you would find anywhere but with a nice green chili sauce. It was good, but not worth the wait.  The item not to kiss is the table side guacamole service.  Small portion of guac but oh so good.  Don't forget to try the ghost pepper sauce, a very small portion at a time.  It goes great mixed with the guac. Get a reservation unless you like to wait 2 to 3 hours on a week night.  I can't imagine a weekend.

As far as food goes I REALLY enjoy The Mission, I have been here 4 or 5 times and have always liked what I've had and I've usually been able to try different things. Their brunch, lunch and dinner menus are all very good and unique. 

My favorite item on the lunch menu in the Cubano Torta, it's excellent. For brunch they have really good bloody marys too. I have never actually had anything I didn't like, but like all restaurants some things are better than others. 

I believe The Mission is located in an old church so the setting is different, however it is very dark and that has been a problem for some of the people I have been with (my mother mainly). 

The service has been great everytime I have been seated at a table, but the two times I have gone just for drinks at the bar the service was awful. Both times I actually left annoyed because their service was so poor. 

Overall, I think it's a great place to eat and an especially good place to take out of town guests who are wanting to try a more upscale Mexican restaurant.
Amazing Mexican food.  Definitely a spot not to miss if you like Mexican.  The drinks and wines here are off the charts also
Amazing guacamole - get it with ghost pepper. Pork belly app - ask for it with tortillas for mini tacos. Drink tequila from the calacas bottle. She's worth it.
Great food beautiful atmosphere only downside is the wait time to get in and get seated you have to be early but definitely well worth it

This restaurant is way overhyped. The food was decent but if I am paying over $30 a plate I expect some very basic restaurant etiquette. Chips and guacamole were great...we started at the bar because we arrived early for the reservation. I ordered a $14 margarita at the bartenders recommendation. It was terrible. Tasted like Cuervo mix. I sent it back and got the sangria which is good. He was nice about it, but I expected something a little more authentic, esp at that price point. When our reservation was ready we were seated outside. Smack dab facing the setting sun. Blasted in the face. I didn't ask to move (because there was probably no where to move to) but I asked how long before the sunset and was told something like "ohhhh soon"...obviously this restaurant is busy and not hurting for cash, so maybe don't seat customers at this particular table at sunset. We were laughing because it was so absurd. I had to scoot way over (the poor man next to me:/) to escape the blinding sun until it set about 15 min later. So next we order a bottle of wine. After we order it we're told the price is incorrectly listed on the menu. It's more $ than I wanted to spend and wouldn't have ordered it I had known. We get apps and food. Good food, but I wasn't wowed, but good. Service was ok, but again, just ok. Silverware not replaced, just moved to dirty outdoor table after plates are taken. Again, things you're fine with at your local Cheesecake Factory, things you're not fine with for a pricey meal. Anywho...the bill comes and the wine is even more than she quoted. Come on. This is basic stuff y'all. Anyway, I suspect there is better "Mexican" food around Scottsdale and Phoenix...you might want to think about eating elsewhere.

Excellent.... 

Loved... Guacamole is a must! 

Fried bananas dessert is a must.   Very tasty,  with cinnamon Gelato and actual peanut butter. 
Quick service and elegant ambiance!

Amazing dining experience! I chose The Mission as my birthday destination because I wanted to try the food so bad! They not only delivered the goods, but managed to blow my mind at the same time.

I had been hatching "my mission" to visit The Mission for quite some time. It began after sampling their Peruvian Clam Stew at a Yelp party. Though it was a mere shot glass of a sampler, I was hooked. The mixture of spicy chorizo, briny clam goodness, and sweet coconut milk forever lingered on my palate only to tattoo my brain with a flavor memory that could not be satiated. Until now.

My dining compadre and I started with the tableside guacamole. It is the perfect balance of everything good that should go into guac. My server almost forgot to top it with toasted pepinos, but I mentioned this and got my dose. We moved to the Peruvian clam stew, but had them split the order in half so we could each sample it... and save room for a meaty entrée. It was everything I had dreamed about and longed for 'lo these many years. Another nice touch is the sweet corn niblets that were sprinkled throughout the dish, providing a burst of sweetness to the rich complexity of the chorizo and clam broth.

Our entrée was equally fantastic. Slow-cooked pork shoulder tacos. The handmade mini tortillas are presented on a heated salt rock! A generous hunk of fork-tender pork shoulder plus grated cotija cheese, diced red onion and fresh cilantro comprise this build-your-own street tacos ensemble. It really is a generous portion that feeds two, as claimed on the menu.

I might have let it slip to our tableside guacamole preparer that it was my birthday. Our waiter picked up on that and brought over a complimentary dessert that was the coup de grâce. Warm bread pudding in a salted caramel sauce with a scoop of dulce de leche ice cream... Decadent without being overly sweet. This dessert again demonstrates the deftness with which The Mission balances flavors and textures. Pumpkin seeds provided some crunch and pomegranate gems gave just enough of a contrasting pop of tartness amidst the sea of delicately sweet caramel sauce.

Needless to say, I had a fabulous birthday, due in no small part to the otherworldly meal I had at The Mission. I will continue to dream about this food until the next time I am summoned. And then... should I choose to accept it... I will embark upon another holy mission in search of deliciousness...

Let's see, it's loud. Stupid loud. My server miss heard or fucked up my order horrendously. The server said she had worked there for six years. Acted like a rookie. I had to flag some body down because they left us with no chips once the guacamole was made. Then again to get the ice tea my friend ordered. I felt neglected. Then he took our guacamole before we finished eating it. She told me that she would serve the mahi ahi tacos to a five year old. I agree. Why beer batter a great fish like that? It tasted frozen or pre-packaged. From a restaurant that isn't a chain I was sorely disappointed. Let us be honest. The portions are great for skinny Scottsdale courtesans, however like most terrible Mexican places, I filled up on the chips. 

Maybe I just had a bad night. When I return I expect better service. I want to be impressed by the food. Till then, only two stars.

The pros: pretty decor, nice salt wall, and bar is well stocked.

Tried this place again and it is still amazing - that guacamole is just the best we've had.  Our server (I believe his name was Spencer) was great, very attentive, came back to the table often to check on us.  I had the chicken tacos and they were very delicious.  My margarita was excellent.  Hubby had the barbacoa tacos again and said they were awesome.  Still our favorite place in Scottsdale.  We had thought about going someplace else for a change, but as we were eating he said "why did we even think of going anywhere else?"  This is where we will bring friends when they visit.

I found the food here to be an experience- the pork belly and guacamole were both to die for.  The drinks were amazing too - we ordered the special margarita and bloody mary and they were both great.  What I wasn't so happy about was the treatment by the hostess.  We had a reservation at 8PM and didn't get seated until 9:30PM.  No offer to comp our drinks or an appetizer, no apology.  We were so hungry were were about ready to leave.  For that I felt like the hostess should get fired.  But I must say the food was worth the wait.
Still the go to when people from out of town want Mexican.  A little upscale, great back patio, food good - not great.

The first thing I have to say about The Mission is that it is beautiful. So romantic! The bar seating, the restaurant and the outdoor seating are beautifully designed. You feel like you are dining in Sante Fe!
The bar itself is outstanding. Every drink is made to perfection and the margaritas, tequila selection and caipharinas were excellent. We had to try the table side guac which was perfection.It had pepitas on top- great idea.The chips  are light -the salsa heavenly. 
Some pork belly lettuce wraps and amazing duck empanadas were perfect with our cocktails.  We moved into the dining room for dinner and were lucky enough to have our same server from the bar, Abeer. She was terrific. 
She explained the menu items and made recommendations. The Almejas Al Vapor was wonderful...but HOT! Soak up the soup with the bread...yum. The corn on the cob, Barbacosa tacos, diver scallops were some of our favorites. It was just a lovely dinner . Can not wait to return.

Do NOT miss the Table-side Guac here, I've never had better food when feeling like I was "eating in the dark" (the restaurant's lighting was too dim for my taste. Yelpers' dinner pictures don't do justice to the dishes 'cause everybody had to freaking use the flash which make unappetizing pictures! Please take note and turn up the light a notch, Mission!)

The Short Ribs tacos had a high price tag but the portion is huge. I liked the rustic feeling of the handmade tortillas but the rounds need to be a little bigger, it definitely threw off the meat/flatbread ratio. The meat was melt-in-your-mouth tender, it was caramelized too, so much so that towards the end, you feel like you're eating dessert and not a savory dish.

I can't really comment on other aspects of the restaurant because it was so dark! 3.5 stars.

So far not to impressed, bartenders not very welcoming, busy setting up, cutting fruit and chatting with each other. Margaritas appear to be pre-made as they are poured from a 64 oz store n pour. Waiting for the food service to begin. Hopeful the food makes up for the mediocre service - well the food made up for the experience - its popular because of the location and past reputation. It's worth a visit if you can get a reservation

My sister and I dined on the back garden patio.  I loved the location of The Mission.  We ordered the table-side guacamole and it was superb.  The Mexican restaurants in Houston doesn't come close to the freshness and the complete circle of spices that were added.  It was topped with pumpkin seeds which was a first for me.  My sister ordered Chorizo Porchetta which was pork shoulder with fresh kitchen made chorizo stuffed in the middle and I ordered the Chilean Salmon.  The drinks were amazing.  We ended dinner with Espresso Churros....oh my...no words.  I will never have Churros unless they are from The Mission way in Scottsdale AZ.
awful. terrible service. very disappointing. go to any other place in the pheonix area theres plenty other quality mexican places that value your business.. the mission is not one of them

I've been here one time before and totally forgot how good this place is. To start it was a 45 minute wait on a Saturday night at 8:30... Totally typical! We snagged a seat at the bar and had a glass of bubbles and a mission mule - excellent. Our wait was about 25 minutes and then we were seated in a snug spot with two tables right next to us (only con about this place). For an appetizer we got the table guac... AH-MAZING... A young man came and made it right in front of us... He even asked our preference on how we like the guac. We then got the duck entree and short rib entree - YUM! The green chili duck was the best meal I've ever had in Scottsdale and was absolutely mouth watering. Thanks Mission - I'll be back!!

Eat here.
Ate here last night, a group of 5.  Pretty colonial mexican decor with beautiful chandeliers one of my dining partners wanted to steal. 

Server was very young, but knew the menu well. 

Home made chips and salsa.  Not much you can do with chips and salsa, but they were not...ummm...cold.

Had the $12 guacamole.  A lot like Barrio's Guac.  Table side preparation, like in Rocky Point.  People rant and rave online about the guacamole here.   It's good and all, but come on, it's f...ing guacamole.  Should have ordered the cheese plate.

Duck Carnitas Empanada.  That shit was good!  I wanted to lick my plate, but the bourbon and tequila had not yet kicked in, so I used my finger.  

Crispy Cola Pork.  Yummy.  The chiltepin made it spicy.  It was a fancy lettuce wrap, and it was delicious.  

Chipotle Caesar.  A fresh break of greenery between the meat dishes.  A little heavy on the dressing.

Pork shoulder Tacos. The meat was the star.  Silly vegetarians can eat all the salad in the world, because that leaves more pork for me.  My wife and I enjoyed the roasted pork without the little tortilla, just dipping it in the mexican BBQ sauce that was served along side.

Chimmichurri Marinated Hanger Steak.  Not a lot of chimmichurri flavor here, but the tomatillo sauce on the side was super savory and yummy.  Tequila and beer and bourbon were making me tingle, so I did lick my plate when no one was looking.  

Will eat here again.  A lot like Deseo in the Westin at Kierland, and also like  Barrio.

Good fancy latin cuisine.  Excellent service.  Good value for the money.

Eat here.

Loved the courtyard with the fireplace.  Service was excellent.  Guacamole was fantastic and whipped up table side.   One dish was salmon on salad (special order for my wife).  Second main course was filet which was good but the sauce prepared with it was way too salty and is disguised the taste of the meat.   Overall though our best dining experience in Scottsdale this trip.

Time your reservation to sit outside and enjoy the sunset.
Great food. Great service.   Pork shoulder was amazing and the pork appetizer was great.  We didn't have a reservation and had to wait but it was worth it.

Everything we ordered was over-the-top delicious. Pomegranate and blood orange margaritas, tableside guacamole (easily the best guac I've ever had in my life), chips and salsa, street corn, steak tacos, short rib tacos, mahi mahi tacos, potatoes with chorizo, and pumpkin bread pudding. Every single thing was amazing. I also love the ambiance of this place - kind of dark, lots of cool mismatched chandeliers, himalayan salt brick wall, leather menus - very cool. I can't wait to come back!

I really enjoyed this place!! The ambiance/decor is super cute here and my favorite thing were the mirrors & salt rocks! I would totally recommend eating family style here, as our waiter (who was really nice) suggested. That way you get to try everything & order tortillas on the side. 

Of course we had to get the tableside guac and the corn! They were both really good & I recommend you get it. We also got a duck confit which was good. Then we had duck, chorizo, and short rib, all of which were good, and we had mahi mahi tacos which I really enjoyed! For dessert we ordered the espresso churros (so good) and the banana dish (even better!). I loved the food here and left very full & happy!

Overall this was a great dining experience and I would love to return here!

Stopped by for a meal while Hunter is passed out at the house with my dad...amazing place!! The environment is very trendy and LA vibe...dark, good music, great atmosphere and really really tasty food!! Started with spicy margarita which was perfect, also tried the pomegranate margarita which was strong with a sweet taste...strawberry basil mojito tastes like a good tasting drink...then the food... Started with street corn which was simply amazing!! Then had the beef on a stick which was marinated perfectly...the guacamole is made table side and amazing...the pork belly was wonderful as well. The short rib was soft and amazing...but the fish tacos was not too good, not tender and little hard, but butternut squash taco was incredible!! Ordered too much food for 4...was stuffed after appetizers...

Unbelievable flavors! The combinations in the dishes were perfect. Believe the hype about the street corn. We had it off the cob and it was creamy, with just the right amount of cheese and spice to enhance the corn without hiding it's flavor.  I'd go again tomorrow !

a little expensive for what you get.. but good.. drinks are WAY expensive 
(for example house chardonnay was 12 and guacamole was 10)
suggest sitting out back (not front) and starting with guacamole 

fwiw.. best salsa i've ever had

Love the location. Love the table side guacamole made to order. Good Sangria. Friend had the Jalapeño Cucumber Margarita. Very good. 

Street corn was a bit pricy at $8. Also too much crema on the corn. 
Everything else was reasonable. We sat on the patio. Had a great waiter. 
Would go back.

A five star review is a rarity for me to give.  It leaves no room for doubt that this is a business that has achieved the ultimate mastery of its craft.  If the purpose of the "The Mission" was to create an experience of latin flavors that both excite and dominate your palette with brutal efficiency, they indeed deserve this 5 star review.

On a rare occasion you get to experience something new.  Both my wife and I love latin food and we had heard plenty of buzz that The Mission was the place to go to feed this hunger.  The old world style of the restaurant is matched by the decor and place settings.  You get the feeling that you are somewhere deep within Mexico or Argentina once you take your seat.  The wait staff was courteous and explained each and every aspect to the menu.  From the delectable seafood soup to the various tapas and main dishes, we were well informed on what we could expect.

We tried a little bit of everything and I cant say as I have tried anything more delectable than the south of the border treats set before us.  Each dish gave a unique experience and flavor that kept the table quiet as we tried to mastermind how to describe these tastes.  

If you want an evening out that will give you no less than an amazing meal with a lot to talk about afterwords, you should make The Mission your mission.

I have been to many steak restaurants in the area and this is by far the best steak I've ever had, second time there. Anything you order is good there. The service is impeccable and the food is the best!

There are many pleasures in life, and going out for lunch is a biggie. So with a wonderful day shining down on me, I am going to dine on the patio with my lovely date. After you order your drink order the Guacamole. A sweet gal will cart over a fresh chunky haas avocado,  jalapeno, cilantro, sea salt, and lime and will prepare your guac in a stone bowl and pestle. 12.

My date got the smoked brisket, habanero, bbq, aji amarillo, coleslaw, yucca torta. 12. I had the tecate skirt steak tacos with green chili salsa, lime, avocado, cilantro and cotija. 10. We drank some wonderful margaritas. 7. The style of food is Latan with the splendor of classical French cuisine. 

So as the Catholics say in Latin "RE VERA, POTAS BENE."
(Say, you sure are drinking a lot.) And lastly would you stop in the Church next door and say a little prayer for me.
Phenomenal Latin American fusion, almejas al vapor are a must, and the table side guacamole is some of the best I've had...

Mmmmm so good Salsa is the best  had the Pork tacos  would come back again and again.
The staff was very good and very attentive. No reservation just show up they will fit you in.
Amber was AWSOME

I have never had chicken so good.  My wife had the salmon and was blown away.  We went there a month ago for the first time and didn't really know what to expect.  The portions wont have you loosing your belt, but the flavor of the food will blow your mind.  I loved the atmosphere and the staff are great and attentive.  Will go back again.

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

You're not coming here for traditional Mexican food.  If you're looking for "authenticity" or "regional cuisine," this isn't the place.  But if you're looking for good contemporary interpretations of Mexican food in a great setting, this is a good place to be.

We've only ever been here for brunch, but it is y far one of our favorite brunch places.  It usually starts with a Mission Mary - their interpretation of a bloody mary.  It is spicy, but more than spicy, it is also peppery, which adds a great new dimension to the drink.

Our go-to dish - the chilaquiles.  Red or green, doesn't matter, they are pretty tasty here.  Slight sourness in the green chiles, some decent heat in the red, the totopos aren't completely soaked through so there is some texture in the chips.  There is plenty of sauce to cover over the chips and get the flavor you're looking for, and juuuuuust enough meat to make the meal more substantial.  

The house guacamole made tableside is also very, very good.  One of the best in the Valley.  It's got more stuff in it than your typical guacamole, but from the cotija cheese to the pepitas, they all add a little something.

Tried my wife's cinnamon pecan waffles.  Awesome.  Really good.  Not super sweet but really well balanced.  I've also tried the corn and crab pancake - these are perhaps the weakest brunch dish that we have tried.  Also had the regular steak tacos off the lunch menu and they too are tasty.  Not the best tacos ever, but still tasty.

This last trip, I tried their pig out all-you-can-eat pork bar where you have a choice between carnitas and pork confit tacos in a taco bar setting.  It's worth the money and it's pretty tasty, but not perfect.  The carnitas were a little dry.  The confit pork was definitely preferable and was better seasoned.  The salsa selection was also a little weak.  They have a little of everything (a tomatillo, a pico de gallo, etc.) but none of them tasted all that great.  I kept my condiments basic - onions and cilantro.  Street taco style.  The other slight weakness, the tortillas.  Small street-style corn tortillas, these were a little too thick to double up but too thin to hold up on its own.  The flavor of the masa was ok.  Would I order the all-you-can-eat again?  I think I would, but I'd really have to be in the mood and be pretty hungry.

So again.  Not traditional Mexican if you are a purist.  But still come for the good food.  It's worth the price.
Great service and delicious food. :) good cute atmosphere. there's also patio seating for times of the year when it isn't scorching hot outside!
Busy at night on weekends. A little pricey for small portions with tacos and tacos but still yummy.

Wow!  Loved it!  The portions were a bit too small for the prices but the food was great.  Hostess was especially friendly.  

Table side Gac is AMAZING but again WAY too tiny - especially for 12.00.  The Primarita Marg was super yummy - but again, pricey!  I felt like I was back in Los Angeles with these prices! Great parking as well!  The decor is beautiful and different for Scottsdale.  Great crowd. I felt like I wasn't in Scottsdale.  It had an up north feel (think San Francisco).  Cool place.  This is by far my favorite place here in AZ - I bring all my out of town guests here and have many girls nights out - and date nights with my hubby. Love that its dark and cozy - but hip at the same time. I have NEVER had bad service or a bad meal - this place is GREAT!  The owner Brian is a doll, his sweet wife works there too - wonderful, wonderful wonderful!

The Mission is a wonderful, unique restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale, with a very cool, and fun atmosphere. And the food is definitely worth every penny. Matt Carter, the head chef has created a menu for foodies, and yet the dishes are not overthought, and portions are a good size. If you like corn soup you MUST get the Almejas al Vapor soup. Omg, it is to die for! The combination of flavors works so perfectly on the palette. I am definitely going back to try the scallops, and basically work my way up and down the menu. The cucumber jalapeño margarita is my fave, has just the right amount of kick, and isn't overly sweet. Once again, it is so perfectly balanced. Make reservations on a weekend night, this place packs up quickly!

This is the third time I have been to the Mission.  The first two were for dinner, the third time was for lunch.  I travel to Phx/Scottsdale and the food here is a can't miss.  At night, it is more of a scene with low lighting and a great atmosphere. In the day, it was totally different very laid back, warm and inviting; especially if you are seated at a table outside with the sun shining down on you. The guacamole is amazing and the street tacos were great with a unique twist.  Also, if you want to experience great food without spending too much, lunch is a great option.

The 5 stars here are basically just for the bartender, Mike.  He's a magician.  He made some phenomenal drinks that we'd never tasted before.  He also threw in a few samples when we weren't sure what we wanted.  The food was great as well. The chicken tacos were excellent as well as the grilled corn.  This place is a no brainer. You have to go here.  The cougars were out in full force, but it's definitely a place for the late 20's crowd as well.

Is it "Location! Location! Location!" or "Ambiance! Ambiance! Ambiance!"? The Mission has both; it's in an ideal location to begin a night out on the town, and the restaurant's low lighting and sexy decor will had me feeling just as spicy as the Latin-infused fare.

My favorite dish, hands down, was a side of creamy grits with chipotle and honey. Everything was tasty, duck empanadas, pork belly pibl, guacamole, though nothing especially stood out as much as that humble side of grits mixed with perfection.

The service was a little over-attentive, but the guy was sweet and obviously trying his best. And he was Johnny-on-the-spot with the wine, so who can really complain about a few interruptions? 

Sexy restaurant. Satisfying food.

Have to say that I was a little let down by the food. The service was very good though.The food was all over the place in my mind. I wasn't sure if I was eating Mexican food or on an episode of Chopped. I think that some people would really love some of the strange combos and some people would find it, well, strange! I didn't have anything I hated but I just wasn't crazy about any of it. My wife normally corrects me if I'm wrong and she wasn't feeling it either. You'll have to decide.

Tableside guacamole, street corn, avocado margarita, and espresso churros- amazing. Each and every one of the tacos we ordered were equally amazing. Great service, awesome atmosphere. We only had time for one night out in the Phoenix area, and this choice did not disappoint!

Let me start out by saying that the street corn from here was out of this world! It is certainly one of best things that I've EVER tasted! Yum! The table service was very good and our server was very attentive and helpful when trying to decide on what to order. I got the pork shoulder tacos and the flavor was spot on and I felt like I could have eaten 10 orders of them! It had a nice pineapple and cilantro flavor pairing. Overall, we were so happy we found this place while visiting the area. 

The only reason I could not give 5 stars is because of the front of the house. When we entered, the hostess originally told us that it would be about 5 or 10 minutes and then in the next sentence she changed it to 15-20 minutes and said that they were trying to give the kitchen a break. That just seemed weird to me. I just can't give a 5 star rating when your first point of contact is unpleasant. Other than that, this restaurant is a must try!

Went for a late lunch.  Guacamole was good, as was the sangria margarita that I had (yes, it's a mix of the two, forgot what the actual name was called).

Got a torta, and the meat was marinated well.  A little sweet but not too sweet.  Portion size was huge.  The fish tacos were good also.

Service left more to be desired and I'm particularly irked that they didn't log in my Opentable reservation.  I was contacted by Opentable after my visit asking why I didn't show up for my reservation.  It all got sorted out but shouldn't have happened in the first place.

The Mission is modern contemporary Mexican restaurant in Old Scottsdale.  This a place that you will need to make a reservation. It is always packed and every seat is full. They have a nice patio seating area outside and romantic seating inside. Inside lighting is pretty much candle-light and some people might not like the darkness. We enjoyed a nice romantic dinner with table side guacamole and multiple flights of different types of tequila. The food is not your typical Mexican food. It has a modern twist but still great flavor. Our meal was nice, but expect to pay $30 a dish. It was a memorable evening, with great environment, good food, and lots of top shelf tequila.

I recently came to the mission for a special romantic celebration with my girl.  First night ever in Scottsdale and first restaurant.  I called 3 weeks ahead of time to ask for a larger table set away.  When we arrived, we were seated at a tiny table and put between 2 larger tables.  Being 6'3, its hard for me to have margaritas, appetizers, dinner plates on a small table especially when you are virtually almost connected to someone else dinner party.  To make matter worse, they seated a part of 4 bros that evidently had to much to drink and the 5'2 ginger that resembled Donny Bonaduce kept making douchebag comments at my girl.  The staff seemed to turn their backs rather than get involved, we got our food, paid our bill and left.  So much for a romantic evening but the tableside guacamole was great,
Great service, great ambience, and the tacos taste really good. Try to Tun with a white bean purée.

Perfect atmosphere and amazing food.  Both the outside and inside represents a very trendy atmosphere. An illuminated wall is made of Himalayan rock salt bricks and if you order tacos, your soft tortillas are served on a heated brick of the rock salt!

If you order tableside guacamole, a waiter rolls a cart over to your table and makes your guacamole right in front of you! The chorizo porchetta was amazing and one of the best dishes I have ever had! 

Waiter was extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.
Fun atmosphere, great food and amazing drinks.  Try the bean puree and the mahi tacos.  Favorite place to dine when in town visiting.

We have eaten here three times. Today we found out that they don't offer dinner or any solid food until 5 PM at the bar.  Great for special occasions and for a delicious tacos, and really delicious guacamole. However, if it's 4 PM and  the game just let out and  you're hungry, find another place.

But if it's after 5 PM, go for it. Worth the wait, worth making a reservation, delicious food.

Great guacamole and great salsa and chips. Mexican street corn is a 10+. Fish tacos and steak tacos nothing special. Chicken entree was fair at best. Cool spot but definitely NOT a "foodie" heaven.  Slightly better than a chain, sit down dining experience in hipper surroundings.

Such a fan of this restaurant. I have been for brunch, lunch and dinner. Each time I have visited, I have had fantastic service. I love the style and ambience of the restaurant. I love the location and how it was actually a mission at one point. I don't think they missed a mark anywhere with this restaurant. When the food, service, and ambiance are all in sync, you have yourself one fantastic restaurant on your hands. My recs would be the table side guac, shrimp tacos, street corn, grilled prawn salad, and the peruvian clam soup!!!!! I am in love with that soup! You can't go wrong with anything though! Oh and the margaritas are top notch, especially the Primarita. It is more expensive but so worth it! I also love the red sangria. 

The curros are also mind blowing. I can go on forever about this restaurant. It is one of my favorites in old town! Hands down!

I used to rave about this restaurant. I've referred a ton of clients to The Mission. I popped in yesterday for a sangria and some table side guacamole which both were always amazing in the past. This time was different. The sangria was horrific and the table side guacamole had very little flavor and was made with a less than ripe avocado. What's normally smooth and creamy is now chunky and tasteless. Now the Mission is like most Scottsdale restaurants - spot on with atmosphere and mediocre with food. 

Consistency breeds success....inconsistency closes doors. 

Not sure I'll return.
Good guac made at the table, good sangria (both red and white), but we found the tacos while tasty to be a little too nouvelle cuisine-y.  Excellent service.

Went here with 2 of my friends for brunch. We had the table side Guacamole, Grilled Chicken Tacos and Brussels sprout Tacos. 
It was very dark in the restaurant. Service was great. We will return!

Good thing the meal was good and the waitress was personable and helpful, because the hostess staff was clueless. They were about to seat us outside, and I said we want to eat inside, and they said, well, we confirmed with a confirmation phone call that you were seated outside. I said, I received a confirmation call, but no one said anything about our seating arrangements. They said to give them a minute, and they did end up seating us inside.  It wasn't a big deal from what I could tell, but they made it their drama. Ok, so the real review... Yes, Yes, YES! The pozole soup was delicious. My husband had the duck empanada, which was too big to be an appetizer - tasty, but too much food. My meal was scallops perfectly prepared and pleasingly presented. My husband had the pork shoulder - tender and well seasoned. The white bean puree that came with the pork was really a treat.  We were too full for dessert, but the mojitos during our meal made up for the absence. Our waitress helped make our mea fun and pleasant - she knew the menu, could answer our questions and made good suggestions.

I really wanted to love you. The guacamole and soup we started with, and the cocktails were amazing. But when we got the mahi mahi tacos and mine had a big, long, black hair in it I almost vomited at the bar. Beware!

Sexy mexy! This what I discovered at The Mission. I almost didn't notice my delicious eats as I was distracted by the warm, stylish interior. This is definitely a place to take that certain someone you're trying to impress. 

After gorging myself on fresh, hot chips, salsa and table side guac, I was amazed I had room for anything else. The only thing I personally didn't adore was the corn. I wanted it a little more grilled and a little less sauced. Maybe I am just not a fan of the cheese/corn combo, but when the tacos hit the table, I was magically hungry again. The corn tortillas were hot and soft, just as they should be. Every taco was easy on the taste buds, but I think my favorite was the fish-- delish! The milkshake and mini-churro finished the meal with sweet success.

Would love to go back and dine on the patio!

Not what I expected. Especially after all the hype. I ate nothing that I could not have prepared at home for a fraction of the price. Dark, noisy: noise due to music too loud & people talking louder to be heard. Quite the din, because it is a small space. 

Needed my phone flashlight to see the menu. Too dark is not for me. This does nothing for the ambience and gives me a feeling that there is something to hide. Perhaps $12 guacamole. That's one expensive avocado! 

I only ordered a salad and the "tacos". Mahi mahi that was mehi meh. The only peeps at my table who ordered entrees, were my two brothers. Meat eaters. They said their chorizo whateveritwas was good. Nothing on the plate as a side. I guess I just don't get it. Rent must be really high, and of course it is a "cool" location. So now I've tried it, but it was completely unmemorable. 

If you like to sit in the dark, eat expensive and just "ok" food because you're a Scottsdale hipster, then this is the place for you. I was just pleased to have exited the loud "tomb" when all was said & done. It's just no big deal.

Riding around Old Town today I couldn't choose which new restaurant to try, Metro, Digistif, or The Mission. Glad I chose The Mission.

This restaurant is beautiful inside, with the beautiful chandeliers everywhere. They have great hardwood floors and travertine throughout, and a beautiful bar. There were no mistakes made in the design of this restaurant. 

The food is expeptional, and they call it a modern latin american. A mix of Peruvian, Ecudorian, Brazilian, etc. I ordered the pork shoulder tacos, and while incredibly small for $14 they were the best tasting tacos I have had in a long time, and definitely on the unique side. They serve you three of them and they are about 2 inches across... very small corn tortillas. I want to try something else next time for a bigger meal.

The service was perfect, however I was the only one in the restaurant. This is my new favorite lunch spot in Old Town. They need to either lower the prices or up the portions for it to be a 5 though.

This place is amazing, one of the best dinners of 2015 thus far. We made a reservation on the word of our local friends and went in hungry for everything. The entire meal was on point, as well as the tequila flights we sipped throughout. The pork belly appetizer will be in my dreams until my next trip. We tried nearly everything and loved it all. Thanks for the memories to the whole crew at the mission-- you all rock!!

YES! My best friend took me for my birthday and it was DELICIOUS!  The service was FANTASTIC!  The atmosphere was WONDERFUL! It is robust, but you still can hear each other and have a conversation. The food was FANTASTIC!  I would have preferred more veggies or side dishes but the good was SUPERB! Thanks for the sipping Tequila on the house for my birthday! There was an offensive couple with 2 other women outside the restaurant asking us if we were a car service. Hmmmm? Did we look like we were a car service while eating our meal inside the restaurant?  Clearly, they are drunks. :)

The food has always been great and their strawberry coconut mojitos are one of my favorite drinks.  Our only complaint is they have messed up our reservations a couple of times so we had to cancel or wait (and the wait can be very long.)  My husband lacks the patience that I have but since we both enjoy the food, I keep prodding him to go back again.  Any time we've had an issue, the staff are apologetic and do try their best to make up for it.  The atmosphere is very nice; I really love the steak tacos and pumpkin bread pudding (amazing!)

The best pazole in town! A beautiful and romantic-chic atmosphere, delish guacamole made at your table and a variety of beer, wine and tequila as well as mixed drinks to choose from. Me and my friends love going here!

Great little latin place..

The pozole is excellent, highly recommend it, as is the table-side made guacamole (even though that's a little gimmicky and it took forever to get). 

The flat iron was very well cooked and really flavorful, paired perfectly with the charred leaks and little tomatilla salad but the portion was very small.

I'd come back if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

LOVE this place. The food is magnificent. Every time we have an out of town guest we take them to Mission.  We have been for dinner many times and for brunch. Amazing menu. Love the table side guacamole...and every entrée we have tried.  You have to make a reservation.

I tried really hard to like this place, but in the end, no different than a Cantina Laredo. Table side guacamole was average compared to other places ( La Grande Orange has the best). Skirt steak tacos were good but were so heavy there is a reason why they only give you three quarter sized ones. Dessert was the most disappointing. The churros were soggy and the milkshake that came with it was terrible.

YUM.

When I think about the Mission, a smile spreads across my face.  The place is great from top-to-bottom.

Stunning menu with high-end meals, to upscale street food.  The Corn on a stick is spicy, sweet and absolutely amazing.

Great for groups, wonderful patio, amazing brunch.  I have never had a bad experience here.  Waitstaff is extremely friendly and attentive.

Portion size is also very good and the drinks are a great topper with their extensive tequila list.

Overall great date spot, team event of just a lazy Saturday lunch.

I just had one of the best meals ever.  I cannot comment on the entire menu but the chorizo stuffed pork shoulder is so good!  My friend sitting across from me said that he's never seen anyone happier.  Great place with atmosphere. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

Food taste was great but disappointed in the serving size and server.  Came here with three friends and sat outside.  At the same time we got our chips and salsa, another guy asked if wanted some guacamole.  We looked at each other and said sure.  We thought it was part of the chips and salsa.  When we got the bill they charged us $12.  We all thought they were a little deceptive in how that transaction worked.  Each of us ordered a different taco.  All tasted great BUT in my case the short rib taco had a tiny nugget of meat on it.  I guess when they smoked it for 12 hours it shrunk to nothing.  It was a small taco to begin with but it was stacked high with the garnish.  I would have like more meat on it.  Yah it is probably a cool place to go but next time I would rather go somewhere where the taco's are more substantial.  For what we got it was pricey.
The service was scatterbrained and the food was good but the timing was a mess.  It's really hit or miss with this place.

I was looking forward to visiting the Mission for a long time.  Finally, I made it last Friday just in time for happy hour. The patio was crowded but not quite full.  The hostess was reluctant to sit us on the patio, perhaps because we mentioned we may not be ordering dinner. That is fair, I can understand keeping the premium sitting open for larger parties or people certain to order entrees. So we took at seat at the bar. The place looked really nice and I was impressed by the selection of premium booze behind the bar.  Unfortunately we never got a chance to experience The Mission. After sitting at the bar for somewhere between 5 and 10 Mins we were yet to be acknowledged.  All the while staff is busy swirling around us. So when we decided that the Mission did not want our patronage, we got up and left after never being spoken too.  Then the hostess who sat us at the bar just 10 mins prior gave us a big smile as we left and said, "Come back again".  Not likely friend. I guess my money is not good enough for The Misson. I give it two stars simply because everyone else's plate looked good.

This place was AMAZING.

Amazing atmosphere, decor, food, and service. 

There were eight of us, and each one of us loved everything we got. To start, the chips and salsa were addicting. We couldn't stop. I got tacos with a side of corn - also amazing. Portions seemed small, but nonetheless we were stuffed!

We sat outside, and a few of us, including the bride-to-be, got pooped on, but I think everything trumped that one uncontrollable mishap. That's how great everything was.

The server also brought us a round of fancy tequila to celebrate the bachelorette party. Super nice of him, even prior to getting pooped on!

I will definitely be back every time I am in Scottsdale.

Swanky ambiance, pretty waitresses and the place was packed. That's usually a good sign. Unfortunately the best part of the meal was the nachos at Bootleggers down the block while waiting for our table. The food at the mission did not come together for any of us. I had the duck confit with mole .... It was weird. More like fried chicken with overly sweet plum sauce. The meals were a little too all over the place for my liking. Drinks were ok. Very overrated and underwhelming. "Broken plate concepts" for sure...

This place was AMAZING.  As if the food wasn't fantastic enough, the service was even BETTER!!  Jonathan and Molly waited on us and we were blown away.  Made great recomendations, cocktails were so unique and delicious and the food was fabulous.  I would highly recommend!!!

Having heard Phoenix dining doesn't often extend past 10pm I was admittedly surprised by the people waiting out the door but judging from the number of halter-tops and guys wearing sun glasses at night I quickly realized that The Mission was not all about "dining" after all and on my new friend's arrival we exchanged greetings and made our way through the crowd, across the patio, and into the dimly lit room.  Setting prejudices aside and deciding to let the food do the talking I was pleasantly surprised.  Full review with pictures is in my blog, highlight dishes are below:

With the kitchen moving surprisingly quickly despite (or perhaps because of) the late hour it would be perhaps fifteen minutes before our first course of the evening would arrive and although something I'd not have traditionally ordered the Almejas Al Vapor would prove to be well worth its "best in the valley" designation.  Described as Peruvian in origin and served in a large low-bowl along with dense "pan de yucca" bread with a good sponge for dipping this complex amalgam of spicy aji Amarillo chile powder, tender clam stew, rock shrimp, chorizo, roast corn, basil, garlic, and turmeric was everything its ingredients suggested and then some - hot and spicy, smoky and garlicky, sweet but saline, and all the while complex without being overwhelming.  While I personally could have stood for just a bit less salt and a touch more sweet to temper the spice this was a small quibble balanced nicely by the sweet rolls.

For the second of this round of appetizers my favorite plate of the meal would be presented as "Duck Carnitas Empanada," an invariably upscale take on the traditional empanada with a golden flaky shell harboring orange glazed duck confit and an admixture of habaneros, mushrooms, cilantro, and queso Oaxaca.  Delectable on its own but certainly open to further adornment the empanada was subsequently topped with a chunk of seared foie gras and finally with a foie fortified queso Oaxaca pan sauce and a drizzle of tamarind oil with the end result sweet, savory, and totally decadent.

Left with a bit more time to digest and a lot less noise as the restaurant's population had literally dwindled by half a mere forty-five minutes after we were seated the final savory of the evening would arrive just after 11pm and as I was doing the ordering it just so happened to be a second round of my favorite fowl, this time the "Green Chile Duck Confit."  Ample in portion and more so in flavor this pile of two legs and two thighs featured a whole lot of duck for the dollar but unfortunately was just a bit less crispy than one would have hoped - a small quibble as it was not greasy, but not "textbook" confit by any means.  Again spicy without being "hot" the duck subsequently topped with sultana serrano peanut mole and paired on the plate with savory "cheesy fried hominy" that tasted something like a cross between popcorn and corn nuts plus smoked mushrooms to help ground the rest of the flavors.

For dessert The Mission's Pumpkin Bread Pudding with Scotch, Caramel, Pepitas, Pomeganate, and Chipotle seasonings was quite outstanding.  Beginning first with the pudding, almost a steamed sticky pudding in texture, the flavor of the pumpkin, cinnamon, and clove was present in spades and the scotch tones blended nicely with the sweet caramel giving it all a heavy handed boozy bite.  With a touch of spice from the chipotle cooled by quickly melting dulce de leche ice cream I additionally found a lot of appeal in the pumpkin seeds and pomegranate with their respective salty and sweet crunch adding some texture.

A modest tab, particularly when split, we opted to divide the bill down the middle and with that we made our way to the streets where, as I'd been told, few people were to be found at 11:30pm even on a Saturday.  Saying our goodbyes I made my way to my car satisfied with my meal at the Mission and realizing that perhaps my bias against "scene restaurants" was a bit unfounded, much like my preconceptions about "Southwest cuisine" - a fitting conclusion to my first trip to Arizona and a bit of reassurance that I could undoubtedly live here.  Sure the city shuts down early but to be completely honest by the time we left The Mission it was already nearly 2 hours after my typical bedtime anyway.

This was our second trip to the Mission. We were here in February 2010 and were wow-ed by the great service and the fantastic guacamole the first time around. We made a point to go back this time and were equally wow-ed. We went for a late afternoon lunch and we had the table-side-prepared guacamole. I had the chicken tacos and my friend had the steak tacos. These were small but, as it turns out, a perfect portion to accompany the pile of guacamole we snarfed. Despite the small size of the tacos they were quite flavorful and, again, plenty of food for an afternoon lunch.

Just come here!  This place OOZES sexy!  I am sure it will be 5 stars when I eat a full meal... but for now the ambiance, fresh made guacamole, champagne and SEXY environment has me wanting more!  Great patios, service, people and ALWAYS packed.  Reservations required unless you want to be smashed at the bar... I don't mind it's worth the visit!  LOVE this place and on my list of ideal romantic dinner places!

I expected the other people in my party to be raving about the eats and drinks we devoured. Apparently, however, our server was the most appetizing element of the entire evening, because that's all they talked about. 

I'll admit, even I took a second glance at the clean-shaven stud that took especially careful care of the ladies... and gents, in our group. Dude delivered the goods in style. But, gee, I must've been the only one who was thinking about the meat inside the folds of those tacos after we left. Seriously flavorful delights, folks. Dine on the swine, for sure, it simply knocks the other land-based meats, chicken and steak, out of the water. This goes for the domestic style corn wraps and the crunchy lettuce wraps, equally. Artistically rendered and inspired plates abound at the Mission. And I'll drop a big thumbs up for the kale salad, I thought it was fabulous; this admission surely wins me Metrosexual points, yes? 

Finally, the drinks. As a general rule, the further you wander from the familiar path, here, the better. While everyone was quite comforted by the house specialty margarita (and it was tasty), I found much more complexity and delight in the unusual options on the menu. Top it all off with a sitting on the lovely patio, and your Mission, should you choose to accept it, is impeccable.

Came in for lunch & drinks while on vacation and instantly fell in love with the decor and ambiance, what a great place.

Our second love was the guac - seriously...the BEST I have ever had. If there was guac in heaven, this would be it. So freaking good.

Both the hus and I opted for different tacos, all of which were delish & the service was great. Definitely a great spot for lunch and I imagine and even better place for dinner & bar atmosphere.

This is my absolute favorite place to eat. If you go here you must get the table side guacamole it is the best you will ever have and is also fun to watch them make it right at your table. I love the chicken tacos, as well as the pork, but the butternut squash tacos also are amazing if you want something vegetarian. They have the best margaritas in town, great atmosphere, always awesome service. Make sure you make a reservation as they are always busy!

This is how much we liked The Mission:  2 dinners, 1 lunch and 1 time for drinks and apps out of 5 days that we were in Scottsdale.  Weather was perfect and we sat in the patio.  Get the guacamole!  We ordered the kale salad, spinach salad, fish tacos, Crispy Cola Pork, Pork Belly Pibil, Pork Shoulder tacos, Pumpkin Bread Pudding and the Primarita Margaritas.  Lots of Primarita Margaritas!  Guess you could say we got addicted, so much so we made it our last stop before heading to Sky Harbor to fly home.

Ask for Adam's special guacamole and make sure you tip him.  Hot and tasty. It will make your night like it made ours. 

One of the ladies said he was a cutie. 

As for the food... The guacamole is a must. House Margarita is spot on. 

Lamb ribs and pork shoulder tacos are heaven.

A must whenever I'm in Scottsdale. I almost always let the waiter bring me whatever they recommend. I honestly don't think I've looked at the menu here for more than a minute or two. Margaritas are amazing and the real deal.

The locals of the area took us here to The Mission, right in the cute downtown area of Scottsdale. It's very trendy Mexican food - lights are dim, music is playing loudly, and everyone is super dressed up and ready to have a good time. We ordered
- Pork Belly: decent. The coolest thing about this dish though, is the fact that the tortilla was served on this giant brick of clear salt - super cool.
- Salsa: SPICY and tasty
- Guacamole: THE BEST GUAC I HAVE EVER HAD! It was made right next to the table after you order it. It has pumpkin seeds, and I don't know what kind of crack, but i could not stop eating it.

And for entree, I had
- Hangar Steak with house margarita, which were just okay. Apparently the steak taco is supposed to be very good, maybe i should have ordered that instead.

This place is seriously super trendy filled with dressed up people. Nice for a great evening out.

Phenomenal food.  The tacos are delicious - we had them all.  Their Mission margarita is a home run.  So much so the hostess was drinking one when we arrived at the check in table (yes, hilarious and so, so unprofessional and likely breaks laws). 

I'd go again any day, but definitely not when trying to impress someone with waitstaff - bottom of bunch.

Very disappointing. Margaritas were very good and service was fine. But the food?  Overpriced and not good. We started with the duck confit empanadas.  The filling was nice but the sauce was way too sweet and then there was the crust.  You needed a steak knife to cut the thing!  We ordered the pulled pork tacos for two dinner (32.00).  It took quite a while and when it came the tortillas were very small and extremely doughy.  The pork was fatty and just not very good.  

On top of everything else, it is very dark so it's hard to see what you are eating.  I used my iPhone flashlight app so we could read the menus.  

Really wanted to like the place but the quality was not there.  Definitely would never go back.  One start is for service and the other is for the drinks.  That's it.
I hope I have the right location. Cat and Shawn Made are day. we would not have stayed if they hadn't been so nice!!!!!!! FOOD AMAZING!!! Thank You!!! See you next year!

The food and drinks here are amazing. I had the mango and jicama salad to start with and the steak tacos for lunch.  The primarita margarita was delicious too. The tortillas are fantastic as was the beef.  I want to come back on my next trip out to Arizona, this place was wonderful and so was the service. Loved the hostess that is a student at ASU, she is lovely.... great place!!!
Fun, lively and fresh. Definitely recommended! We like the back garden area best. Inside is nicely designed but darker and louder.

Great food BUT DO NOT let them seat you on back patio. Totally different vibe and last Saturday they had more flies on patio than a taco truck in Nogales! Waitress and Manager offered NO solutions....beware!

Enjoyed a Sunday Valentine's Day brunch at The Mission.  We enjoyed the skirt steak with egg, red chilaquiles, roasted poblano grits, and the espresso churros with a chocolate milkshake. Just a great experience in food with great service.  We had an 11:00 am reservation and we were seated right away.  Will go back for dinner!

The atmosphere is very "Scottsdale" and upper-class. I would suggest wearing formal-casual attire at the minimum, but that is just my opinion. The food was pretty good, the the price was not commensurate with the quality. You are paying a high price for the atmosphere, and that it about it.

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. It is so amazing! I love the ambiance, the interior decor style, the food and the service is always great. This is the only place that makes me miss eating chicken as the chicken taco's are so fantastic. I've been a full vegetarian for a few years now though and let me tell you, there butternut squash tacos are so delicious, so make sure to order them. My favorite thing there is the table side guacamole! I love the guys that come over and make it for you (don't forget to tip them, it's the nice thing to do) and they make some bomb guacamole. I brought my parents there and my dad typically hates guacamole but he tried the table side guac here and he ended up eating the whole bowl! 

The restaurant is always busy, which is always a good sign. So, be sure to make a reservation. If you didn't make one, don't worry, just walk-in because there's usually room in the bar or somewhere on one of the two patios.

Started w/the table side guacamole (spicy & all the trimmings) delish and I definitely recommend it as a starter!! I ordered the park shoulder tacos, omg!! So tasty! The are mini tacos (3), filled me up, I could only eat one! The bar tender Par, was very knowledgeable, did an awesome job w/me as, I have never been here before but was helpful and I appreciated that. He has a great personality and ended up making me the cucumber jalapeño margarita which is another recommendation! If I get a chance during my stay, I will be coming back!
Favorite Restaurant! I come here for date night, birthdays, anything! The steak tacos and street corn are great and the cucumber jalapeño margarita is one of a kind!

Very nice clean restaurant.  Staff was very friendly and helped me navigate their menu which I perceived to be complicated by the fact that they call it a Brunch.  Once we established that it was not really a brunch but rather an all you can eat taco bar the mud cleared quickly.  I ended up ordering the Cubano sandwich.  It was very tasty and the horseradish brought the whole sandwich together quite well.  Dessert was excellent we had the pumping pudding.

The food was tasty but VERY overpriced. My sister ordered a margarita and they charged her $13.00 !!! Looking at the drink menu the next day on line they charged her for some ORGANIC margarita!! Really ??
She never even mentioned anything about organic anything ! The regular margaritas are 8 bucks !!! They saw us coming !

Ok food, ok service, ok drinks. Not impressed but it's good.

Most stuff I like in this place I can get of slightly lower quality at Baja Fresh.

The decor is nice. If you're into churchy stuff.

Service can really lag on busy nights.

Went there for appetizers on 3/19/11. Good service but the food was lacking. The tableside guac was basically a mashed up avacado with little flavor as were the two skewers of oversalted chicken. The shrimp was salty too. Felt the food was overpriced and lacked the blend of spices found in good Latin food. Paying for the ambiance and Scottsdale location.

This place is doing something right for sure!  I have been here for breakkfast, lunch and dinner...I have also been here for a last minute bday dinner and for night caps that have turned into a bit more than that....thank you Brian and Terry!  These guys can turn the joint inside out everynow and again....if you catch them on one of these evenings your bound to have a drink or two poured in your direction.

This place is quiet eclectic if you walk around for a look see....There is a  piece of framed art in the far back corner that Brian's  (an owner) mother painted. There is a round table with claw legs under a chandelier that came from Brians mom's house and I would guess once stood at the base of double spiral staircase in the foyer of a large plantation-like home.  The candles,chandeliers, communal table, outside fireplace and courtyard make for great ambiance...

The Mission has not let me down yet....The food, be it breakfast lunch or dinner has always been as friendly as the staff and as eclectic as the ambiance.  Kobi Beef hot dog wrapped in bacon with beans on the side.  
Halibut tacos.  There is a dish (cant recall what its called) that has peanut butter in it...OBVIOUSLY do not order if you have allergic reactions to peanut butter....but, let me tell you, if you're kool with p-but, order this dish!!!  O, you also have to like pork.

Afterwards if ur feeling guilty for all the extravagant food and drink, u can always walk on into church and confess.....(right next door).

And tell them I sent you....NOT the priest,...tell Brian I sent you and that you want a drink on the house (let him know the power of YELP.

AMAZING!

Wonderful dining area, amazing patios, great location, the most friendly staff with great great service!  

The food was fantastic and the churros rocked!
Very pretty and trendy restaurant. Some food was great, some was good. Definitely nothing life changing about this food but overall enjoyable. Service a bit on the slow side. Solid drinks.

How did I forget this?

This place just rocks all the way around. Even with their overpriced drinks and retarded wait times. 

Just go.

Get the Guac and the Porkbelly 

Oscar the Grouch used to be orange. Jim Henson decided to make him green before the second season of Sesame Street. 

Did you know that? No. You didn't. This has officially been the most helpful review you have ever read. You're welcome.

Wonderful food! Love coming here for my birthday every year! I eat beans every at every restaurant I go to and by far The Mission has the best. Great food, great service, wonderful decor and atmosphere!

Wow, what an incredible ambiance. I loved the vibe...the setting was so surreal with salt lights and an inviting yet pretty atmosphere with a South American flair. Our server was kind of a genius on the topic of South American/Peruvian food. I was impressed. The margaritas were fantastic and the food was interesting, unique and flavorful. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Thank you Jamie McDonald!!!! The food & service was outstanding!!! 
Abeer was superb!!!
Visiting here from Loveland, CO for the 1st time & this dining experience will be a memorable one!!

Loved the atmosphere and the table side guacamole!  The wait was a pain although it was a Friday night so i was asking for it! Service was great despite how busy they were! Definitely recommend! Will return soon!
this place was worth the trip and is located in the old town Scottsdale:)) beautiful and food was delicious too.

Excellent food, terrible service. Going out to dinner should be an experience. A dining one. Not an eating one. If I wanted to dash in and out, I would go to McDonald's. The servers here seem to be under a lot of pressure to maximize turnover. We made it explicitly clear to our server that we would be laddering our courses. He not only seemed annoyed, but still popped by every few minutes to see if we "knew what we wanted yet". While the food and ambiance were top notch, we didn't enjoy the evening because we were made to feel rushed. There are plenty more wonderful restaurants to choose from in Scottsdale.

They try too hard with the decor... crazy big chandeliers??? the menu is ok... we sat at the bar for a few apps and some drinks but the bartender was so miserable that he made our time there uncomfortable... he wasn't friendly... he didn't make any conversation... we had some questions about the menu but he was to apathetic to help us... overall food was decent but the service could use some fine tuning...

HOLY CRAP! 

This place is insane! The Sweet Corn appetizer was just like some that I had tasted at a Fell's Point festival. (I confess to going home and making some because I was so inspired) The scallop tacos were also served in heavy and delicious portions. 

To top it all off, the red sangria was singing to me by the end of the night. 

Awesome rustic chic decor. A must go in Scottsdale for a fun night out with the girls.
Great food, wonderful service!  Abeer was an awesome server. She made wonderful recommendations!

The Mission is a well-rounded establishment. The drinks are on point, the service is exceptional and the food - oh my god. My fiance is a vegetarian and she LOVES coming here, they always have amazing options for her. 

I always go for the pork. It practically melts in your mouth. You never need a knife. And all of the flavors blend together perfectly. Oh, and definitely get the table side guac - just don't fill up on it!

This is the first "Mission" we went to. They were fantastic. The room was a tad dark, but the food was great. We ate at the bar, the server was quick, the corn off the cob was amazing. The street talks are still my favorite item. They have opened up another Mission closer to us, so we go to that one a lot. The food is great! We go for Sunday brunch/lunch and for dinner. Strongly recommend going.

I can't justify paying $50 for Mexican food.  I came here for a date.  The restaurant was really dark.  I could barely see my date.  I could barely see my date when I was sitting AT the table LOL.  The fresh guacamole was great.  We each had an entree and shared a bottle of wine.  At any other restaurant, I wouldn't have mind so much.  But $50 for Mexican food.  I won't be going back.

This was our third attempt to get a table at The Mission. The first two times we tried to get a table the wait was over an hour. This time we put our names down and went to another bar for drinks first. Food was very impressive. You must try the grilled street corn, Almejas Al Vapor, Pork Belly Pibil and the tableside guac!! The only item that I wasn't overly impressed with was the Duck Confit. But Overall worth the wait.

The Mission is one of my favorite restaurants!  I LOVE the food!!!!

I have been here several times and have never had a bad experience. I have had almost everything on the menu and never been disappointed.  How does one go wrong with the atmosphere/decor, friendly staff and last but not least the best food. 

Must haves: Prima rita, table side guacamole, steak tacos (my fav!!!), bread pudding:) 

If you are looking for a great atmosphere, fun night, date night , or just a place with flavor...look no further!! I recommend this place!!! If only there were more places like this....

Love for the mission!!!
Excellent quality but perhaps a bit pricey and the portions are  tiny. Nice setting though and service was outstanding. Would definitely go back just for the tableside guacamole.

We came for Christmas Eve and had a spectacular meal. The service was attentive but relaxed. We were not rushed through our meal as the other reviews indicated.  We would highly recommend the guacamole by the table and the glazed pork belly appetizer.   Margaritas were delicious.   A wow experience. I wish we lived around here so we could experience it again.

The food and drinks here are amazing! 5 stars for sure! I have to deduct a point for service though, the last 2 times we dined here, it seemed to take forever to get drinks, and the servers aren't very good at explaining dishes, nor are they personable. 

The cucumber Jalapeño margorita is one of my favorite drinks around. 
We always start with the guacamole (make sure you order it spicy, its really not that hot) and it never fails us. For entrees, my gf always gets the tecate steak tacos and they are fantastic. last time i had the pork shoulder tacos for two, and wow, were they flavorful. love the street corn here too. I had one of the steak dishes once as well, and I can't say I was disappointed. It was cooked perfect, and full of flavor. 

This is one of our favorite restaurants for the time being, i just wish the service was a little better.
Unfortunately not a good night. Bad service. Waited 25 minutes for our drinks and another hour for food which tasted good
Very friendly staff, tacos are amazing, Guac and salsa were fantastic.

I didn't quite like this place first of all if you go at night don't forget to bring your flash light with you cause it's dark in there. The food is common regular nothing that measures up to the price they're changing. The place looks fancy but if you really look it's in bad condition needs to be renovated so the darkness is to hide all the flows I suppose.
The service ways lovely! We enjoyed the hip atmosphere. Is a great time for a lively dinner!
Went here on a date and enjoyed all of the food and the margaritas were delicious! Definitely would go back.

(4.5) I came to The Mission with my dad and the ambiance, food and service were everything my dad hyped them up to be. The southwest, adobe style decor is so beautiful and authentic.
